loans.name: Faasalafa

texts.en:
Faasalafa is a thirty-eight-year-old mother from the village of Satapuala. She is an old member of our programme and this is her second loan.

Faasalafa makes and sells pork buns as her business. She sells them at the village primary school and she also supplies her pork buns to shops on the Mulifanua wharf.

She sells five days of the week and she usually gets about $150 a day. This is her second loan and she is looking forward to receiving other loans to help her with home improvement. She is one of our most reliable members and she is still very active.

loans.use: Buy a pot, flour, yeast, and other ingredients for her pork bun business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products and improve the appearance of her store

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudarni

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sudarni is a housewife who is diligently assisting her husband to earn additional income. Her husband, I Gede Suparmita is a trader/ merchant. Ni Ketut Sudarmi raises pigs at her house. With initial capital of IDR 1.2 million (approx of USD 125), she bought 4 piglets which after 4 months can be sold for IDR 800 thousand to IDR 1 million per pig (approx of USD 85 to USD 105/ pig). She feeds her piglets twice a day with wheat and paddy and also with various leaves. The profit that she can earn from this pigs is used to meet her family daily needs and also to finance the education of her two children who are still in kindergarten and 4th grade of primary school. The loan money will be used to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sudarni seorang ibu yang ulet bekerja untuk membantu suaminya, I Gede Suparmita, yang berprofesi sebagai Pedagang. Ni Ketut Sudarni juga memelihara babi dirumahnya yaitu babi penggemukan. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.200.000.- Ni Ketut Sudarni membeli 4 ekor bibit babi setelah dipelihara selama 4 bulan, babi-babinya siap dijual dengan harga perekor dari Rp. 800.000.- sampai dengan Rp.1.000.000.- Ni Ketut Sudarni memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari. Disamping dedak padi dan juga dedak gandum, Ni Ketut Sudarni juga memberikan makanan tambahan seperti daun talas, daun pisang dan batang pisang. Keuntungan yang didapat dari pemeliharaan babi ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga dan juga untuk pendidikan kedua anaknya yang duduk dikelas 4 SD dan TK. Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Ni Ketut Sudarni akan membeli beberapa ekor bibit babi lagi dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is thirty five years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. She has been selling frozen fish and meat in Obuasi for six years now. She has not been able to buy more frozen products due to low working capital.

Afia wants to use this loan to buy more frozen products, like fish and meat, to increase her stock. She has been educated by Sinapi to save some money from her profits in order to take care of her children.

Afia is member of the group called “Papa Ye” (meaning Goodness). The members of the group guarantee for each other in repaying the loan.

Afia is the person pictured above wearing a pink dress. Beside her is her sister Janet.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen products, like fish and meat

loans.name: Nikutusia's Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Nikutusia is 28 years old and is single. She owns a small general store which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members: Furaha, Rose and Mary. They have businesses dealing with tailoring, food vending and charcoal sales.

loans.use: to buy more items for her business

loans.name: Genisis Group

texts.en:
Celsa is a 48 year-old woman who lives with her three children in Luperon, Dominican Republic. When we arrived in Luperon she was behind her house killing chicken to supply the meat for her small restaurant that she runs. Celsa is famous for her Dominican soup, which has big chunks of fresh vegetables, chicken, and spices. She wants to use her loan to buy more food for her “comedor” including rice, live chicken, and vegetables. When Celsa isn’t working or caring for her children, she enjoys going to church and helping out in the community. She hopes that in the future she will have a bigger and nicer restaurant, and that she will be able to help the orphans in Luperon by making them lunch every day.

Thank you to all of the Kiva lenders who will help these entrepreneurs realize a better future!

loans.use: To buy more rice and vegetables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Mrs Nelly belongs to the Communal Bank "Maria Gracia". She lives in the San Martin region, in the Moyobamba province and district, and her business is located in the street jr. callao cuadro 7. Her services are in cosmetology and she has a beauty salon.

Thanks to a loan from Manuela Ramos she was able to renovate her beauty salon which during many years has generated income that has permitted herself to cover the necessities for her family. Her perseverance and dedication has successfully allowed the business to increase considerably.

With the loan she is asking for of S/. 800.00 ($ 275.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she would purchase an armchair, a machine to cut hair, hairspray, scissors and hair dyes of varying colors.

Mrs Nelly is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children. Her business provides work for other persons during times of celebrations and promotions. For now she is supported by one person. Her dream is to be abel to own a spa.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal” MARIA GRACIA”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia Moyobamba, distrito de Moyobamba, su negocio está ubicado en el jr. callao cuadra 7, ella presta sus servicios como cosmetóloga en su salón de belleza. Gracias al préstamo que Manuela Ramos le otorgó pudo renovar su salón de belleza que durante muchos años le genera ingresos que le permiten cubrir necesidades de su familia, la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente. Con el crédito recibido por S/. 800.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará un sillón, una maquina para cortar pelo, cepilladores laca, tijeras, tintes de distintos colores, La señora Nelly tiene 44 años vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su negocio brinda trabajo a otras personas en épocas de fiestas de promociones por ahora cuenta con un personal que le apoya , su meta es llegar a tener su spa.

loans.use: Purchase furniture, tools and hair dyes

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth has sold food in Arusha since 1993. She is 42 years old and single with three children, ages 7, 9, and 14. She works daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm selling food and earns a monthly profit of approximately $60. Elizabeth hopes to take out a loan in order to buy more food supplies for her to sell.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her group member, Bibiana, who also owns a shop in Arusha.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in her food shop.

loans.name: Iris Reyda

texts.es:
Iris is a member of “Banco Comunal Kusikuy”. “Kusikuy” means “be happy” in Quechua. She is married, 43 years old and has 2 children, she processes cereals which she buys from wholesalers and people that bring cereals to her; the processing takes place at her brother’s mill where she pays the minimum production cost, Iris manufactures flour and cracked cereals which are sold to state institutions. She carries out this activity with the help of hired personnel in accordance to orders.

Iris needs a loan of 1800 soles ($625) to be invested in paying the personnel. It is Iris’ dream to expand her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Iris es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua. Iris es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Iris se dedica a procesar cereales, los cereales los adquiere de los mayoristas y también de personas que le llevan, el proceso lo realiza en el molino de su hermano en donde paga los mínimos costos de producción, produce harinas, cereales partidos que provee a instituciones estatales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personales, que contrata de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga.

Iris necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago del personal que trabaja. Lo sueños de Iris son ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Pay hired personnel in order to increase production of flour and cracked cereals.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una persona muy activa y trabajadora; inició el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso extra ya que la pensión que recibe de su esposo no le alcanzaba para cubrir todas las necesidades y además tenía algunas deudas que cubrir. En un inicio se dedicó a vender diversos productos, pero en el 2004 se empezaron a poner de moda los accesorios de bisutería y de esta manera fue como su hija y ella decidieron elaborar pulseras y collares. Les fue muy bien y posteriormente empezaron a vender productos de belleza y hasta ahora han podido salir adelante. Hace 2 años le dieron su primer crédito KIVA el cual les ayudó mucho. Habían ido creciendo pero debido a una enfermedad de una hermana a la cual me tocó cuidar y la cual lamentablemente falleció se estancaron un poco, pero sabe que con la ayuda de Dios saldrán adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materiales para la elaboración de pulsera y collares, así como en productos de belleza lo cual le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel is a very active and hardworking person. She started the business because she needed an extra income because the pension that her husband receives wasn't enough to cover all of the needs and besides, she had other debts to cover. In the beginning she worked selling a variety of products but in 2004 costume jewelry started to become popular and because of this she and her daughter decided to make bracelets and necklaces. They did very well and later started to sell beauty products and until now have been successful. Two years ago, Kiva gave them their first loan and it helped a lot. They had been growing but due to the illness of her sister who unfortunately died and her responsibly to care for her, the business slowed down a little but they know that with God's help it will continue to grow. She needs a loan for US$700, which will be repaid in six months, to buy materials needed to make bracelets and necklaces in addition to beauty products and that will help them increase their sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Elizabeth O.  M. pertenece al Banco Comunal JERID Camino al Éxito II, también es socia del Club de Madres Purísima Concepción,  tiene 49 años y vive en la calle Espelucín manzana 2 lote 3  del pueblo joven Aurora Díaz del distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Terminó su secundaria pero no continuó estudiando porque se casó con el señor Moisés Mejía Sarachaga con quien tiene 5 hijos y dependen de ella 3, que son estudiantes.
Empezó su negocio vendiendo plástico en el mercado, pero conoció a Credimujer y se animó a cambiar de negocio, porque se capitalizó entonces empezó a hacer negocio con redes de pesca.
Su negocio se ubica en su casa. Recuerda que el primer préstamo que le dieron fue de 300 soles para devolverlos en 4 meses y los invirtió en comprar redes de pesca.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará más redes para ser trabajadas en pesca.
Sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ms. Elizabeth O. M. is a member of the "JERID Camino al Exito II" Communal Bank (Path to Success), and is a partner of the Mother’s Club “Purísima Concepción” (Immaculate Conception). She is 49 years old and lives in the Especlucin Street, in the town Joven Urora Diaz of the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo and department La Libertad de Peru. She finished junior high school but did not continue studying since she married with Mr. Moses Mejia Sarachaga with whom he has 5 children, 3 of which are direct dependants and students. She started her business selling plastic in the market, but got to know of Credimujer and decided to switch businesses, by gaining access to capital and get into the business of fishing nets. Her business is located in her home. She remembers the first loan for 300 Soles which she paid back in 4 months, and invested it in purchasing fishing nets. With this credit of 800 Soles, which she'll pay back in 6 months, she will buy more nets for fishing. She dreams with her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lopez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fishing nets

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.en: Mrs A. Akouwa is an  expert in selling  charcoal . She  has  other  women working with her  as a  staff. Her staff  members are  Batchassi Pierrette, A. Akouwa and Passai Celestine, who is standing with her in the picture.  Her staff members  are  also specialized in  the charcoal business. Mrs A. Akouwa is requesting a loan of 900 dollars to buy  more charcoal  which  are made from dead  wood  so that they  can  bring   them in  the cities like Lome, Anie, and Aneho  to sell to the  women  who have restaurants  and food shops.  As Christmas and  New Year   are coming,  women  will need  charcoal to prepare their food  for  business and   for family  needs.   Because the market is flourishing  at this time of the year, she is sure that she could sell and make  more profit at the end of this year  and  continue the business throughout the next year.  She said she will use half of the profit of each month for her family's basic needs (food, particularly) and the other half to pay back the loan. Thank you for supporting  her small business.

loans.use: Charcoal  and sell it  in Lome, and other  cities

loans.name: Aslon

texts.en:
Aslon A. is 27 years old. He is married with 3 adorable children. Aslon has always opted to make his life in his homeland, to work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear sheep and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time, as he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background. Today he wishes to increase the number of his animals with the hope of increasing his income and improving the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1,200) for the term of 12 months. Your solidarity will help Aslon move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep for improving his living conditions

loans.name: El Carmenn Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO EL CARMENN  ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA ROSEMARY QUIEN ES MIEMBRO DE UN GRUPO CONFORMADO DE 12 SOCIOS (AS) LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMERCIALES COMO  A LA VENTA DE COMIDA, ROPA, POLLO Y ALGUNOS SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMO LA PANADERÍA A LA EDUCACIÓN PÚBLICA Y AL SERVICIO DE COCINA. DENTRO DEL ÁMBITO COMERCIAL Y DE PRESTACIÓN DE SERVICIOS EXISTE UNA GRAN COMPETENCIA PERO LA EXPERIENCIA Y EL MOVIMIENTO DE MERCADERÍA HACE QUE LOS (AS) SOCIOS (AS) SALGAN ADELANTE SIN PROBLEMAS. LOS FONDOS OTORGADOS POR LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL ESTÁN DESTINADOS AL INCREMENTO DE MERCADERÍA Y PARA ALGUNOS A LA REPARACIÓN DE SUS MATERIALES DE TRABAJO. DENTRO DEL GRUPO EXISTE GENTE CON EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO DE GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE CONOCEN EL MODO DE TRABAJO DE LA INSTITUCIÓN DEMOSTRANDO EN ANTERIORES GRUPOS RESPONSABILIDAD EN LOS PAGOS, LOS SOCIOS ANTIGUOS SE ENCARGARAN DE IMPULSAR A LOS SOCIOS NUEVOS DEL GRUPO A SEGUIR ADELANTE CON RESPONSABILIDAD Y CUMPLIMIENTO.
texts.en:
The Carmenn Group, which is made up of 12 members, is represented by Rosemery. The members work in different commercial activities such as food sales, clothing sales, chicken sales, and some work at a bakery, a public school, or in a kitchen. Within the commercial and services fields there is a lot of competition but the experience and the movement of the market lets the members get ahead without problems. The funds lent by Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital will be used to buy merchandise and repair work materials. There are some group members who have experience working with supportive groups, so they know how the institutions work and have demonstrated responsible repayment in previous groups. The older members are in charge of motivating the newer members to keep moving forward in their fulfillment of their responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en:
K. Abdumalik is a 41-year-old farmer, who lives with his family, consisting of three children and his wife. He lives in the northern part of Tajikistan, in the Spitamen district of Sugd region. Abdumalik has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Sahib has 10 years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Hiss orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for $800 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Abdumalik is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas en su casa que tanto trabajo le costó adquirir. Desde muy pequeña se dedicó a las ventas, pues estuvo trabajando en múltiples actividades que le enseñaron a desenvolverse como una muy buena comerciante, desde que se casó, hace 5 años, inició su negocio propio junto a su esposo, quien le ayuda en la venta de frutas y jugos. Ambos salen a vender desde las 6 de la mañana en la calle, pues poseen una triciclo que les sirve de movilidad para trasladarse con su negocio a los lugares públicos más concurridos; como hospitales, colegios y mercados, este trayecto les toma todo el día, donde María, junto a su esposo y sus hijas van recorriendo toda su localidad, lo cual es muy fatigado por el calor, pero esta familia no deja de agradecer por tener una oportunidad de trabajo, pues saben que con el tiempo podrán obtener la tiendita o el puesto que desean para vender sus jugos y frutas. María viene trabajando con MFP desde hace un año, este es su segundo crédito, lo que le ha ayudado para comprar su mercadería. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará cajones de frutas, los cuales adquiere en el mercado central de la ciudad, pues los costos son más cómodos.
texts.en:
Maria is 24 and lives with her husband and two children in their home that was very hard for them to get. From a young age she worked in sales, working in several jobs that taught her to be a good businesswoman. When she married 5 years ago, she started a business with her husband, who helps her sell fruit and fruit juice. They both leave the house at 6:00 am on their tricycle, which serves as their means of transportation. They travel around the city selling fruit in the busiest places in the city, like hospitals, high schools and markets. Maria, her husband and their children travel around together the whole day, which is very tiresome due to the heat. However, this family is beyond grateful to have the opportunity to work and they know that in time they will be able to open a small store to sell their juices and fruits from. Maria has been working with MFP for one year and this is her second loan, which will help her buy fruit. She will buy crates of fruit in the downtown market since the prices are more affordable there.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Vianey

texts.es:
Vianey  inició el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado las ventas, desde muy chica vendía Avon, luego se caso y siguío vendiendo actualmente tiene muchas actividades comerciales, ahora hasta una miscelánea. Comenzó el negocio en mayo del 2006 cuando una comadre de su mama la invito a vender por catalogo productos cosmeticos, hace muchos años, después se caso y dejo de hacerlo, pero la volvieron a invitar ahora de forma directa y en este momento es distribuidora.


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 6 catorcenas para  comprar  mercancía, también tiene pendiente un pedido de zapatos que tiene que sacar de la compañía distribuidora para seguir con el comercio.
texts.en:
Vianey started his business given that he always liked selling. Since he was very young he sold Avon. Then he got married and continued to sell. He currently has many commercial activities with a wide variety. She started the business in May 2006, when a friend of her mom invited her to sell cosmetic products through a catalog, many years ago. She then got married and stopped doing it, but she was invited again to do it directly and she is now a ditributor. She needs a loan for MXN $3,000 that she will pay in 6 installments to buy merchandise. She also has a pending order of shoes that she needs to get from the distributing company in order to continue with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou S. is 57 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, where she runs a small restaurant. She normally sells her daily diet to the people of her neighborhood and passers-by across the street. She can make around $15 a day to support her family's needs.

She is a divorced mother of eight children. One of her children is married and lives separately. The others are students who help her with her business when they are not learning. Two of her children are employed in Phnom Penh. The oldest child is a trader and the second is a private teacher.

Because Mrs. S. needs to satisfy her customer's requirements, she would like to ask for a loan to buy necessary ingredients and to improve her workshop.

loans.use: To buy necessary ingredients and to improve her workshop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, pues gracias a su trabajo ayudó a su pareja en la compra de la casa donde viven, junto a su hija y nieto. Al llegar a la capital se dio cuenta de la escasez de productos y los costosos precios con los que vendían, entonces tuvo la idea de traer productos de su tierra tales como: manzanas, ciruelos y diversas variedades de frutas que ella misma produce en sus terrenos de cultivos para así venderlos en la capital. Inicio su actividad como comerciante hace 15 años y la experiencia que tiene la ayuda a invertir su dinero en negocios rentables como la venta de comida, pues junto a las frutas que vende en el mercado, empezó a vender tamales. Con el tiempo espera juntar el capital suficiente para abrir una tienda en su casa donde venda los productos que produce y deje de salir a las calles. Gloria trabaja con MFP hace 5 años, este es su octavo crédito y formar parte un banco comunal donde la motivaron a seguir desarrollándose con responsabilidad y trabajo. Sus terrenos de cultivo requieren de abono y semillas para incrementar su producción y esta es la razón por la que solicita 2800 soles.
texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old and is a very hard working woman. Thanks to her work she helped her partner with the purchase of the house where they live, together with their daughter and grandson. When she first arrived in the capital city, she noticed the scarcity of products and the high prices they were sold at. Then she had the idea to bring products from her own land such as apples, plums, and various varieties of fruits that she herself grows in her cultivated fields, and sell them in the capital. She started this commercial activity 15 years ago and the experience she has helps her to invest her money in profitable businesses like the sale of food since, in addition to the fruits she sells in the market, she began to sell tamales. With time she hopes to get together sufficient capital to open a store in her house where she will sell the products she produces and give up going out to the streets to sell. Gloria has worked with MFP for 5 years. This is her eighth loan. She belongs to a community bank where they motivate her to continue advancing herself through responsibility and work. Her cultivated land requires fertilizer and seeds to increase production and this is the reason she is seeking 2800 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertlizer and seeds for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Mamur

texts.ru: Уразов Мамур-мужчина 46 лет. Женат отец 1 ребенка. Занимается продажей запчастей на рынке Аппон и Булок Аштского района. Мамур также по специальности мастер телемеханик. Мамур закупает товары у оптовиков на рынках Гули Сурх города Истаравшана. Мамур ездить за товаром в месяц один раз. Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2008 года ему нравятся все наши условия поэтому он решил продолжить с нами сотрудничать.
texts.en:
Mamur U. is a 46-year-old man. He is married and the father of one child. Mamur sells spare parts at the Appon and Bulok markets in the district of Asht. Mamur is also a television repairman. He buys items from the wholesalers at the Istaravshan Guli Surh town markets, and travels there once a month to buy goods. He has been a loan client of MicroInvest since 2008. He likes the terms and has decided to continue his collaboration with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare parts

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Silvia Elena Z. F. Z. tiene 35 años, es una madre soltera y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Silvia es una mujer muy emprendedora y siempre le ha gustado el negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de gorras al por mayor. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella decidió hacerse cargo del negocio al fallecer su esposo, porque tenia que sacar a su hijo adelante. Actualmente su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central, decide trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por que los financiamientos le han servido de ayuda para el negocio. es por eso que el dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo ya que ella viaja a otros departamentos para buscar el producto de manera mas favorable.
texts.en:
Silvia Elena Z. F. is 35 years old and a single mother with one child that she supports. Silvia is an entrepreneur woman and has always liked the business arena. Her business is the wholesale of caps and has been doing it for more than 4 years. She decided to take over the business after her husband’s death, because she had to provide for her son. Her business is currently located in the central market.

She decided to work with Fundación Leon 2000 because the funding has helped the business. The loan requested is for working capital since she travels to other states to find better priced merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna O. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high school. Edna sells veterinary drugs at Abotoase near Hohoe, and has done this business for quite some time now. Her husband is a teacher. Edna uses her income to pay for school fees and housekeeping expenses. She will use her loan to purchase more drugs to sell to the farmers to treat their animals. With the new profits from her expanded business, Edna plans to reinvest to enable her meet her financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs to sell to farmers to treat their animals

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Having a husband who works as a soldier is very difficult for Mrs. Flordeliza S. of Barangay Research Minante 1, Cauayan Isabela. Aside from being far from her husband, she solely takes care of her four children, three of whom are attending elementary school. Her youngest child is only three years old. Though she sometimes feels anxious with the nature of her husband’s job, she is really proud of him.

In order for her to help her husband earn a living, she decided to manage a rice retailing business in their village. Moreover, she is also venturing into direct selling of personal collections. At present, she earns PHP1,000 a week. Wanting to increase her income, she thought of borrowing a loan from Kiva for an amount of PHP20,000 pesos. With that loan, she can buy more rice to sell through her retailing business. With her trust in Kiva, she knows that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: To buy more rice

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es: El señor Héctor David Chávez tiene  59 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene tres hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad. El señor Chávez es dueño de una tienda de productos varios ubicada frente a la policía, en la cual ofrece venta de ropa, recargas electrónicas, cabinas telefónicas, servicio de fotocopiadora y además vende calzado. Don Héctor Chávez comenzó su negocio de ventas varias hace ya cuatro años y estaba ubicado el negocio en su casa. Ahora lo traslado hacia frente a la policía con el objetivo de tener un lugar más estratégico de ventas, para  vender más. El crédito será invertido en la compra de más mercancías productos variados, principalmente ropa, calzado y artículos escolares. Su sueño es tener una librería bien surtida para brindarle a su familia lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Mr. Hector David C. is 59 years old, married, and has three children, who are all adults now. Mr. C. is he owner of a general store located in front of a police station, where he sells clothing, electronics, offers phone booths, photocopy service, and also sells shoes. Mr. Hector C. began his sales business four years ago from his home. Now he has moved it to a location in front of the police station with the objective of having a more strategic location for sales in order to sell more. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more general merchandise, principally clothing, shoes, and school supplies. His dream is to have a well supplied bookstore so he can provide all that is necessary for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Juventud Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Juventud” esta representado por la señora Zulma M. y conformado por 12 miembros una mayoría D. los socios se dedican al transporte público D. pasajeros, a la chaparía D. vehículos a la soldadura con arco y oxigeno, entre las mujeres se dedican a la venta D. comida, pollo, masitas, ropa, salteñas y a la atención en cafés Internet. La competencia en el ámbito laboral es elevada ya que muchos D. los negocios bajan sus ventas debido al invierno ya que la mayoría D. las socias posee carritos D. venta D. comida, pero saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y esperando que las ventas mejoren con el retorno D. la primavera. El destino del financiamiento es para la reparación D. sus vehículos así como para la compra D. repuestos y herramientas nuevas para sus negocios D. chaparía y soldadura; en cuanto a las socias el crédito esta destinado a la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos que son el sustento D. sus familias. Su experiencia crediticia es muy buena ya que algunos D. los miembros participaron en grupos anteriores y cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR..
texts.en:
The members of the group “Juventud” (Youth) is led by Sra. Zulma M.. There are a total of 12 members, some of whom are involved in business activities such as public transportation, auto body repair, and welding. The women primarily engage in retail businesses selling food, chickens, pastries, clothing, empanadas, etc. Some members also manage Internet cafés. Competition in the marketplace is fierce and business is down because of the winter season. This is especially true for the members who operate food carts, but they know that they can get ahead through hard work, and eventually sales will improve in the spring.

Some of the members will use their funding to repair vehicles, purchase spare parts, acquire new tools for their businesses, and purchase welding equipment. Other members will invest their loan in goods, supplies, and material that will help them improve their sales and support their families. They have had good experiences with credit since some of the members have participated with other groups and have worked with solidarity loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther H. is from the village of Upper Centro,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old. Esther is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Esther owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Esther has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esther joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Esther is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Esther from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Iris Mercedes

texts.es:
Iris es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Iris es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Iris junto a su esposo tienen un taller de reparaciones y venta de relojes en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad.
Iris necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de relojes y pilas.
Los sueños de Iris son mejorar su terreno y tener un recreo, comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Iris is a member of the Communal Bank “Alianza” (Alliance). She is 53 years old, married, and has 4 children. Iris and her husband have a store, located in the central part of the city, where they repair and sell watches.

Iris needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy watches and batteries. She dreams of making improvements to her land, taking a vacation, and buying a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase watches & batteries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des matériels de coiffure

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr: D. Olga est née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Olga vit à cadjehoun, un quartier de Cotonou, depuis vingt neuf ans. Mariée à HONHONOU Emmanuel un tisserand, Olga est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Olga n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école, mais depuis près de vingt ans, Olga vend de façon ambulante des tissus, des sacs et des savons dans son quartier et au marché. Olga s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Olga a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Pour agrandir son commerce et assurer l'évolution de ses enfants, Olga sollicite à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Olga D'almedia was born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Olga has lived in Cadjehoun, a district in Cotonou, for 29 years. She is married to Emmanuel Honhonou, a weaver, and is mother of two children who are both in school. The couple shares responsibility for the family's expenses. Olga has not yet had the opportunity to go to school, but for nearly 20 years, she has gone door-to-door to sell fabrics, bags, and soap in her district and at the market. Olga buys her supplies in Lomé, Togo, neighboring country of Benin. Olga has already received two loans that she repaid in full to Alidé. She is requesting a third loan through Alidé to increase her business and provide for her children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags, fabrics, and soaps

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. is 36 years old and blessed with one child. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables at the main market in Eldoret town. She joined KADET after learning about it from friends. She has applied for this loan in order to buy more items to sell, including bananas various kinds of vegetables. Her dreams is to succeed at her work, buy some land and build a house.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn C. is from the village of Purok Piape, Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phath

texts.en: Mrs. Phath P. is a villager in Ank village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice on. In her plantation, she faces some problems because her field is far from the irrigation system and it has infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crops. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy a water pump, rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline. She is 43 years old and a widow with a child who is a farmer who helps with the mother’s work.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió primaria completa y tiene su fotocopiadora.
Raquel nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una fotocopiadora.
Su sueño para el futuro es salir adelante y así poder vivir feliz y tranquila.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Raquel has been a partner of the communal bank "Gran Poder" for five years now. She is from the district of Llave, province of El Collao, and department of Puno. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Raquel tells us that with the first loan she solicited from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, of 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. Currently, she is requesting a credit of 3,000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to purchase a photocopier. Her dream for the future is to get ahead and thereby live happily and peacefully. The things that she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with her partners.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mr. Yon K., 62, and his wife, Mrs. Yoeun Soun (both pictured), 61, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1978 and have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, one daughter helps her parents in the business and the other one attends school. Although the couple is old, they are still strong enough to work.

Yon and his wife have been farming for forty-two years. He is asking for his first loan of US$1,200 in order to purchase oxen to assist his farm.

loans.use: To purchase oxen to assist his farm

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly S. currently sells porridge to her nearby villagers for breakfast. She is married with three kids, all of whom attend school and need her care. 

Her husband helps support the family by driving a motorcycle taxi. He is able to generate $5 per day.  Recently his income has been declining due to the fact that his taxi is often broken and is not attractive to the passengers.

To solve the problem, Ly S. is applying for a loan for her husband to hire a repairman to repair his broken taxi. (Mrs. Ly S.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To hire a repairman to repair his broken taxi.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia P. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntualmente y le han ayudado a mejorar su vivienda.
Solo le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder tener su casa terminada. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en el departamento de elaboración.
Ya que es soltera y la única persona que depende económicamente de ella es su mama que es una persona mayor de edad. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la mama de la señora Ignacia P. ya que ella se  encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Ignacia P. has had two previous loans with FVP which she has repaid on time. They were used for home improvements. All she needs still is to finish the interior. She is asking for funding in order to finish her house. She plans to repay the loan with part of her salary working in the assembly area of a factory. She is single and the only person who depends upon her economically is her elderly mother. The person in the photo is Ignacia P.'s mother because Iganacia was at work when the home visit was made.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For interior finishing touches.

loans.name: Okunlola's Group

texts.en:
I. is 44 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos with her family. She is very hardworking and, through her hard work, makes sure she has food on the table every day. 
I. owns a shop where she sells clothes. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more clothes to meet customer demand. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is a business woman. She loves her business because it is highly profitable. She sells dried fish at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for 6 years. She hopes to grow her business. Dried fish in Nigeria is used to prepare mouth watering Nigerian soup like “egusi” (melon soup). She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. She is married with 2 children and she is 39 years old. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. Dorcas says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Porto-Novo la capitale administrative du Bénin, K. Nathalie est mariée à SOUROU Honoré, un marchand. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a près de 17 ans que Nathalie s'est installée au quartier Louho Awanou dans le cinquième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Nathalie vit dans ce quartier avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses charges, Nathalie prépare et vend des bombons, et aussi de la farine de manioc au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. C'est à Ikpinlè et à Ouando que Nathalie s'approvisionne. Nathalie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits dans l'institution, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Nathalie sollicite un quatrième prêt en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande des clients.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. K. Nathalie is married to Mr. SOUROU Honoré, a merchant.  The couple have two children who are both in school.  Nearly seventeen years ago, Nathalie settled in the Louho Awanou quarter in the fifth district of the city of Porto-Novo.  She lives in this quarter with her children and husband.  The couple jointly ensure that their various family expenses are covered.  To cover her expenses, Nathalie makes and sells candy, and also cassava flour, at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo.  She gets her supplies in Ikpinlè and in Ouando.  Nathalie is a previous ALIDé client having already benefited from three loans from the micro-finance institution.  The three loans have all been repaid.  She's requesting a fourth loan for raising her business level and for responding better to customer demands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cassava flour and sugar for making candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Asror

texts.en:
I. Asror is a humble farmer. He is married and has two children. His job as a farmer is the only source of income for his family. He works on a plot of land of 0.8 hectares and he is awaiting harvest season at the moment. The main problem he is facing in farming is lack of capital to enable him to buy high quality seeds and also to buy fertilizer. Therefore Asror is applying for a loan from IMON International. He will use the loan money to buy high quality seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. 

Asror hopes to be able to improve the quality of his harvest by having all of those. With this his revenue will increase and he will be able to finance his children's education to higher level and also to meet his family's daily needs.
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta P. is a 61-year-old married woman who lives in Park 3, Bantayan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by making hollow blocks, being a rice retailer and running a general store.

Violeta’s 67-year-old husband, Wenceslao, helps her with managing the business. They have nine children who are between 20 and 39 years old. Three of their children have their own families, while the other six have their own jobs and help their parents with running the business.

Violeta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in making hollow blocks, rice retailing and her general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Violeta is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 22,000 was used to fund operations for her hollow blocks making, general store and rice retailing, which had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 14th cycle loan, the amount of Php 22,000, which she intends to use on her hollow blocks, rice retailing and general store. Violeta is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, vive en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Huatatas en donde siembran flores, papa, arveja, cuenta con 1 hectárea de terreno, sus ventas los realiza en un mercado cercano a su casa. Además Gloria se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuy, gallina, los cuales son vendidos en los restaurantes. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono para sembrar papa. 
Los sueños de Gloria son educar a sus hijos y sembrar en mayor extensión de terreno.
texts.en:
Gloria along with her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children, 5 of whom are in school. She lives in the community of Santa Rosa de Huatatas where they plant flowers, potatoes, and peas on one hector of land. They sell their harvest at a market close to their house. Furthermore, Gloria raises small animals like Guinea pigs and chickens that she sells to restaurants.

Gloria needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian soles to invest in buying fertilizer to plant potato. Gloria's dream is to educate her children and plant a greater area of land.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer to plant potatoes

loans.name: Ileana Mercedes

texts.es: Ileana Mercedes tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado ser una persona independiente disfruta también tiene que mantener a sus 3 hijos que todavía están a su cargo, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, no es la primera experiencia que tiene con los financiamientos pero se encuentra muy contenta de administrar bien su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y cosméticos. Sueña con volver su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Ileana Mercedes is 38 years old and has been operating a general store for more than two years. She has always wanted to be an independent person and also enjoys supporting her three children who are still under her care. Ileana is always looking for ways to improve her income.

This is not her first experience working with loans and she is very happy that they have helped her manage her business well. This loan will be used to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, and cosmetics. She dreams of converting her store into a distribution center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mil

texts.en:
Mrs. Mil P. is 42 years old and lives in Tuol Svay village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Es Sae, are farmers who own 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land that they use to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

In order to support this farm, Mrs. Mil P. decided to ask for a loan to dig a well and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm crop.

Aside from farming, Mr. Es Sae is also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has six children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a laborer, while the other four are attending the local school and also support their parents’ farming.

loans.use: To dig a well and to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Tiomai

texts.en:
Tiomai S. is 38 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Tiomai has 1 year of experience in this business.  Tiomai needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or ~US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tiomai joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Tiomai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina A. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 60 years old. Cristina is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a bakery. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling bread in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El  Sr. A. Arancibia Ortiz, trabaja para el centro de insumo para la salud el es encargado de traslado de la dirección de Distribución.
Tiene más de diez años de trabajar para esa empresa.
Es padre de familia de dos hijos  y uno de ellos se en cuentran en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que va a cambiar el techo de la casa por que este se encuentra en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasa.
 A. dice que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Arancibia Ortiz is employed by the Health Supplies Center; he is in charge of transport in the Distribution Office. He has worked for this department for over 10 years. He has two children one of whom is still school aged. The requested loan is to buy building materials and supplies because he will replace his roof because it’s in bad shape and during the winter it leaks. A. states that thanks to Ceprodel’s loans he has been able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheeting, lumber, mails and paint.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Issue d’une famille pauvre, Mme A. Akou, née en 1971, a vite abandonné les bancs pour manque de soutien matériel et financier. Elle a hérité ce commerce de vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques de sa mère qui est morte très tôt. C’est une femme de bonne moralité avec trois (03) enfants à charge. Ces produits sont très appréciés par sa clientèle et elle est souvent confrontée à des ruptures de stocks de marchandises. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’acheter les produits en gros et d’en tirer assez de bénéfice. Le profit permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et ainsi mieux assurer l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Issue d’une famille pauvre, Mme A. Akou, née en 1971, a vite abandonné les bancs pour manque de soutien matériel et financier. Elle a hérité ce commerce de vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques de sa mère qui est morte très tôt. C’est une femme de bonne moralité avec trois (03) enfants à charge. Ces produits sont très appréciés par sa clientèle et elle est souvent confrontée à des ruptures de stocks de marchandises. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’acheter les produits en gros et d’en tirer assez de bénéfice. Le profit permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et ainsi mieux assurer l’éducation de leurs enfants.

loans.use: vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 54 years old. Elenita is married and has four school-aged children. She is a fish vendor. She buys directly from the fishermen and sells assorted fish to the market. She also owns a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells a variety of different products. Her store needs to be repaired.

Elenita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Elenita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Phiippine pesos, which will be used to purchase more fish to sell and to repair her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell and to repair her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish, frozen meat, bags of rice, beans, pepper, salt and seasoning.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis C. L., es trabajador activo de Lidya Ludic de Nicaragua desde hace seis  devengando un salario de C$6,000.00 desempeñando el cargo de cajero, el señor C. está muy agradecido con Ceprodel por que ha logrado a mejorar su vivienda. 

Este crédito lo utilizo para compra de Cerámica, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra para terminar la construcción de un Pantry
texts.en:
Mr. José Luis C. L. has been employed as a Cashier at Lidya Ludic de Nicaragua earning a salary of C$6,000.00.  He is very grateful to Ceprodel because he has managed to improve his home.

He used the loan to buy tile, cement and sand and to pay labor costs to finish building a pantry.

loans.use: To buy tile, cement, sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sumeera

texts.en:
Sumeera lives in Lahore, which is the second largest city in Pakistan and famous for its gardens and historic places. People from all over the world visit this beautiful city every year. 

She is a young lady married to L. H., who runs a small restaurant near his home. He offers different kinds of Punjabi food, such as biryani (made with chicken and rice) and Nan chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread and pickles) and tea. He has been in this business for many years and has built a good reputation among his clients due to the quality food and customer service.
  
Sumeera helps her husband prepare food for his restaurant. She also fulfills her responsibilities of a housewife very well.  

Sumeera has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband's restaurant business. With the loan, her husband will buy cooking oil, rice, chickpeas and spices, etc., in bulk. 

Sumeera is hopeful that with the loan, her husband’s business will grow and his income will increase.

loans.use: To buy needed supplies for the restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of thread, fabric, and toys

loans.name: Maritza Asucena

texts.es:
Maritza vive en la zona # 8 en Nueva Guinea con su familia compuesta por 2 niñas y su esposo; ella labora como docente de primaria en la zona Urbana de Nueva Guinea desde hace 10 años, sus hijas actualmente estudian y su esposo trabaja como comerciante de ganado el cual apoya con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos, ya que son una familia bien unida y con mucho deseos de superacion, agradece grandemente el apoyo que ha recibido de Kiva ya que anteriormente fue beneficiada donde aprovechó para construir una habitacion. 

Esta vez solicita su tercer crèdito para invertirlo en compras de materiales de construccion y de esta manera ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda, es una señora muy alegre y muy servicial , ha demostrado puntualidad y capacidad de pago.  

Su mayor sueño en  vida es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y que sus hijas se preparen para que sean personas de bien.  
 Subscribe
texts.en:
Martiza lives in the #8 area in the Nueva Guinea with her family which is made up of 2 girls and her husband. She works as a primary school teacher in the Urban area of Nueva Guinea for some 10 years. Maritza’s daughters attend school and her husband works as a cattle trader and with his earnings they are able to meet the families’ expenses and the obligations that they have since they are a very united family and have many dreams of getting ahead in life. She is grateful for the support she has received from Kiva since she has had loans previously and she was able to build a room.

This is Maritza’s third loan and it will be used to buy construction materials so that they can improve the home little by little. She is a very happy and helpful person, as well as punctual and has shown to be able to meet her payments.

Martiza’s biggest wish to improve her quality of life and that her daughters get an education and be respectable members of society.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Walter Santos

texts.es:
Walter es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el Caserío Santa Clara, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Pítipo, su actividad principal es la agricultura y sus pobladores son gente humilde y bastante trabajadora. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclyo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la producción agrícola. El cría animales menores en su domicilio y adicionalmente siembra cereales y hortalizas. Tanto los animales como la producción de sus cultivos son vendidas en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista) de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades le sirven para ayudar su familia a solventar sus gastos y sacarlos adelante.

Walter desea brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de yuca y pallar que tiene instalados actualmente, para ello ha creído necesario solicitar un crédito de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, los cuales planea invertir en la adquisición de abonos.
texts.en:
Walter is a 41 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in the village of Santa Clara, a rural area located in the Pítipo district.  The main economic activity is agriculture and residents are humble, hardworking people.  The area is located in the Ferreñafe province, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

Walter has worked in agricultural activities for ten years.  He raises small animals at home and he also plants grains and vegetables. He sells both his animals and his crops in the Moshoqueque wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo.  His income from these activities supports his family and helps them to get ahead. 

Walter wants to care for his yucca and lima bean crops which are currently planted.  For this reason he has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will use to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: Care for his yucca and lima bean crops.

loans.name: Carof

texts.en:
Carof M. is 30 years old single man from Kakamega town. He is a capenter and has been doing this business for the past four years. He is currently applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the previous loans. He intends to use the money to buy more timber to add to his stock. Carof earns a monthly income of Kes 11,000.

His desire is to open up a timber yard wholesale in the future.

loans.use: Buy more timber to add to his stock

loans.name: Tsetsegtuya

texts.en:
Tsetsegtuya, 37, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is self-employed.  Both of her children are attending a local secondary school. They have a decent standard of living.

Tsetsegtuya started a clothes trading business at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business with a working capital of 1,000,000 MNT. Now, her business is more stable – she has been renting the same stall where she now sells for a long period of time. 

Tsetsegtuya  lives close to Narantuul market.  This is an advantage for her as she does not need to spend much money on  transportation. She is a sociable person whose desperate wish is to have her own apartment. 

Tsetsegtuya is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to buy more seasonal clothing to sell this season.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Pulacayo Group

texts.es: El banco de Emprendimiento "PULACAYO " es uno grupo  nuevo de la agencia, se encuentra en su primer ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco esta representadas por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora Matilde quien es la líder del grupo, tiene como negocio la venta de lencería de forma ambulante, ofrece sus productos en oficinas, donde ya tiene su clientela, es un apersona muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería por mayor y así de esta manE. incrementar su capital de trabajo. Como TesorE. esta la Sra. Margarita que tiene el negocio de venta de Chocolates en la una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar chocolates por caja para surtir sus productos. 	todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan a delante a sus familias solas con el único deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida, las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Pulacayo Communal Bank is a new group with the agency, and it is in its first cycle.  It is comprised of responsible and hard-working people.  This group is represented by the following people.

Matilde, the president, is the leader of the group.  She has a business selling lingerie in an itinerant manner.  She sells her products in offices where she already has customers.  She is a very hard-working person.  She will use the loan to buy wholesale merchandise.  That way she will increase her working capital.

Margarita is the treasurer.  She has a business selling chocolates on one of the centrally located streets in the city.  She wishes to use the money from the loan to buy boxes of chocolates to stock up on her products.

All of the members are responsible and hard-working people.  In many cases, they get their families ahead by themselves.  Their only wish is to improve their quality of life.  The members are grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mushabe

texts.en: Mushabe H. is an individual client from Ibanda. She is 42 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. H. is involved in the "boda boda" transport system where she buys motorcycles and gives them out on loan for a profit. She is also involved in the sale of produce, especially bananas and mostly from her plantations, and this contributes to increasing her income. She is a goal oriented lady with the drive to succeed. She needs a loan to be able to top up and buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Cinthia Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Cinthia, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, vive con su pareja y una  hija de él con quien se encuentra en la fotografía, nos comenta que aun no tiene  hijos  propios  ya que primero espera terminar sus estudios para poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia. El marido trabaja en una cerrajería.

Se dedica a sus estudios en la carrera de  Ing. Industrial, es para esto que solicito su crédito ya que espera que este le pueda ayudar para los gastos que representa el semestre de estudio, nos cuenta que ya está en octavo semestre y que le faltan solo dos para culminar sus carrera, además de esto ella también le ayuda a su esposo a comprar algunas herramientas que requiere en su trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar libros, hojas, y otros gastos para sus estudios. Está  en el Banco Comunal ya por tres años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the "Mujeres con Esperanza" (Women with Hope) community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo which has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees' owing to the large quantity of tamarind fruit that used to exist there. 

Here we meet Cinthia.  She is 21 years old and lives with her partner and his daughter, who appears in the photo.  The couple don't have any children of their own yet since first she hopes to finish her studies so that she can provide her family with a better future.  Her partner works in the locksmiths trade.

Cinthia is studying industrial engineering.  She is requesting a loan because she hopes that it will help her to cover the expenses that this semester brings.  She tells us that she is in her eighth semester already and that she only has two left until she finishes her course.  In addition to this, she would also like to help her partner by purchasing some tools that he needs in his work.

This loan will be used to buy books, paper and to cover other expenses related to Cinthia's studies.  She has been a member of her community bank for three years and she likes being a member because the payments are easy to make.  Her dreams are to finish her studies and get a good job.

loans.use: to buy books and paper, and to cover other expenses related to her studies

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen G. is 27 years old. He lives in Sevan city with his parents and his sister. Armen is an auto mechanic but, since 2004, he has worked as a waiter. He has also operated a fruit and vegetable business since 2006. Armen’s parents help him in his trading and, thus, they support their family.  
This is Armen’s second loan from Nor Horizon and he is asking for 500.000 AMD to buy stock such as potatoes, tomatoes, greens and cucumbers to resell. 
Armen will use the expected income for his wedding preparations.

loans.use: To buy stock such as potatoes, tomatoes, greens and cucumbers to resell

loans.name: Jimena Janeth

texts.es: La señora Jimena  se dedica a trabajar como dibujante,  quien hace dibujos particularmente para estudiantes a quienes  en sus unidades educativas les dan dichos trabajos, su familia esta compuesta por su persona, su esposo quien trabaja en otra provincia razón por la que se ausenta a veces por largo tiempo de su domicilio y su niña de 6 meses de edad, la señora para colaborar a los ingresos familiares se dedico a trabajar como dibujante. Ya que la actividad lo realiza en su domicilio vio por conveniente abrir una librería para mejorar sus ingresos. Razón por la que solicito crédito para la compra de material escolar y también material para realizar sus dibujos, es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jimena works as a draftswoman and makes drawings for students who are given projects at school.
