Her family is comprised of herself, her husband who works in another province and is away from home for long periods of time, and their 6-month-old daughter.  She contributes to the family income with her work as a draftswoman.  

Since she does her job from home she believes it would be a good idea to open a bookstore to increase income.  She plans to use the loan to buy school and drawing materials.  She is a hard worker and intent on getting ahead, and grateful to the institution for the support received.

loans.use: To buy materials to open a bookstore

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a resident of Kitale town in Western Kenya  and has been in farming for three years, producing and selling maize and beans to the local market. He is married with two children aged three years and five months. Emmanuel's farming income is subsidized by his income from employment as a driver.

Emmanuel has made a loan request of 50,000 KES, this being his second loan after the first one of 25,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business. He says the "bodaboda" (motorcycle transport) business is currently booming and will definitely help him improve his dairy business. He is focusing on having five acres of land with three high breed dairy cows in the near future.

Emmanuel says they are experiencing challenges with marketing both in terms of accessibility and poor prices.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells garlic and onions in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy garlic and onions to sell in her food stall.

Mildred has been in this business for nine years. She also earns income from fattening pigs.

Mildred has been developing her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money  to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy garlic and onions to sell in her stall

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, age 25, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Phan raises pigs and is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband sells mango, earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Phan has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase pigs to raise for sale. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a small grocery store since 2009. He sells all types of food products, juices, soft drinks, breads etc. His shop is situated in a busy area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He helps his father with the household expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory. He expects that his business will continue to grow with the coming years.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Teddy has a beauty salon business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids for resale in her salon. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, by buying new clothes. In the future, she hopes to open a poultry farm.
Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids to sell in her salon.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en: This borrower is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Three of the children are going to school. Her husband is a businessman. She needs more money for school fees. She wants to start a small business for more income.

loans.use: with a small seals business.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Primavera nace gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros que organizó a sus vecinas y amigas con la idea de producir un bien para ellas, dándoles una visión de que a través del comité estarían alcanzando el progreso de cada una. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con 12 miembros, donde todas trabajan muy unidas y de esa forma les es más fácil cumplir con sus obligaciones. Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando para salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
La Señora Agustina se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas, hace un buen tiempo que lo hace por lo que ya tiene un grupo de clientas y clientes bien definido, que siempre compran de ella sus productos. Ella por medio de este trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y puede solventar los gastos que surgen en la casa. Sueña con algún día poder tener un local donde vender sus ropas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de estación con lo que podrá actualizar su stock de mercaderías y también cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
This committee called “Primavera” (Spring) was started thanks to one of its members who organized her neighbors and friends with the idea of doing something good for them.  She had the vision of a committee that would help each member make progress.  The group currently has 12 members and all of them work very close with one another, which makes it easier for them to meet their obligations.  All of them strive to move forward in search of success for themselves and their communities.  

Sra. Agustina sells all types of clothing.  She enjoys what she does because she already has a group of customers who always buy merchandise from her.  Through her work, Agustina has been able to get ahead and cover the expenses accumulated by her household.  

She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothing so that she can keep her inventory stocked.  Agustina hopes this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: Compra de ropas de estación, para la posterior venta

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Rubie has a shop that sells longganisa (spiced meat similar to chorizo) & home-made sausage. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making sausage.

Rubie has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rubie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making sausage.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. Beatriz is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her fishing business.

Beatriz has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Chaloliddin

texts.ru:
Чалолиддин добросовестный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец двух детей. Он занимается скотоводством более двух лет. Чалолиддин любит свой бизнес и занимается с удовольствием. Он покупает скот из местных рынка города, привозит их домой и кормит в определенный период. Когда они набирает вес, потом продают их в хороших ценах. Чалолиддин хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свое жилищное условия. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Chaloliddin is a conscientious and honest person.  He is married and is a loving father of two children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for two years.  Chaloliddin loves his business and enjoys being involved in it.  He buys livestock at the local city markets, brings it home and feeds for a certain period of time.  When livestock gains weight, he sells it at a good price.  Chaloliddin want to expand his business and improve his living conditions.  He want to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock.  He hopes that creditors will support him.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд образованный, трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Более 5 лет он занимается купля продажей продукты питания. Он имеет арендованный магазин на своем селе. У него много постоянных клиентов, которые часто заходят за покупками продуктов. Он приобретает товар у других рынка районов по дешевле, чем у местных рынках. Его отец помогает ему по данному бизнесу. Он получает дополнительный доход от переработки абрикосов, получает зарплату и пенсия родителей. Махмуд хотел бы получит займ в размере 2500$ США для покупки широкого ассортимента продукта. Заранее Махмуд благодарен всем за поддержку и милосердие. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mahmud is an educated, hard-working and conscientious person.  He is married and is a loving father of two children.  He has been involved in buying and selling food products for over five years.  He has a leased store in his village.  He has many loyal customers, who often stop in to buy food products.  Mahmud buys his products from other district markets cheaper than at the local markets.  His father helps him in this business.  Mahmud receives an additional income from processing apricots, receives a salary and his parents' pension.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500 for the purchase of a wide assortment of products.  Mahmud thanks everyone in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Sanjragchaa

texts.en: Sanjragchaa is 66 years old and lives his wife in an apartment in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife sews and makes clothes. He is retired and in pension at the moment. His family started a tailoring business in 2002. He supports his wife in every aspect that is related to the family business. His family is planning to expand their business operation and build a house. He is a diligent and hard working man who says "With the bank loan, I want to develop and improve my business to a certain degree. I and my wife are planning to open a tailoring house in our hometown." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase sewing materials for their business and to complete the construction of a new house.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah, 22, is married and has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.

Samah has a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries to have a better selection for sale, in order to increase her income. She doesn't have enough money to pay for this, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Samah gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more groceries and have a variety of groceries for sale. This will enable her to compete, to sell more and to increase her income in order to have a better quality of life. Samah is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead in the grocery store.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to have a better selection for sale.

loans.name: Djeyi

texts.fr: Djeyi est une femme commerçante, elle habite à l'ouest du Sénégal. Elle s'active dans le domaine du commerce depuis plus de 3 ans. Avec ce prêt elle veut acheté des marchandises (sacs d'arachides, du niébé) qu'elle va revendre au marché. Elle compte faire du profit pour aider ses enfants et participer sur les dépenses quotidiennes de la maison
texts.en: Djeyi is a retailer who lives in the west of Senegal.  She has been working as a retailer for more than three years.  With this loan, she would like to buy merchandise (bags of peanuts and black-eyed peas) which she will re-sell in the market.  She plans to make profits which she will use to help her children and contribute towards her daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (peanuts and black-eyed peas)

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marisol  es casada, tiene 4  hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Unión por el Progreso” grupo  conformado por 8 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Marisol  trabaja desD. hace   2 años en casa,  realizando las labores D. limpieza, cocina y lavado este trabajo surge porque  el sueldo D. su esposo que es taxista  no alcanzaba  para cubrir los gastos básicos , educación, alimentación, servicios, Marisol nos cuenta que su motivación para salir adelante son sus hijos , gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos van al colegio  y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una  mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar un refrigerador y así poder vender helado, gaseosas, marcianos . Sabemos que Marisol cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Marisol is married and has 4 school-aged children. Currently, she is a member of the "Unión por el Progreso" ("Union for Progress") communal bank, which is maD. up of 8 members who dedicate themselves to various business activities. Marisol has been a domestic worker for two years, doing cleaning, cooking, and washing. This job came about because her husband's salary as a taxi driver did not cover their basic costs, such as education, food, and services. Marisol tells us that her motivation to move ahead is her children - thanks to her effort and dedication, she has succeeded in bringing in more money, her children go to high school, and, above all, her family has a better quality of life. With the goal of continuing to grow, she has asked for a new loan to purchase a refrigerator so she can sell ice cream, soft drinks, and popsicles. We know that Marisol will reach her goals with much work and effort, and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru: Файзулло житель района Хамадони. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Файзулло уже 13 занимается торговлей. Он продает овощи и яблоки. Кредит берет для приобретения фруктов.
texts.en: Fayzullo is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  He is 44 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Fayzullo has been involved in sales for 13 years.  He sells vegetables and apples.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1979. She lives in Xom Mit village, Co Loa commune, Dong Anh district. She is a farmer. Her husband is a driver. He has an income of about 4,000,000 VND per month. 

Not only does Mrs.Lan grow rice, but she also sells breakfast. She has had this job for five years. Besides, she is cooking for a school near her house. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. 

She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the sixth time she is borrowing from SEDA. 

She is the leader of a five-member group loan in SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy foodstuffs for cooking breakfast to sell.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Thanh is 28 years old. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy cloth.
Xuan is 33 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND for a small business.
Phuc is 43 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to breed pigs.
Duyen is 29 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND for a small business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to cook breakfast to sell.

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien is 32 years old and is married with two children aged between 5 and 7 years old. His business is well organized. He sells retail items such as sugar, cakes, lotions, etc. Gratien has thirteen years of experience and employs one person to help him.

Gratien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as sugar, cakes, lotions, etc to sell. With any profit from this loan, Gratien will reinvest in his business. He will also be able to buy a bicycle to help him in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as sugar, cakes, lotions, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Enhnaran

texts.en:
Enhnaran is 47-years-old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in eastern Mongolia. Her husband is a teacher and heir two kids are school students. 

She started her grocery retailing business in 1999 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years she has gained the trust of her suppliers. Therefore, she buys her products fairly cheap price. She uses that advantage to supply other counters. Since her income is the main income in the family, she uses every opportunity to grow. She is lacking 1,200,000 MNT to run her business efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more products to run her business efficiently.

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en: This time Mrs.Tuul wanted to increase her working capital (inventory) such as baby clothes for the business' expansion. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase a large numbers of baby clothes from her supplier. In addition, she used her previous loan successfully and paid it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase a large numbers of baby clothes from her supplier.

loans.name: Dania Esperanza

texts.es: Dania Esperanza es una emprendedora que ha cumplido su sueño de tener su propio negocio y poder salir adelante. Este inicia por la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia que junto a su esposo que la apoya han luchado por seguir sus sueños. Dania Esperanza está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de ropa de hombre, para damas, niños, sandalia, short, entre otros productos que mas demanda sus clientes.
texts.en: Dania Esperanza is an entrepreneur who has achieved her dream of having her own business and being able to get ahead. This began due to the need to generate income for the family for which, next to her husband who supports her, they have fought to follow their dreams. Dania Esperanza is requesting a loan to invest in the business buying men's, women's, and children's clothing, sandals, and shorts, among other products that her clients most request.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing, sandals, and shorts, among other products.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: A sus 20 años, el joven Santiago es un emprendedor quien decide junto con un amigo iniciar su propio negocio y poner en marcha la venta al por mayor de artículos como gorras, gafas y relojes por Internet distribuyendo sus productos a través de un ambiente Web a todas las regiones del país. Con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y realizar además estas al por menor, el joven Santiago necesita de la compra de mercancía en gorras, gafas y relojes con lo cual puede cumplir su objetivo. A corto plazo, sueña con tener un gran número de clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.
texts.en:
Santiago, age 20, is a young entrepreneur who decided to start an internet business with his friend. They sell items wholesale, including baseball caps, sunglasses and watches. They distribute products to all regions in the country. 

In hopes of improving sales and pursuing retail distribution, Santiago is applying for a loan to buy additional merchandise. Santiago's short-term goals are to increase his customer base and to provide a better quality of life to his parents.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as baseball hats, sunglasses, and watches.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel tiene 24 años de edad estado civil Soltero vive con sus padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla Victoria que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantana, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Luis Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. 

Solicita el crédito para los insumos que necesita para la agricultura como  abono, insecticida,  fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. Las compras  realiza en Agripac  en Ventanas. 

Su  sueño es comprar un terreno. El desafío al que se enfrenta es las plagas del maiz. En su tiempo libre le jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is 24 years old and single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas, which is in Los Ríos Province.

Luis is a member of the Communal Bank "Victoria", which is located in the neighborhood of Pantana in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farm workers and livestock breeders.

Luis Miguel is a farmer who grows corn. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies that he needs for farming such as compost, insecticides, fertilizers, urea, and fungicides. His purchases will be made at Agripac in Ventanas. Luis dreams of buying a plot of land. The challenges he faces include dealing with pests that attack corn crops.

In his free time, Luis Miguel enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, fertilizers, urea, and fungicides.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur in an enterprising man. He is thirty-four years old and has two children. He works hard to get ahead and to offer a better future for his kids.

For more than six years, he has worked as a welder. His business goes well because he knows his trade and is very dedicated to his work. His work is his only source of income. 

Elnur applied for the loan of AZN 500 to cover his own medical needs. This amount will cover his medicine. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders in advance!

loans.use: To purchase his medicine.

loans.name: Jesusdegbe 4 Group

texts.fr: JESUSDEGBE 4 est un groupe composé de quatre  personnes qui sont des amies et qui font des tontines ensemble. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie-Claire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie-Claire est âgée de 24 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie-Claire est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Marie-Claire et son mari. Pour cette raison, Marie-Claire vend de la patate douce à son domicile depuis dix environ. Parallèlement à son activité, Marie-Claire vend également du gari (farine de manioc), des condiments et de l’huile de palme. Marie-Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marie-Claire sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupement JESUSDEGBE 4, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du gari, des condiments et de l'huile de palme.

loans.name: Ahouéfa Joséphine's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VICTOIRE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même localité. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ahouéfa Joséphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Joséphine est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Ahouéfa Joséphine est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à sa charge. Ahouéfa Joséphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges de la maison sont supportées par dame Ahouéfa Joséphine. Ahouéfa Joséphine a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire, pour y arriver Ahouéfa Joséphine vend des boissons en canette et des produits alimentaires dans sa région depuis vingt ans. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins, d’assurer les besoins et l'éducation de ses enfants. Ahouéfa  Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ahouéfa Joséphine sollicite ensemble avec du groupe VICTOIRE un crédit auprès de ALIDé .

loans.use: Acheter des boissons en canette et des produits alimentaires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy brow driers, hair weaves, extensions, clips, and braids.

loans.name: Faleao

texts.en: Not many people have the talent in using natural resources to make cricket balls. And it is not every ones talent in Samoa but, Faleao, since she was a child has always been fascinated by the cricket ball and the raw materials from the forest that are used to make them in Samoa. In addition, when it was her turn to be taught the traditional family secrets she put all her efforts and time into producing this solid product.  She is likely to succeed because Faleao has the potential to make it into the overseas market. Although she caters to local markets, the only chance she has of displaying her products overseas is through people that come to Samoa buying her product. Her products are used in American Samoa, the United States of America in Samoan communities, Australia and New Zealand. She dreams of building a solid foundation to house her products one day.

loans.use: buy materials for expanding her business.

loans.name: Adriana Josefina

texts.en:
Adriana is a hard-working and very responsible person. She is married and has a 7-year-old child. Her husband is a maintenance technician and in order to help him with the household expenses she started making cookies and empanadas for sale. She really enjoys this work. Little by little the clientele has increased, and she started selling to acquaintances and neighbors. Thankfully, through recommendations, she now produces her products for banquets.

In order to be prepared with the ingredients she needs for the preparation of her products, Adriana requests a loan of $375 dollars. Her clients solicit her more and more, and in many cases the orders are very large. She wants to be prepared in order to provide great service. You can help improve her family’s way of life. Her family greatly appreciates your sincerity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Adriana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad. Su esposo es técnico de mantenimiento y para ayudarlo en los gastos de su hogar empezó a elaborar galletas y empanadas para venderlas, a ella le gusta mucho esta actividad, poco a poco los clientes se han incrementado, empezó vendiendo entre sus amistades y vecinos y gracias a las recomendaciones, ahora también elabora sus productos para banquetes.

Para poder estar preparada con los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, Adriana solicita de un préstamo por $ 375 dólares, sus clientes la buscan cada vez más, en ocasiones son pedidos muy grandes, ella quiere estar lista para darle un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase consumables

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam has a family business. He is 48 years old and has 3 children. He works in the state service. In the morning, he and his wife Gulbahor go to their trading place and sell their goods. Then his wife (in the photo) stays to trade and he goes to work. To buy the goods, he goes to Istaravshan town, 170 km away from Isfara. He came to Microinvest two and a half years ago to get a loan. The loan helped to increase the assortment of goods, and now he has more regular customers. He plans to further expand his business and is asking for a $1000 loan for 12 months for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of new shoes and handbags for sale

loans.name: Un Nuevo Sol Group

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Cristina, and I’ve run a small grocery store in the town of Alto de Villa Nueva for the last ten years. I need the money to buy various things such as pastries, crackers, soda, water, sugar, etc. With the earnings my business generates, I help my husband with the expenses of my three children. I have my best sales on weekends since the store is located in front of a soccer field; at the end of the game the players come and buy soda and candy from me.

My name is Faviana, and I devote myself to selling tortillas; I’ve had this business for 20 years, and it’s located in the town of Altos de Villa Nueva. At this time I need to buy corn, firewood, oil, salt and tanks to keep my tortillas in. As you can see, I’m an older woman and I can’t find work in my country at my age. I’m married and have two children. My husband works, but he earns very little; with the profits from this business, we manage our expenses. I am grateful for your help so that I can buy what I need.

My name is Martha S., and for fifteen years, I’ve devoted myself to making and selling donuts. I need the money to buy flour, firewood, sweetener, and other items. At this time, I don’t have much material to make my donuts; this lack is becoming urgent now that I have orders from nearby schools and other customers. With my income, I pay for my children’s education and help my husband with our home’s monthly expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Cristina, mi negocio es un pulperia en la colonia Alto de Villa Nueva hace 10 años. El dinero lo necesito para hacer varias compra como: Churros, galletas, sodas, agua azucar etec. Con las ganancias que me genera mi pequeño negocio ayudo ami esposo con gastos de mis 3 hijos. Mi mayor venta los tengo los fines de semana ya que esta hubicado frente a un campo de Foot- Boll, los jugadopres llegan al final del partido y me comprar sodas y golosinas.

Mi nombre es Faviana, yo me dedico a la venta de Tortillas, este negocio lo tengo hace 20 años esta hubicado en la colonia Altos de Villa Nueva. En estos momentos nesecito comprar maiz. leña, acite, sal, y pailas donde pongo mis tortillas. Como ustedes pondran ver ya soy una mujer de edad y no puedo conseguir un trabajo aqui en mi fpais por la edad, estoy casada y tengo dos hijos. Mi esposo trabaja pero sus ganancias son muy pocas y con las ganacias del negocio sobrevivimos con nuestros gastos. Les agradesco que me puedan ayudar para poder comprar lo que que nesecito.

Mi nombre es Martha S., yo me didico a la venta y elaboracion de Donas, este negocio lo tengo hace 15 años. El dinero lo necesito para comprar harina, leña, dulce y otros. En estos momoneto no tengo mucho paterial para hacer mis donas y me urge ya que tengo varios pedidos de las Esculas que estan serca de mi colonia y tambien de otros clientes. Con las ganancias pago los estudios de mis hijos y ayudo a mi esposo con gastos mensuales que tenemos en nuestro hogar .

loans.use: Purchase of flour, pastries, soda, oil, rice, crackers, firewood, corn, and salt.

loans.name: Lucy Isabel

texts.en:
Lucy is an artist and her medium is yarn. When Lucy was just 8 years old, she picked up a pair of knitting needles and hasn’t put them down since. She specializes in all types of baby clothing and is always busy filling the many orders that are constantly rolling in from expectant mothers wanting adorable outfits for their new babies. Lucy specializes in baby clothing because she has a soft spot in her heart for children, being a mother of three herself. 

For the past 10 years, Lucy has been a part of her village bank, taking out loans and investing in her knitting business. It has grown significantly thanks to her hard work and the economic help she receives. She is currently saving her money in order to provide for all the costs that go into maintaining a happy and healthy household for her family. In addition to the economic help is has provided her, Lucy loves her village bank because it has taught her how to formally save her money in the bank instead of in the house, where it is easy to spend frivolously. Lucy is requesting a loan of $350. With this money, she will buy a wide variety of yarns in different colors.

loans.use: she will buy a wide variety of yarns in different colors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Karla Del Rosario

texts.es:
Karla H., or Karlita, is a woman devoted to her small grocery store in the department of Chinandega. For the last two years, she has had her own store, earned through her own savings and through the support of her husband.

The business began with very few products, but as the years went by, she has stocked her shelves with new products that people demand. Very intelligently, Karlita has turned to Ceprodel, who has granted her loans that she has known to pay on time and in agreement with her terms. That's why, with her greatest need being once again the purchase of these goods, she will this time trust in Ceprodel to support her and her business in getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Karla H. conocida como Karlita es una dama que se dedica al negocio de pulpería en el departamento de Chinandega teniendo su propio negocio obtenido por sus ahorros propios y el apoyo de su esposo desde hace 2 años.

El negocio nace con pocos productos pero a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ha surtido su estante de nuevos productos demandados por la población. Muy inteligentemente la señora Karlita ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha sabido pagar en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido, es por esta razón que su mayor necesidad es una vez mas la compra de estos productos pero esta vez confía en que Ceprodel la apoyará para salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Kiwafu B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Alice K.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Alice is 32 years old and is single. She has 1 child aged 7, who goes to school. Each week, Alice makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for future use. Alice has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to buy more sacks of charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Alice is joined in her small group by Rose N., Justine N., Margret N., and Racheal N.. Rose N. has a business selling fish and wants to increase the business volume. Justine N. is currently operating a business selling fresh food and wants a loan to start buying food from the villages. Margret N. operates a business supplying goats and wants to purchase more goats. Racheal N. is currently in the business of running a stationery shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more text books.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business to bulk selling

loans.name: Emira

texts.en:
Emira is a 36-year-old woman from the town of Goražde. She lives together with her husband and their child who attends secondary school. Her husband does seasonal work and he can earn about US$ 120 monthly. They are doing agriculture. They are receiving a social help in the amount of US$ 800.

Emira wants to use this loan in the amount of US$ 825 to buy necessities for spring sowing of crops. Her intent is to increase monthly income for her household and secure crops for the coming growing period.

loans.use: To buy necessities for  sowing spring crops

loans.name: Siyavush

texts.en:
Siyavush S. is a 38-year-old father of three living in the Imishli region of Azerbaijan. For nearly two decades, he has earned a living by breeding cattle for beef. Meat is a staple in the Azerbaijani diet, so Siyavush has many regular clients.

He has earned a good profit, but prices for supplies have increased dramatically recently. To expand his business and support his family, Siyavush has applied for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a dairy cow and two calves. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow and two calves for a small cattle farm

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda lives on Fuerza Aérea Avenue in the Ferropetrol zone of the city of El Alto. She lives with her children and has her own stand where she sells clothing, mostly for women and girls, and is situated in a central market in the city of El Alto.

The loan she is requesting will be used toward the purchase of merchandise so that she may increase her sales, and therefore, her earnings. This is her second loan from Impro through Kiva, and her previous loan has been repaid in its entirety. The evaluation conducted qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda vive en la avenida Fuerza Aérea de la zona Ferropetrol en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus hijos y tiene un puesto en el cual vende ropa, preferentemente de mujeres y niñas, ubicado en un mercado céntrico en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de mercaderías y así poder incrementar sus ventas, por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito con Impro a través de Kiva; el crédito anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of women's and girls' clothing to sell in her stand.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the community bank Sol Naciente, located in Jr. Cajamarca 100 in the Calleria district of the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 54 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a sobador, a traditional practicioner treating dislocations and other injuries through manipulation and massage, but his earnings do not meet the family's expenses. For that reason, Rosa decided to invest her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the launch of a business selling healthy food products made by Union, a company associated with the Seventh Day Adventist Church, which gives students attending one of its 3 Peruvian universities the opportunity to pay for their studies through flexible work in the food factory.

Now Rosa has her own business selling these healthy food products. She rises at 7 AM to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband. Later, from 3 PM until 7 PM, she works distributing and collecting payment for her products.

With this loan of 1000 soles which she will repay in 4 months, Rosa will buy 60 each of piononos and kekes, two typical Peruvian pastries, along with 45 loaves of whole grain bread, 15 whole grain pastries, and more.

Rosa walks a long way to be able to sell her products., though that has not been an obstacle to her moving ahead. She has a special charisma that allows her to attract clients, and more clients every day. She feels happy to be member of the Manuela Ramos family, since the support they give her allows her to work and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, ubicado en el Jr. Cajamarca 100, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es sobador, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no satisfacen sus gastos familiares, es así que Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de productos UNION.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con su negocio de venta de productos Unión, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am. para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y esposo, luego se dedica a la repartición y cobranza de sus productos desde las 3 pm hasta las 7 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró 60 unidades de piononos, 60 unidades de kekes, 45 unidades de panes integrales, 15 unidades de kekes integrales, etc.

Rosa es una mujer que tiene que caminar mucho para poder vender sus productos, pero eso no es impedimento para salir adelante, posee un carisma especial para atraer a sus clientes que cada día son mas y mas, ella se siente feliz de pertenecer a la familia de Manuela Ramos, ya que el apoyo que le brindan le permite trabajar y ayudar en su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of Union brand healthy food products in wholesale quantities (pastry, bread, etc.)

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema A. is a Tanzanian business woman (pictured standing). For 4 years, she has run a retail shop selling soft drinks in the Kigamboni area. She purchases the soft drinks from wholesale shops and sells to consumers in the area near the shop.

Rehema uses the profits from the business to meet her family's daily needs, including paying school fees for her children. She doesn't have enough supplies to meet the demands of her many customers. She requests a loan of $750 to increase the supply of soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Midori Rossana

texts.es:
Midori tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos.  Es una gran negociante de animales, junto a su esposo, se dedican a este rubro desde hace 20 años y esta gran experiencia les ha servido para ubicar sus mercados de venta y dónde adquirir su animales. La dinámica de su trabajo consiste en comprar animales de las localidades de Mito y Matahuasi, para luego revenderlas en las ferias ganaderas de Coto Coto y Chupaca, de lunes a viernes  se dedican a adquirir los animales y los fines de semana de  venderlos, por ello, este trabajo arduo tiene sus recompensas, lo que anima a Midori a continuar. gran motivo, es el  bienestar de su familia y el sostener la educación de sus hijos. 
Midori quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo, razón por la cual solicita el préstamo con el que podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de animales.
texts.en:
Midori is 41 years old, lives with her husband and her three children. She has been an animal trader with her husband in this area for 20 years. This great experience has served to place her markets and where she purchases her animals. The dynamics of her job consist of buying animals from the towns of Mito and Matahuasi and then reselling them at livestock fairs in Coto Coto and Chupaca. From Monday through Friday, she acquires the animals and on weekends she sells them. This hard work has its rewards, which is what encourages Midori to continue. A big reason is the welfare of her family and the support of her children's education. Midori wants to increase her working capital, which is the reason why she asks for this loan with which she may purchase a larger quantity of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital to purchase a larger quantity of animals

loans.name: Griselda Vianey

texts.es:
Griselda inició el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado las ventas y tenia a su cargo la cafetería de la escuela en donde estudiaban sus hijos la primaria, pero al terminar de estudiar, tuvo que dejar la cafetería, ya que tienen que ser padres de familia de alumnos de la escuela para poder tener ese negocio; por lo que hace 4 años, empezó con un préstamo que le hizo una hermana a vender papas fritas para ayudarse, luego al ya no poder tener a su cargo la cafetería, y con la experiencia que había adquirido en la misma, decidió instalar un snack ambulante por las tardes y en eventos especiales (fechas cívicas, fiestas religiosas, temporada de baseball, etc. ya que por las mañanas trabaja de ayudante en la cafetería de una universidad.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mercancía para próximos eventos, y tener mercancía para vender mas y obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Griselda began her business since she has always enjoyed sales, and she had in her care the cafeteria of the primary school in which her children studied. But at the end of their studies, she had to leave the cafeteria, because you must be a parent of the students of the school in order to be able to have this business. Because of this, 4 years ago she began with a loan from a sister to sell french fries in order to help herself. After she couldn’t run the cafeteria, with the experience that she had acquired there she decided to began a mobile snack stand for the afternoons and special events (Civic dates, religious festivals, baseball season, etc.) Also in the mornings she works as a helper in the cafeteria at the university. She needs a loan of US $475 that she would repay in 6 months in order to stock merchandise for upcoming events, and to have merchandise in order to sell more and obtain a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia C. M., tiene 56 años  pertenece al Banco Comunal  Mujeres del Milenium  y vive en la Mz 14 lote 6 Víctor Raúl Parte Alta del distrito del Porvenir provincia de Trujillo departamento de la Libertad Perú.
Tiene instrucción superior incompleta y estudió 2 años básicos de costura.
Se casó con Enrique Francisco Córdoba, con el que tuvo dos hijos, que actualmente ya trabajan.
Julia cosía y no se atrevía a hacer otra cosa, pero ahora vende briquetas, leña, cose ropa y vende golosina y comida.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, no invirtió su préstamo porque tenía miedo no poder reponer, a partir del segundo préstamo ya empezó a trabajar.
Con este crédito de  1000 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará briquetas (carbón de piedar), telas para confeccionar y otros insumos y leña porque después se pone muy escaso.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio y dar trabajo al que no tiene. Pero su gran pasión es la Educación inicial.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia C. M. is 56 years old and belongs to the Women of the Millenium Community Bank. She lives in Mz 14, lot 6, Victor Raúl Parte Alta in the Porvenir district of Trujillo, La Libertad, Perú. She didn’t complete her higher education and studied the basics of sewing for two years. She married Enrique Francisco Córdoba, with whom she has 2 children, who are currently working. Julia used to sew and wouldn’t have dared to do anything else, but now she sells briquette, firewood, sews clothes, and sells sweets and food. She repaid she first loan of 300 soles in 4 installments. She didn’t invest the loan because she was afraid that she wouldn’t be able to repay it. Starting with her second loan, she began to work. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy briquettes, fabrics, and other supplies and firewood because later it will be scarce. She dreams of expanding her business and giving employment to someone without a job. Her great passion, however, is early education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric at wholesale.  To buy briquettes and firewood.

loans.name: Marlenis

texts.es:
La microempresaria Marlenis R. tiene 42 años de edad, es casada con 2 hijos, todos estudian y desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de perfumes para apoyar a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Doña Marlenis tiene como clientes a mujeres que trabajan en oficinas publicas como el ministerio de educación, el ministerio de salud y algunas oficinas privadas como el chino chow entre otras. Sin embargo ella tiene que enviar a la capital pagos quincenales ya que estos productos son propiedad de empresa vogel, pero  la mayoria de sus clientas les pagan al mes por lo que necesita financiamiento para poder asumir esas deudas y recuperarlas mensualmente, además para poder comprar mas productos ya que sus clientas le compran estos productos por lo menos una vez cada mes, en algunos casos pintura de labios, en otros perfumes, en otros cremas en fin una sola clienta  siempre le compra algo. 

Quiere comprar los siguientes productos los cuales ya están encargados: 1 docena de perfumes de hombre variado a US$ 96 Dólares cada docena, 1 docena de tinte para el cabello a US$ 36 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de perfumes de mujer  a US$ 120 dólares cada docena, 1 docena de crema para el cuerpo a US$ 36 dólares cada una, 1 docena de desodorante para mujer a US$ 32 dólares cada una, 1 docena de desodorante para hombres a US$ 30 dólares cada una, y ½ docena de tratamiento para el cabello a US$ 30 dólares la media docena.
texts.en:
Businesswoman Marlenis R. is 42 years old and married with two children. Both are students. For the last eight years, Marlenis has been selling perfumes to help her husband with household expenses. Her clients are women who work in government offices such as the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Health, as well as private offices like Chino Chow etc. She has to send payments every two weeks to the capital since the products that she sells are owned by Vogel Company. However, the majority of her clients pay her monthly. She therefore needs a loan so that she can cover these debts and then get the money back at the end of the month. She would also like to be able to buy more products as her customers buy from her at least once a month such items as lipstick, perfume, or creams. Each customer always buys something. As a result of requests from her customers, Marlenis wishes to purchase one dozen men’s perfumes at US$96 per dozen, one dozen hair dyes at US$36 per dozen, two dozen women’s perfumes at US$120 per dozen, one dozen cases of body lotion at US$36 at US$36 per case, one dozen cases of women’s deodorants at US$32 per case, one dozen cases of men’s deodorants at US$30 per case, and half a dozen hair treatments at US30 per half dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of personal care products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is divorced and has two teenage daughters. She sells food in a little store at Drogobych city. Maria has been in this business for 5 years. She used to manage a store under the Soviet Union, but when the USSR fell, the employees at that store lost their jobs. Later many of them, like Maria, opened their own small stores and businesses.
Because of her experience, Maria was able to make her small business a success.

Maria would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH ($632) to purchase more goods for the coming holiday season so she can increase her assortment of inventory. Even though Maria is alone and raises two children herself, she is very optimistic and believes that Jesus Christ can help her to overcome any difficult situation.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Imelda Pastora

texts.es:
La Emprendedora Señora de nombre Imelda Pastora Alarcón tiene la edad de 50 años, sus estado civil casada, Doña Imelda tiene 3 niñas sus edades son las siguientes su hija mayor de 26 años trabaja por cuenta propia su otra hija de 23 años cursa el 4 año de su carrera y su hija menor de 20 años cursa el 3 año de su carrera, su esposo labora como maestro de obras, sus propósitos son generar lo suficientes ingresos para seguir manteniendo su negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos sus deseos son de que sus hijas tengan un futuro asegurado en donde ellas puedan salir adelante ante cualquier situación que se les presente sus sueños son tener salud para ver el logro de que sus hijas coronen sus carreras además en sus sueños esta dejarle una vivienda para que puedan tener un techo donde vivan dignamente.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una librería en la que ofrece productos como: cuadernos, lápices, borradores, lapiceros, cartulinas, la ubicación de su negocio es en telica, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de obtener otra fuente de ingresos que le ayude a ella y a sus hijas a darle un mejor vivir y contar con el sustento diario cuando inicia este negocio fue con capital propio y con una pequeña cantidad y empezó colocando cosas pequeñas como reglas, bolsos y marcadores pero solo con estas cosas no logro satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes por lo que mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento para realizar todas las compras necesarias pero debido al nuevo auge de la entrada a clases es por eso que necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que estará destinado para la compra de mas útiles escolares por lo que hoy en día recibe pedidos y así saca mejor provecho de sus productos.
texts.en:
The businesswoman Mrs. Imelda Pastora Alarcón is 50-years-old, married and has 3 daughters. Her eldest daughter is 26-years-old and self-employed. Her 23-year-old daughter is in her fourth year of her studies and her youngest daughter who is 20-years old is in her third year of studies. Her husband works as a construction worker.

Her intentions are to generate sufficient income in order to continue maintaining her business, which is now her primary source of income. Her hopes are that her daughters will have a secure future in which they can overcome whatever situation they are presented with. She also wishes to have good health in order to see the success of her daughters in their careers. Additionally she wishes to leave them with housing where they can live with dignity.

Mrs. Pastora Alarcón runs a bookstore where she offers products such as: notebooks, pencils, erasers, pens and cards. Her business is located in Telica and she has run the business for 10 years. She began her business in order to have another source of income, which helped her and her daughters to have a better life and security. When she began her business it was with her own small amount of capital that she invested in small things such as rulers, bags and markers but with only these things she could not satisfy the demand of her customers. Recently she has decided that a loan would help her to make all of the necessary purchases of school supplies for the peak time in sales and take advantage of the need for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar B. est âgé de 28 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son enfant et sa femme dans le quartier Torakabougou dans la préfecture de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il abandonna très tôt l’école pour se consacrer à la photographie qu’il a appris auprès d’un ami. Avec une expérience de 7 ans, Monsieur Boubacar B. maîtrise bien son activité et très sollicité au niveau de la ville de Bougouni avec une clientèle généralement composée de jeunes. C’est surtout pendant les vacances, les jours de mariages(Jeudi et Dimanche), les soirées dansantes et les baptèmes que son activité est très élévé.
Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complementaire, il décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinanace Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, un appareil photo, et des péliculles.
Il s’approvisionne en appareil photo et en péliculles à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Monsiuer Boubacar B. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt et faire la finition de sa maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar B. is 28 years old and lives in a monogamous family with his child and wife in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He left school very early in order to devote himself to photography, which he learned from a friend. With seven years of experience, he is mastering his work and is in high demand by customers general composed of young people in the city of Bougouni. He is particularly busy during vacation time, on wedding days (Thursdays and Sundays), for dance parties, and at baptisms.

In his search for supplemental financial resources, he decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which he is on his first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy a camera and film. He gets his supplies in Bamako, the capital of Mali.

He plans on realizing a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that he envisions using to pay the loan interest and to complete his house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camera and film

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi: Chị Bùi Thị Nguyệt năm nay  52 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành và có việc làm ổn định.  Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi gà, vịt, cá tại nhà còn chồng chị làm nghề đánh cá. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng từ công việc chăn nuôi và đánh bắt cá gia đình chị không chỉ hoàn trả vốn tốt mà còn có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để  đầu tư mua thêm 100 con gà giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi,  phần còn lại chị sẽ sử dụng để mua thêm dụng cụ để đầu tư cho công việc đánh bắt cá của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bui Thi N. is 52 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2006. She has four children, two of them are adults and have stable jobs. Currently she raises chickens, ducks, fishes at home, and her husband catches fishes. With an income of VND3,000,000 per month from poultry raising and fishing, she not only pays back the loans but also has financial resources to improve living condition and send the young children to school.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000. She will use part of it to buy 100 baby chickens and foods for them. She will use the remaining part to buy tools and equipment for fishing for her husband to catch fishes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 100 baby chickens to raise, and fishing equipment

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de un plato típico de su zona, conocido como lechón, que es cerdo al horno, y para ello recorre las principales calles de su localidad y eventos festivos, muchas veces en compañía de sus hijos, que la ayudan a vender este exquisito plato, preferentemente en las mañanas. Lo que le gusta a Elvia de su trabajo es que también puede apreciar los parajes y las actuaciones que hay durante las celebraciones, lo que no le agrada es el clima lluvioso porque le impide trabajar cómodamente, pese a esto, seguirá vendiendo este plato porque le es muy rentable, tiene mucha demanda, por lo que está pensando aumentar sus ventas. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las más activas de su banco comunal, pues siempre gusta de ser la que impulsa la organización de su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de más cerdos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Elvia is 35 years old and lives with her two children in her own house. She sells a dish typical of her region known as "lechón", which is baked pork. She sells in the main streets of her town and at holiday events, often in the company of her children, who help her sell this exquisite dish, preferably in the mornings.

What Elvia enjoys about her work is that she can enjoy the places in which these festive events take place, and the activities that go along with the celebrations. What she doesn't like so much is the rainy weather because it makes it difficult for her to work. In spite of this, she'll continue selling lechón because it is very profitable for her and it is in great demand, so she is thinking about increasing her sales.

This is the fourth time she will get a loan with MFP, and she is one of the most active members of this communal bank. She likes to be the one who gets her group organized. The money that she asks for is to invest in the purchase of more pigs, and ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs to be able to cook more lechón

loans.name: Pese

texts.en: Pese P., 52, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 years experience in the plantation business.  She sells to the village and the public 6 days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 tala (WST).  SPBD loans are Pese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To pay her children’s school fees and acquire more equipment for her plantation.

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
La señora Nolberta es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 01 hijo.  No tiene estudios.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, ella es artesana (bordados) y realiza crianza de truchas.  Obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que le sirvió para comprar bayetas (telas), lana y otros materiales que necesita. 

Con este crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará materia prima (lana, bayetas por mayor, etc.) con ello  incrementará sus ganancias y ayudará a mantener a su hijo y en los gastos de sus estudios.  Agradece  al Movimiento Manuel Ramos por su Confianza y su apoyo.
texts.en:
Señora Nolberta is a member of the commual bank, "María Asunción Galindo," in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno. She is 47, lives with her boyfriend, and has one son. She did not go to school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for two years. She does embroidery and raises trout. She received her first loan of 300 PEN and used it to purchase fabric, wool, and other materials that she needed. With this loan of 500 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy supplies (wool, wholesale fabric, etc.). With the loan, she will increase her profits and help support her son and his educational costs. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for their confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, wool, and trout food

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
Fizuli Q. is a 40-year-old man who keeps his own café. He is also a cook and serves his clients with dishes of meat and tea. He has more that twelve years of experience in this field. His café is located in the open air in spring and summer which makes it very attractive.

Fizuli is married and has two children. He would like to improve his working conditions in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: To improve his working conditions

loans.name: Buri

texts.ru: Бури Гашбеков проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 63 года. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Бури более 15 лет занимается земледелием. До этого он работал гидротехником. Бури выращивает рис для продажи и для семьи. В этом ему помогают его дети. Клиент просит  у нас кредит, чтобы собрать урожай и посеить второй.
texts.en:
Buri G. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 63 years old, married, and has seven children. Buri has been farming for over 15 years. Before that he worked as a hydraulic engineer. He grows rice for sale and for the family. The children help him with the work. This client is requesting a loan from us to use for gathering the first harvest and planting the second.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and replanting

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis es viuda, vive con sus 3 hijas quienes se autoeducan y la apoyan mucho. La casa donde habitan es propia. Desde hace 12 años vende condimentos en todas sus variedades y los distribuye a todas las bodegas que se encuentran por su zona, los mismos que deja al crédito o al contado. Y cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas que reparte los mismos productos por otros lugares. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y sobre todo conocer nuevos lugares para incrementar sus ventas, además este negocio le es rentable porque sus condimentos son muy demandados debido al uso para las amas de casa y los restaurantes. Para más adelante, Gladis quiere comprar una movilidad para repartir con mayor comodidad sus productos. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son puntuales en sus pagos y sobre todo que se comprenden mucho entre todos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más condimentos para seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes y con otro tanto, invertirá en el negocio de una de sus hijas que se dedica a la compra y venta de madera.
texts.en:
Gladis is widowed and lives with her three daughters, who are educating themselves and are very supportive of their mother. For the past 12 years, Gladis has been selling all kinds of different spices, which she distributes to local grocery stores for payments in cash or on credit. One of her daughters helps her with the business by distributing spices in other areas. Her favorite parts of her job are giving good customer service and traveling to new places to increase her sales. Her business is profitable because the spices she sells are in high demand from restaurants and housewives. Gladis would like to buy a car in the future to make the distribution of her products easier. This is her eighth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma; her favorite part about her village bank is that her fellow members make their loan payments punctually and understand one another. With the requested loan, Gladis will buy more spices so that she can continue to supply them to her clients and will also invest in her daughter's lumber sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spices and invest in daughter's lumber sales business

loans.name: Charibel

texts.en:
Charibel M. is a responsible mother who aims to improve their standard of living. She wants to have their own house in their village in Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. In order to fulfill this dream, and also to provide for the needs of their family and the educational needs of their children, she and her husband are working hard. 

Charibel operates a passenger tricycle as her source of income while her husband works as a bus conductor. She can earn a daily income of PHP 150 to PHP 200 a day which is quite enough to meet their basic needs.

With her desire to achieve her dream house, Charibel would like to borrow PHP 9,000 to further maintain her motorcycle-transport business which is her source of income. With her motorcycle, she believes that she can save some of her income for their house. She also wants to put up her own store in the future. Charibel says that “nothing is impossible to a person who keeps on trying.”

loans.use: To further maintain her motorcycle-transport business

loans.name: Nolverta

texts.es: Nolverta es una mujer que a sus 39 años siempre ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 hijos: Wilfredo de 21, Wilber de 20, Yeni de 18, Cintia de 16 y Álvaro de 13 años, quienes son la razón de todos sus esfuerzos. Para comer bien en Juliaca, se tiene que visitar el restaurante de Nolverta, el cual se ha convertido en uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad, debido a la buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas.  A ella le gusta cocinar y siempre lo hace con mucha dedicación, pero le disgusta mucho servir y alcázar los platos de comida a los clientes, porque tiene que hacerlo sola, ya que no cuenta con el dinero para pagarle a un ayudante, aun así no se desanima y quiere salir adelante para en el futuro llevar una mejor vida. Nolverta ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y ha decidido que quiere ampliarlo incrementando el número de mesas que actualmente tiene. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde siempre paga todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Sus deseos de progreso son respaldos por sus compañeros de banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida y ella trabaja también por el bien de los demás. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mesas y sillas, así podrá atender a más clientes a la vez.
texts.en:
Nolverta is 39 years old. She has always fought hard to get ahead. Nolverta lives in her own home with her 5 children: Wilfredo - 21, Wilber - 20, Yeni -18, Cynthia – 16, and Alvaro -13. Her kids are the reason for all her efforts.

If you want to eat well in Juliaca, then you must visit Nolverta’s restaurant. It is one of the most popular in town because the food is so flavorful. She enjoys cooking and will continue to do so with great dedication. However, she dislikes serving and keeping up with customers’ orders because she runs her business by herself and does not have enough money to pay an assistant. She has yet to become frustrated and wants to get ahead in order to have a better life. Nolverta has been in business for 5 years and has decided to expand by increasing the number of tables she already has.

This is her second loan with MFP and she always makes her payments on time. Her desire to succeed is supported by her fellow community bank members. She is well admired and also works for the good of others. With her loan of 2000 soles, she will buy more tables and chairs so that she can serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La señora Nilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas II”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 57 años y 08 hijos, que ya son independientes y son su gran orgullo.

Nilda, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, ya que la separación que tuvo con su esposo, le afecto bastante moralmente. Ahora se encuentra mas superada y con ganas de salir adelante sola, con sus propios medios. Se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de la línea Unique que le dieron y le siguen dando muy buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo invertirá comprando una vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Nilda, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nilda belongs to Mujeres Optimistas II Communal Bank, in San Hilarión, a district of the province San Martín, in the department San Martín. She no longer lives with a husband, is 57 years old, and the mother of 8 children -- all now grown -- who are her great pride. Nilda is woman who has survived great difficulties on her walk through life. She had to separate from her husband, which had a significant affect on her. Now she finds herself in a better position and wishing to go on alone and get ahead with her own means. She started selling cosmetics from the company Unique gave her, and has been met with good results. Now with the business she manages, she feels very happy because of her success. With this loan of S/ 500.00, she will buy beauty products such as perfume and cologne, creams, powder, lipstick, and nail polish, for her stock, as well as display case to display her products. Nilda, with her maturity, follows the example of many women who have started businesses and who have, with persistence, succeeded in reaching their dreams. She is very grateful for Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her own business and other women to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products for her stock

loans.name: Rissicatou

texts.fr: B. Rissicatou est née le 18/02/1962 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Rissicatou est mariée à LALY Houdossoudé, un soudeur. Rissicatou et son mari ont cinq enfants. La famille vit depuis dix sept ans à Pk10 à Cotonou. C’est Rissicatou et son mari qui supporte les charges de la famille. Rissicatou est dans la restauration. Rissicatou vend aussi de poissons frits. C’est au port de pêche de Cotonou que Rissicatou achète ses poissons. Rissicatou a déjà quinze ans d’expérience dans la restauration et la vente poissons frits. Rissicatou a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé ; crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Aujourd’hui, Rissicatou sollicite un troisième crédit d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement pour faire ses achats en gros.

loans.use: Achat de condiments de cuisine et de poissons

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda es una mujer muy dinámica de 42 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, el último de ellos vive con ella y su esposo acompañándoles en una casa alquilada. Hace 26 años dejó su tierra natal para ocupar un puesto en la municipalidad de un centro poblado aledaño al suyo. Desde entonces, vive en dicho lugar, encariñándose mucho con toda la gente. Por tal motivo decidió emprender un negocio propio, el cual tiene productos muy variados, diferenciándose de los demás establecimientos. En su mini market, Magda ofrece útiles escolares, cosméticos, comestibles y hasta condimentos molidos, esta diversidad de productos le ha permitido ganar mucha clientela y a la vez hacerse muy conocida. Por ello, atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, brindándoles a sus clientes un buen trato y una sonrisa acogedora, de este modo Magda reúne las ganancias necesarias que le permiten solventar los estudios de sus hijos en la ciudad de Lima.
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, en su anterior préstamo demostró puntualidad en sus pagos y un buen desempeño como tesorera de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de accesorios de uso personal y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Magda is a very dynamic 42 year-old woman. She is married and she has 4 kids, with the youngest still living with her and her husband in a rented house. Twenty-six years ago she left her native land to run a stand in the municipality of Aledano Al Suyo. Since then, she has been living there and she has grown very fond of the people. For this reason she set up her own business through which she sells various products, making her business unique from all the others. In her mini-market, Magda sells school supplies, cosmetics, food and even ground spices. The great variety in the products she sells has won her a considerable clientele, making her very well known. She runs her business from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day, so that she might provide her clients with good service and a welcoming smile. Magda earns enough income this way to be able to pay for her childrens' schooling in the city of Lima.

This is the second loan she has received through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). Through her previous loan she was always on time with her payments and she was a wonderful treasurer for the community bank. The funds she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of person care items, as well as under garments.
