Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her supply of merchandise.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en: Mrs. Soung L. lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Siem Rin, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they earn little income to support the family's living. In order to improve their living standards, Mrs. Soung L. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is 46 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To add her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles runs a drugstore in his community. He sells all kinds of drugs in his store by the roadside. Charles procures his goods from Kumasi and sometimes from distributors' vans. He has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy drugs in bulk to increase his stock.

Charles is 39 years old, married and has one child in school. He lives with his child and wife in a rented apartment in Goaso, a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo region.

loans.use: To stock a drugstore

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
In the photo, you can see Rashad who has a cheese production business. He has been in this business for four years.

Rashad was born in 1984, is single, and lives in Fuzuli region. Now he needs a loan of 1,700 AZN to improve his cheese production business.

loans.use: To improve his cheese production business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 33 years old. She is married and has three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Joyce is a trader. She trades in printed textiles. She sells in a shop by the roadside in her community and treks to sell. Joyce buys the textile goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long N., 44, has established a small family home in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Long N. is a homemaker who cooks tasty foods for her family and cares for children. She was married years ago and is blessed with six children. Two of them are married and live independently, while the other four are students. This family is supported by Long N.’s husband, who works as a civil service officer for a committee consultant department.

Long N. will be using her first loan to buy a used motorbike for her school-aged children to use to ride to their place of study.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her school-aged children to ride to their study place

loans.name: Irma Marleni

texts.es:
La señora IRMA MARLENI M. SÁNCHEZ tiene 44 años, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Irma se dedica a la venta de plantillas, cueros, pegamentos para calzado.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò cuero, plantillas al por mayor, pegamento, etc.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà plantillas al por mayor, cuero, pegamentos, hilos, etc.
Irma sueña con ampliar su negocio e invertir en el negocio de cabinas de Internet para lo cual està ahorrando.
texts.en:
Irma Marleni M. S. is 44 years old. She lives in the district of El Porvenir, in the Trujillo province, state of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Esperanza del Mañana communal bank. She completed her secondary education. She lives with her partner and has 4 children whom she supports. She sells soles, leather and glue for shoes. With her first loan for 300 soles she purchased leather, shoe soles wholesale, glue, etc. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 soles which she will use to purchase shoe soles wholesale, leather, glue, thread, etc. Irma dreams of growing her business and investing in an Internet cafe business, something for which she is saving.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase shoe soles wholesale, leather, thread, glue, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane H. is a 36 year old lady married to Antony Jibo and they are blessed with two children. Jane is in the business of selling clothes in Bamburi area. She has been in this business for the past three years. Jane was introduced to Kadet by an existing client.

She intends to utilize the loan to increase her stock of childrens wear, male trousers, skirts and blouses for the ladies. Jane has a good credit history for she had borrowed from another MFI and she serviced her loan well.
       
Jane is a hard working lady, and her desire is to go wholesale.

loans.use: Add stock of childrens, men's and ladies' wear.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar G. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, but is now settled in Absheron town, Masazir village. He is 43 years old. Vugar is married and has 2 children.

He has been in this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 15 sheep to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata F. est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle fait du petit commerce de pâte d'arachide, de pagne, de bijoux et de parfums. Son objectif est de constituer une forte épargne afin de prétendre à une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Aminata F., 56, is married and the mother of 7 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years and has received four loans which she used wisely and reimbursed in a timely manner. She sells peanut butter, African print waxcloth, costume jewelry, and perfumes. Her goal is to have sufficient savings so that she can claim to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little business

loans.name: Laba

texts.en: Laba N. is from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is 44, married, and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the Village Bank "MBarry Gouytane" for eight years. Her main activity consists of raising cattle and sheep. She will use this loan to buy more cattle. The increased revenues will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy more cattle

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 51-year-old married man with two children in school. He is a self-employed estate management and commission agent. He got into this business after gaining experience and skills because he was formerly employed in this sector. He has been operating his business for eight years.

Besides his business, Gilbert has rental houses where he earns extra income. He plans to install water for sale in his rental houses and hence he requested Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya. This will be his fifth loan from the organization.

Since Gilbert is the breadwinner in his family, he feels he has to work hard to make ends meet. Therefore, he hopes to acquire more properties in the future and succeed in his business.

loans.use: To install water for sale in his rental houses

loans.name: Anabela Daniel

texts.pt:
Anabela Daniel M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 34 anos de idade viuva e mae de 4 filhos de 11, 08, 06 e 04 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 10ą classe, parou quando perdeu seu marido. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Sai de Maputo para a cidade da Matola quando contraiu o matrimónio, onde juntamente com seu falecido esposo fixara sua residência. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 11 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e vende mais refrescos onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum com as amigas através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA mais tarde decidiu na continuar por vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (ovos, óleo, arroz, amendoim e outros) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a construção da sua obra para posteriormente a rendar.
texts.en:
Anabela Daniel M. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 34 years old, widowed, and mother to four children, ages 11, 8, 6, and 4. The three eldest go to school. Anabela only finished tenth grade; she quit when she lost her husband. She lives in her own house with her children and does not support anyone else. When she got married, Anabela left Maputo for the city of Matola, where she established residence together with her late husband. She has had her own business for more than 11 years. She has no employees and sells mainly soft drinks. Her monthly income is about 5,500 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money with friends through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Anabela has taken out loans before with the Tchuma Credit Association. She decided not to continue with them for several reasons. She learned about Hluvuku from a neighbor who is also a customer at this institution. This is her third loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy products (eggs, oil, rice, peanuts and other products) to increase and diversify her inventory. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out more loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to continue construction on a rental house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (eggs, oil, peanuts and other products)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more baby items	to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
On the face of it, M. Joseph has come a long way with his cattle-selling business which he started with the savings he got from his tea leaf picking and packing small-scale business. Having had determination and a vision to change for better, the married father of four children invested in a farm stock of cows which he grazes and sells after some time to earn some profit.

Joseph’s main challenge is poor quality animals that do not grow very fast to bring quick returns. With this loan he will deworm and also buy more cows to sell. This will help him expand his business and also increase his revenue to meet family needs

loans.use: To stock more cows into his farm and buy deworming medicine

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria P. is from the village of Segatic, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Neria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, soap, eggs, sugar, salt and noodles. Neria also sells electronic loads for Smart and touch mobile phones in the local community. Neria has been involved in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Neria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Neria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Neria is requesting his second loan, of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers, fungicides, and vegetative supplies in order to provide optimum maintenance to improve his crops

loans.name: Norulah Khayat Group

texts.en: Norulah is the group leader of Norulah Khayat group. He lives in District 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his father and mother, so they live in a small family. He wants to take a loan for his tailoring business. He needs this loan to make a big shop for his business and to buy some materials, such as an electric sewing machine, different kinds of threads and scissors for his business. And help with his family as well. And expand and progress in the business. Thanks to the lenders of Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy some materials for his business

loans.name: Affoussath

texts.fr: R. Affoussath est née en 1961 à Sakété, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Affoussath est mariée à AMOUSSE Taofik et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée depuis sept ans au quartier Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Affoussath n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Affoussath vend des produits de beauté et des savons à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est dans le même marché que Affoussath achète ses produits. Affoussath exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Dans le but de développer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Affoussath sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
R. Affoussath was born in 1961 in Sakété, in Ouémé Department. She is married to Taofik Amousse and has three children, all of whom have been to school. For seven years the family has lived in the Lokokoukoumè neighborhood of the commune of Sèmè-Podji. Together they take care of family expenses. Affoussath did not go to school. To meet her needs, she sells beauty products and soaps at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center, where she also buys her stock. She has been in this business for five years and has already repaid one loan from ALIDé. To grow her business and respond better to customer demand, she is asking for a second loan.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Andaluz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Andaluz está compuesta por ocho personas, 7 mujeres y 1 varón, este es su primer ciclo, tiene como presidenta a la señora Miriam Lucinda A. M..

La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Santiago II.  La señora Miriam tiene como negocio la venta de productos de belleza, en particular perfumes, desde hace seis años, ingresó al grupo por invitación de sus amigas. 

Sus clientes son en general mujeres de diferentes oficinas y tiendas.Su crédito es de Bs. 1500.- y le servirá para comprar mercadería.

Ella comenta que le gusta el Crédito en Pro Mujer por que es fácil, debido a que la garantía es solidaria, se ahorra quincenalmente y tiene servicio de consultorio de apoyo en el área de salud.
 
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen diversos negocios,  elaboración de comida, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa, imprenta, venta de productos de belleza y tienda de barrio
texts.en:
A.C.Andaluz is consists of 8 people, 7 women and 1 man. This is their first loan cycle and the president is Mrs. Miriam Lucinda A. M.. This communal association belongs to the Santiago II Centro Focal. Miriam has been selling beauty products, specifically perfume, for six years. She joined the group at the invitation of her friends. Her customers are generally women from different offices and stores. Her loan is for Bs. 1500 and she will use it to buy merchandise. She mentions that she likes the loan through Pro Mujer because is it easy, guaranteed, she saves money every 15 days and enjoys the provided health services. The members of the communal association have varied businesses; selling food, perfume, clothing, printing, beauty products and neighborhood store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume that her customers select via catalog

loans.name: Luatimu Salome

texts.en: Luatimu Salome S. is 32 and married with one child. She owns a business venture selling BBQ (sausages, chicken, plantains) and has four years of experience in this business. Luatimu Salome needs a loan of WST 1,500 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or approximately US$274 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2009, Luatimu Salome joined SPBD and this is her 2nd loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal

loans.name: Vanh

texts.en:
Mr. Vanh S. is 40 years old and his wife, Seng Phan, is 38. They work from home making furniture to sell. Most of their output consists of beds, tables and cupboards, which they accumulate and sell as sets. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. 

The couple has four children, all of whom are in school and also help their parents make furniture. In order to make their business more successful, Vanh S. has applied for an $300 loan to buy raw materials to make furniture to sell. (Mr. Vanh S. was not available when the photograph was taken.)

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: María De Los Santos

texts.es: La  Sra. María de los Santos G. M.   ella  es Trabajadora del colegio público “Los Muñoz” la ceiba Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  Veinte y un año de trabajar para el magisterio es casada actualmente, tiene tres niño en Edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de un electrodoméstico “Refrigeradora”, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. María de los Santos G. M. is an employee of Los Muñoz Public School in La Ceiba Villa El Carmen. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 21 years. María is married and has three school age children. She has taken five loans with CEPRODEL which were used to buy construction materials for making improvements to her home.

María is requesting a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit because they have helped her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Hovéamédé

texts.fr: Mr T. Hovéamédé est né en 1980 à Aného. Il est père de deux (02) enfants qui sont à sa charge et vit actuellement à Vodougbé avec sa famille oû il pratique la culture maraîchère. Ces récoltes sont commercialisées par les femmes qui les vendent sur les marchés de la localité. Malheureusement il n’arrive pas à fournir toutes ces clientes. Son objectif est de doubler sa production. C’est pourquoi il sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra de financer l’achat d’intrants agricoles et étendre son domaine cultivable. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en: Mr T. Hovéamédé est né en 1980 à Aného. Il est père de deux (02) enfants qui sont à sa charge et vit actuellement à Vodougbé avec sa famille oû il pratique la culture maraîchère. Ces récoltes sont commercialisées par les femmes qui les vendent sur les marchés de la localité. Malheureusement il n’arrive pas à fournir toutes ces clientes. Son objectif est de doubler sa production. C’est pourquoi il sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra de financer l’achat d’intrants agricoles et étendre son domaine cultivable. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie.

loans.use: achat d’intrants agricoles et étendre son domaine cultivable

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela M. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Fidela operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products. Fidela's previous business is still existing and his husband is the one managing it, and Fidela having this sari sari store and just starting this business.

In 2009, Fidela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Fidela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose T. is 33 years old and is married to a husband who is a nurse. They have six children, three of whom go to school. Rose is currently in the business of selling various items from her shop such as cartons of salt, bags of beans, etc.

Rose is requesting a loan to stock more items in her shop to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to work on building a house.

loans.use: Stock more items in her shop to sell

loans.name: María Delma

texts.es:
La Señora María Delma Z. es comerciante que habita en el Municipio del Viejo, se dedica a la venta de comida en el sector  el Bisne, y este crédito desea invertirlo en su negocio,  tiene 5 años de experiencia en su negocio y es una señora Responsable con todas sus obligaciones.

A la fecha lleva 24 créditos con la institución los cuales todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
María Delma Z. is a businesswoman who lives in the Viejo Municipality. She sells food in the Bisne sector, and she wants this loan to invest in her business. She has five years of experience in this business and is a responsible woman in all of her obligations.

To date she has had 24 loans with the Institution, all of which were very well paid on time.

loans.use: Purchase oil, rice, and beans

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis  se dedica a trabajar en el comercio de refrescos el cual lo compra de la fabrica de refrescos muy conocida de la ciudad y posteriormente lo lleva  a la localidad del chapare  y lo distribuye en tiendas de Quillacollo solicita el crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería ya que ahora ya tiene pedidos para lo cual necesita mas capital, vive con su madre quien se encarga de los quehaceres de la casa y el ayuda con los gastos del hogar, es una persona responsable y trabajadora que tiene muchas ganas de superación, uno de sus deseos es el de ser el mas grande distribuidor del sector.
texts.en:
Luis makes a living selling drinks. He buys from a well known factory in the city and takes them to Chapare region and distributes them in stores in Quillacollo. He is requesting a loan to buy more inventory since he has orders and needs capital to fill them.

He lives with his mother who takes care of household chores while he helps with expenses. He is a responsible and hardworking person with great aspirations. One of his dreams is to be the largest distributor in the business.

loans.use: Working capital for inventory

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a mother from Hebron. She has three daughters and five sons. Jameela has been working in spinning wool for five years now to add another source of income to the big family. Jameela's husband has a small goat farm where he raises goats for sale, which is the family's primary source of income.

Jameela took a loan from FATEN to purchase wool fibers and spinning tools as well as goat feed to help her husband in his work.

Jameela is well known in the city where she lives for her beautiful and professional work, which she holds a sample of in the picture here.

loans.use: To purchase wool fibers and sheep feed

loans.name: Cecibel Del Rosario

texts.es:
Cecibel de 41 años, no está casada pero si tiene dos hijos. Para tener una actividad económica y no quedarse sola ella acepto la propuesta que le hizo una amiga en donde ella seria vendedora de productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). 

En la actualidad tiene 5 años  realizando su trabajo sola recorriendo las calles. Trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un valor muy económico. Ella tiene pensado seguir trabajando para asegurar su vejez. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere una actividad económica que no tenga que caminar mucho, por eso quiere tener una papelería y ya ha comenzado a comprar una vitina y cuadernos (aparece en la foto).
texts.en: Cecibel is 41 years old, isn't married and has two children. In order to make a living and not be alone she agreed to a friend's suggestion to start selling Yanbal-brand products (a business that lets enterprising women sell its products independently). She currently has five years' experience selling the products on the street.  She works from early in the morning offering the items to her friends and neighbors, selling perfume, lotions and deodorants at a good value. She plans to keep working to secure her retirement. With the loan, she wants to purchase Yanbal products such as perfumes, lotions and deodorants. In the future, she wants a job in which she doesn't have to walk as much, so she wants to have a stationery store and has already started buying a display case and notebooks (items that appear in the photo).

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and lotions

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos  hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical caracterizada por producir principalmente frutas como el mango,la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Roxana siempre trata de brindarle a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y un trato amable con lo cual se ha asegurado una clientela fidelizada durante el tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Roxana desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos, de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Roxana is a 26 year-old mother who lives together with her husband and two children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area with a semi-tropical climate which is noted for producing fruit such as mango, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Roxana has a small grocery store in her home.  She offers her neighbors and acquaintances a range of daily-use products, essentials and groceries.  Roxana always tries to provide her customers with good-quality products and good customer service which has gained her a loyal customer base over the time that she has been running her business.

Roxana also raises and sells young animals.  She uses the income that she makes from this business to help her husband with their family finances.  Roxana would like to expand her business, acquiring more products so that she can meet her customers' demands.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business, acquiring more products

loans.name: Lushaufan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Lushaufon; El socio tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, el socio trabaja comprando y vendiendo autos en Oropesa a comisión, el socio tiene a su hermano mayor en este negocio y así como el socio entro en el negocio ahora el está apoyando a su hermano y el invertirá el crédito para aumentar al capital de su hermano y hacerse socios para comprar un vehículo y luego lo venderán y se repartirán las ganancias o de lo contrario volverán a  invertir en otro autos mas en sociedad y de este saldrá las ganancias para ambos. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el aumento de capital para la compra de un vehículo y su futura venta.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lushaufon is a member of the "Ahorro es Progreso Choquetata-Tipon" (Saving is Progress Choquetata-Tipon) community bank which is located in Tipon district, in Cusco province and department.

Lushaufon is 22 years old and single.  He works buying and selling cars, on commission, in Oropesa.  His older brother is also in this business.  He is supporting his brother in the business and will invest his loan in increasing his brother's capital and in them becoming partners in buying a vehicle which they will then sell and split the profits, or they will re-invest in other vehicles together and their profits will come from that.

Lushaufon is requesting this loan to invest in increasing capital so that he can buy a vehicle which he will then sell.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in increasing his capital so that he can buy a vehicle which he will later sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman who lives in E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a junk shop, a drilling and plumbing business, and a business buying and selling Jeep parts. Her husband, Wilfred Ryan G., who is 37 years old years old, manages the junk shop business. They have a child who is 11 years old and is currently going to school. 

Agnes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Agnes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use as funds for the business operations, so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family and for her child’s education. Agnes is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: El Sr. Pablo Emilio G. C. él es trabajador activo de una empresa Contratista desempeñándose como Jardinero tiene cinco  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL   uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para sufragar unos gastos personales en su hogar, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Señor Pablo Emilio G. C. is an active employee of the company, Contratista.  He has worked there as a gardener for over five years.  He is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  He has had two credits with CEPRODEL.  One was for the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, and gravel and the other was to expand and improve his house.  The credit that he is currently seeking will be used towards personal, household costs.  The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited him and his family in many ways and have improved their quality of life.

loans.use: Pay off personal, household costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Siep's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village bank loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes. Mrs. Siep, born in 1959, was selected as the village bank president by its members. 

Mrs. Siep and her husband, Mr. Hay, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate different vegetables to make a living. They also earn income by selling morning glory. With their occupations, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Siep would like to ask for a loan to buy rice for food intake. The couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice for sustenance

loans.name: Jhimmy

texts.es: El señor Jhimmy trabaja como mecánico y tiene un pequeño taller donde arregla autos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de herramientas de mecánica para el arreglo de movilidades, para ampliar su taller y atender a más clientes; así podrá mejorar sus ingresos . Vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Jhimmy is a mechanic: he owns a small garage where he repairs cars. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy mechanical tools to repair vehicles, as well as to expand his garage in order to serve more customers and consequently increase his earnings. He lives in a rented house in the Villa Copacaban neighborhood of the city of La Paz; he is single and he has no children. This is the first cycle he is working with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy tools for his auto repair garage.

loans.name: Ondina

texts.es:
la sra. Ondina S. S. tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la colonia el Sitio de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa.
Ondina trabaja de niñera.
el credito lo utilizara para hacerle unas mejoras al baño de su casa, desea reparar la tuberia, repellar, pulir, poner ceramica, instalarle una puerta y poner un tanque para almacenar agua.
Ondina obtiene un salario mensual fijo por el trabajo de niñera, esta haciendo estas mejoras para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para su familia.
su meta es terminar de constriur su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
47-year old Sra. Ondina S. lives in the neighbourhood of El Sitio in the town of Teguicigalpa. She works as a nanny.

She plans to use the loan to make improvements to the bathroom in her house. She wants to repair the pipes, plaster the walls, install tiles, add a door, and put in a water storage tank. 

Ondina receives a regular monthly salary from her job as a nanny. She is making these improvements to her house so she and her family can have a better standard of living. Her goal is to gradually finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, pipes, tiles, a door, and a water tank

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fe works hard to support her family. She has a "Carenderia" (small restaurant) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Fe is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her Carenderia business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
If one wants to improve, she has to keep her eyes forward and act prudently. Rosalinda V., 46, learned this at a young age and aims to keep an eye on the future of her business and family. She has only finished high school, but looking forward, she has the rest of her life to spend with her husband, Florante, an aircraft maintenance personnel. Also, three bright futures are in their hands as they take care of three children. Together, they live in Silang, Cavite, Philippines.

Rosalinda owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells daily essentials such as shampoo, canned goods, and beverages. Aside from this store, she also has a small computer shop and a billiard shop, all located in their community. She has been in this micro business for three years now, and she earns around PHP11,000 monthly.

To help her continue running her business, she applied for a PHP30,000 loan. She will use this money to buy another computer to meet the demands of her clients. Also, she will purchase grocery items to add to her store shelves. Rosalinda is grateful for the help being extended to her business, as it is what keeps her family up and going every day.

Being a sari-sari store owner, it is difficult for her to follow up with customers who have long lists of debts. But Rosalinda continues to devise strategies to meet this difficulty. Rosalinda also aims to save enough for old age. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her variety store

loans.name: Nandakumari

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Nandakumari. She is married and has 4 children, aged 22. 21,13 and 11. In 2002, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, a loan from Patan BPW and used the funds to buy seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Dhankumari plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Afisa

texts.en:
Afisa is 52 years old, married and has nine children aged twelve to 32 years old. Apart from the eldest two children, her children are in school. Her husband sells soft drinks such as sodas while Afisa sells food stuffs such as small fish, and sunflower oil she gets from neighboring Burundi.

Afisa is in need of a loan to buy more fish and sunflower oil in order to make more of a profit. With her profits she plans to continue paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish and sunflower oil to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Ii Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty II se denomina al excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Olga, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 1° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa.
Ellas solicitan el credito para la compra de frutas y verduras, es decir, para adquirir las mercaderias que las mismas mujeres salen a vender. Desean poder tener mas productos que vender para poder asi atraer mas clientela y por medio de esto conseguir un poco mas de ingresos para ellas y sus familias.
Quieren un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que piensan que la situación actual es muy dificil.
texts.en:
Kuña Aty II is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Ita.  The group was formed thanks to the current director of the group, Olga, who contacted a loan advisor during a weekly meeting that she was holding in her area in order to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) program worked.  Once she had learned how the program worked, she managed to gather together a group of 15 women who are now working very happily on their first loan cycle.  They are working jointly and supportively within the program.

The ladies are requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables.  That is to say, they would like to acquire the merchandise that they go out and sell.  They would like to have more products to sell so that they can attract more customers and make a little more income for themselves and their families.  They would like their children to enjoy a better future since they believe that the current situation is very difficult.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Zachary is 34 years old. He is a hard working and honest business man. For the last 8 years he has been selling and repairing cell phones. He supplements the income from this venture by running a beauty shop. Previously, he was in farming. Zachary is married and blessed with a two-year-old child. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to open up a business for photocopying.

loans.use: To open up a photocopying business

loans.name: Pacifico

texts.es: El señor Pacifico nacido en Valle grande vive con doña Felicita no tiene hijos, el tiene su casa en la Guardia tiene su tierra en Quebrada Portuque a 4 km de la Guardia, el trabaja en la agricultura, siembra yuca, maíz tiene cítricos pero también se dedica a la crianza y ventas de chanchos, el destino del crédito es para siembra de yuca, y también para la compra de Chancos pequeños, el es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, su deseo es pronto tener hijos para así completar su familia,  se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. en la foto el Sr. Pacifico se encuentra en compañia de su pareja.
texts.en: Señor Pacifico was born in Valle Grande. He lives with Doña Felicita, and has no children. His house is in La Guardia, and his land is 4kn away in Quebrada Portuque. He works in agriculture, sowing yucca and maize. He also has citrus trees. He dedicates much of his time to raising and selling pigs. The loan is intended for planting yucca and for the purchase of piglets. He is a very hard-working person, always thinking of his family's well-being. He would like to have children soon to make his family complete. He is grateful to the institution for the support offered. In the photo you can see Señor Pacifico with his partner.

loans.use: To plant yucca and buy pigs.

loans.name: Margaret Wanjiru

texts.en: Margaret is 35 years old, single and has one child who is eighteen years old. She runs a shoe sales business at Gikomba in Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years now and she says her major challenge is financial constraints. Margaret is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy shoes to sell to the local people. She hopes to grow her business and start importing shoes from abroad. She sees herself improving her family's living standards and giving her son a good education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and committed to her work.

loans.use: Shoes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other equipment for the shop.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Siaka O.'s Group

texts.en:
Siaka (pictured right) is the leader of this group of teachers. Born 49 years ago in the eastern village of Malegohun, Siaka is married to a teacher and the couple has four children – three in primary school and one in secondary school. Siaka has been a professional teacher for 27 years now. He has requested a loan of 2,200,000 leones to invest in agriculture. He will use part to hire laborers and part to buy seeds to plant. 

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of borrowers from a primary school in Kenema, Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT seeking a loan of 14,600,000 to invest in things that their mere salaries cannot let them do. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment and pays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba has received her senior high school education. She is married and has five children. She assists her husband in supporting the family as part of her duties. 

Araba sells bags of charcoal as well as maize, gari, (a cereal made from cassava) and groundnut at Krofofordo. Araba has been selling charcoal for 20 years. 

Her loan will be used to obtain additional bags of charcoal to resell. She hopes to use the fresh profit to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to obtain additional bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 52, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Candido, a technician.  Of her five children, four are already working, while the youngest is in college. By the grace of God, she has managed to support all her children's educational needs. As of the present time she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her youngest child’s college education.

Corazon operates an appliances-repair shop. Her husband is the main technician, while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair and check-up of all types of appliances, like electric fans, washing machines, air-conditioners and others. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts of appliances. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Corazon hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts of appliances needed in her business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 29 years old, does tailoring and earns about $2.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $5 per day. They have two children, 5 and 2 years old, one of whom is studying. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for use in the family. She also wants to buy cheap fabric, but good quality, to make clothes to sell so that she can make more income for her family. She has planned to buy two more sewing machines at home and hire a worker to sew at her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for use in the family.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén es agricultor y maestro albañil; también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba de agua que mejorará el cultivo en sus tierras. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia Aroma; es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito tanto de Impro como de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Rubén is a farmer and master bricklayer. He also buys and sells cattle. His wife helps with the farming activities. With the money from this loan, he will be able to pay the cost of a water pump so that he can improve the crops on his land. Rubén lives in his own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. He is married and has five children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a water pump so that he can improve his crops.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora surge gracias a la ayuda D. otro comité que está trabajando en ese lugar. Actualmente está integrado por 17 mujeres, las cuales se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento D. cada una D. ellas, en un sentido integral, es decir, tanto en lo económico como en lo personal.
La Sra. Ignacia, presidenta del grupo, está domiciliada en la ciudad D. San Lorenzo, está casada, tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. bebidas D. todo tipo, como ser cervezas, whiskys, vinos, energizantes y otros. Comenta que tiene muchas ventas, en especial los fines D. semana, que es cuando tiene más salida sus productos. Por medio D. su esfuerzo y trabajo, ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar con los gastos D. la casa y manutención D. la familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cervezas, whiskys, vinos, energizantes y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y D. esa forma ofrecer más variedades a los clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Maria Auxiliadora  exists thanks to the help of another communal bank that is working in the area. Currently it consists of 17 women, who set as their main objective the growth of each one of them, in a holistic sense, personally as well as economically. 

Sra. Ignacia, president of the group, lives in the city of San Lorenzo. She is married and has 2 children. She sells all kinds of drinks such as beer, whisky, wine, energy drinks and others. She tells us that she has many sales especally at the weekends which is when she has the biggest turnover. Through her hard work and effort, she has been able to get ahead and help with the household expenses and support of her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy beer, whisky, wine, energy drinks and others, with which to stock her business and in this way offer her clients more variety.

loans.use: to buy beer, whisky, wines, energy drinks and others

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine works hard to support her family. Geraldine is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Geraldine requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en: Glenn is married with one child and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor. Glenn is a farmer, and she has backyard piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to purchase feed and medicines for her business. Glenn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months. In the future, Glenn would like to purchase more piglets from the profit of her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for her piggery business

loans.name: Phidiliah

texts.en:
Phidiliah is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is working. Her husband is a constructor who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Phidiliah has operated a motorcycle transportation business for the past three years; in addition she also sells cereals. Her potential clients are the local villagers. She faces a major challenge of the rising cost of fuel. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase spare parts and repair her motorcycle and also buy cereals for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair her motorcycle and also to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Tuyat

texts.en: Tuyat is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her husband is a chef, and her son is a student. She started her garment retailing business earlier this year. Although she's fairly new to the business, she already has regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that winter is here, she is requesting a loan of 1,150,000 MNT to buy warm garments to sell. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says: "I am finally doing something I love. I can see a bright future in my business, and it is very helpful to my family."

loans.use: to buy warm garments to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 35 years old and married. She has six children, with three in school. Mary Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Joy runs a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. Mary Joy has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Naim

texts.en: Mrs. Naim, 41, a humble farmer living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, is preparing a wedding party for her child in the next few weeks. The big day will arrive soon and Naim is worried about how to handle the party due to the lack of adequate funds. In order to better the situation, Naim is taking out her first loan from HKL to prepare a great wedding party for her second child. This loan will be the main funding to cover her expenses. In the future, Naim hopes to fix some parts of her house, especially the wall made of zinc, which currently has become decayed.

loans.use: to prepare a great wedding party for her second child.

loans.name: Marlito

texts.en:
This is Marlito, 56, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is a father to his three children. He manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marlito is a soft drinks dealer. He buys large quantities of soft drinks from soft drinks factory then sells it to different variety stores. His ability to please people gives him more and loyal customers. He also has an arcade shop.  He earns a minimum of 2800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of Soft drink variants to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Marlito hopes to expand his business in the coming years. He dreams to give all his children a good and quality education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of soft drink variants needed in his business.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en:
Kokou is a 41-year-old auto electrician in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He lives with his wife, who works in retail, and their four children. 

Kokou is seeking a fourth loan from WAGES, having fully repaid his previous three loans. He will use this loan of 600,000 FCFA to buy more batteries for resale. He buys batteries imported from Europe, and his primary difficulty is making sure that the batteries he buys are all high-quality. He plans to use his increased profits to reinvest in his shop and to increase his savings. He hopes in the future to continue to improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy car batteries for resale.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à la même église au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Charlotte Julienne Kaï, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Charlotte Julienne Kaï est âgée de 51 ans et est une veuve. Charlotte Julienne Kaï a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à sa charge. Charlotte Julienne Kaï vit avec ses enfants. Charlotte Julienne Kaï a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Charlotte Julienne Kaï exerce comme activité, la vente de friperies dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Charlotte Julienne Kaï désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Charlotte Julienne Kaï sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies.

loans.name: Deisy Vicenta

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Deisy, tiene  61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro jubilado.
Deisy es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo para ayudar con los gastos que genera su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, siempre aprovecha los créditos para ir a comprar y así a ella le sale más barato ya que compra al contado y de esta forma mejoran sus ganancias, son más de 17 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son necesarios para su vida. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.

loans.use: comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has been running this business for about 20 years. She started with the help of a family member that was living abroad who sent her $2 (50,000 sucres), which at the time went a very long way in Ecuador. Her husband passed away 32 years ago and she was left to raise her 6 children on her own. For a long time she was a seamstress and often worked all night in order to support her family. Today her children are all grown and two still live with her.

She runs this business because her children do not generate sufficient income to support her. She feels proud to be able to be independent and to be able to help her children. She is seeking the loan in order to continue diversifying her product line and to make some improvements to the shop. She currently sells a large variety of products for the home and also cosmetics for women.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new products to sell from her store

loans.name: Vaiutu

texts.en:
Vaiutu specializes in the preparation of baked taro, breadfruit and luau to sell at the local open air market.  She sells primarily to workers who purchase her products to take home for their children or elderly parents who remain home during the day.  The food is already prepared and proves to be a great convenience.

She makes approximately 150 tala per week, or more depending on the sales for the week.  She uses this money to provide for her family and to repay the current loan that she has from SPBDF.

Vaiutu is applying for another loan in the amount of $850 to enable her to purchase additional food supplies and building materials for her stall.

loans.use: To purchase Young  taro plant, coconuts, foil, tauaga,	(HI)= timber, iron roofing

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is 43 years old and is married with three children. One of them is a girl and the others are boys. To supplement her husband’s income, Farida runs a business selling various cookies by delivering them to several stores. Farida can sell 150 packs of cookies a day. For these sales, she can earn revenue of $12. Farida has been a member of MBK for almost two years. She needs additional working capital of $100, so that she can buy more cookie material to make more cookies, and thus more or less double her income.

loans.use: To buy more cookie material

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai, the mother ( 56 years old ), sells cakes and candies at home. Her son works as a day laborer which means that his income is uncertain. They cultivate 60 "green dragon" (fruit) plants. Their average income is $15 per month per person. Hai wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their garden, and they will pay back  the loan over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: invest in their "green dragon" fruit plants

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: "River fish and palm oil are consumable goods, hence the demand for this item is high," says Mrs. Mary O., who hails from Benin City of Edo State. She is 47 years old, married, and a mother of four (4) children. She hopes to get this loan for business expansion, i.e., to buy more river fish and palm oil for sale. She has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy more river fish, palm oil and Ogbonor for sale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel I. is 26 years old and lives with his father and child in the town of Carapeguá. Joel lost his mother early in life and thanks to the example of his hardworking father, has been able to continue moving forward and providing for the family. As both a student and a worker,Joel sacrifices a lot in order to achieve economic self-sufficiency.

Joel is well known in the area. He began working by establishing an office supply store, which he runs out of his house. Unfortunately, this business did not turn out as well as initially expected and he decided to change. He then began selling local crafts from a mobile stand. He has been doing this for the past three years.

Joel has requested a loan to buy bedding and clothing that he can sell from his stand. In this way he will be able to increase the variety and quantity of goods he sells and continue to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy bedding and clothing

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent owns a wholesale beverage depot in the village of Nansana. He is a distributor of sodas and beer which he sells in cases to retailers. Most villages have one distributor. He will purchase quantities of 200 cases at a time with 24 bottles to a case. A case of soda will cost him 9700 shillings, or about 400 shillings per bottle. He will then sell it to the retailer who will sell it to the customer for 500 shillings. So, the gross profit earned between both the wholesaler and the retailer is about 100 shillings per bottle. 100 shillings is about five cents.

Vincent has been a distributor since 1993. This is an excellent business, because you have a contract with the bottler and you have little competition. Sodas and beer are relatively inexpensive, and they offer a simple luxury that even the people of the villages can occasionally afford, although often alcohol is homemade. Vincent has been in operation since 1993 and with his lending group for the past nine years. With his loan, he plans on stocking more beverages. Eventually he would like to be able to afford a vehicle, buy some land, and build a house.

loans.use: Vincent plans to use his loan to buy more beverages for his wholesale business.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa Álvarez used to be an emergency nurse. She had to retire from doing this due to an accident she suffered which left her in poor health. Due to this, she had to find other ways to make a living. She began selling bakery goods/pastries out of her home. She has experience doing this since she would help her mother, who was a master when it came to baking.

Justa takes orders and also delivers her baked goods to the local schools in the area. She also works there as a temporary assistant/secretary in the evenings.

In her free time, she also provides all sorts of legal services such as birth certificates, college certificates, identification cards, etc. which provide her with some money.

At this time, Justa would like a loan to purchase main ingredients to bake a variety of pastries since school is starting, and this is the time when she makes the most money. She lives with her 2 sons and 2 grandchildren in the house she inherited from her father in-law.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Justa Álvarez, trabajó como enfermera auxiliar, actividad que tuvo que dejar a causa de un accidente que afectó mucho su salud. Por tal motivo tuvo que dedicarse a otra actividad, como es la repostería, trabajo que realiza desde su domicilio y aplicando las enseñanzas de su madre quien era maestra en técnicas de repostería. Generalmente justa trabaja a pedido, llevando sus productos al centro educativo donde también cumple funciones de secretaria auxiliar del magisterio en el turno de la noche. En su tiempo libre se dedica a realizar todo tipo de tramites, como ser certificados de nacimiento, títulos de bachiller, cédulas de identidad y otros que le representan siempre un ingreso pequeño. Actualmente Justa precisa de capital para poder incrementar la variedad de sus productos en repostería, la compra de insumos es vital para poder dar continuidad a su negocio, puesto que la temporada de inicio de clases esta cerca, y es una temporada ideal para generar recursos para su subsistencia, tomando en cuenta que sus dos hijos y sus dos nietos viven con ella en la casa que les dejó su suegro.

loans.use: To purchase more bakery ingredients

loans.name: Kireka A3(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose N..  She is currently in the business of matooke selling and is requesting a loan of UGX 800000 to increase the stock in the business.  Rose is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a doctor.  She has 5 children ranging from age 6 to 16 and her children go to school.  Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education.  Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in the matooke business and the loan was paid back on time.  Rose is joined in her small group by Florence N., Solome M., Jane N., and Margret N..  

Florence N. is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to expand the business.  Solome M. is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more matooke for sale.  Jane N. is also requesting a loan of UGX 500000 to re-invest in the business.  Margret N. is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more food supplies.

loans.use: To re-invest in the food business

loans.name: Satupaitea Pitonuu Centre Group 2

texts.en: This is the second group that joined the SPBD program in the village of Satupaitea Pitonuu.  Just like the first group, these women belong to fishing households.  Their husbands and sons go out to the sea to fish, while the women sell the fish in the village or at the Salelologa Central market.  They have undergone the required 4 sessions of training from SPBD.  These sessions taught them how to plan a business, manage their household finances, and build up savings.  With their initial loans, they will buy newer fishing gears to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fishing canoes, torches, nets, spears, hooks and other fishing gear

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
Gloria sells shoes by catalog, a business she began two years ago, selling at first to her colleagues at her husband’s work and to her friends. Her husband is a welder in a business, and she wishes to support him in paying the household expenses, primarily the schooling of their two children ages 8 and 4, in addition she would like to renovate their home to be more comfortable for her family.

She is asking for US$250 loan, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and fill pending orders for the next season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo este negocio lo incio hace dos años, vendiendo primero a los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo y sus amistades, su marido trabaja como soldador en una empresa, ella deseaba apoyarlo con los gastos familiares principalmente escolares de sus dos pequeños de 8 y 4 años, además deseaba acondicionar mejor su casa para ofrecerle mas comodidad a su familia.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir pedidos pendientes de la próxima temporada.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fatma's Mungo Yupo Group

texts.en:
Fatma, aged 40, is divorced with nine children (aged 23, 20, 18, 16, 14, 11, and 10). She owns a stand where she makes and sells chapatis from 6am to 6pm daily. From this business, which she started 9 months ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $25.

Fatma hopes for a loan to purchase more food ingredients to make chapatis. She will share this loan with Sada. Both of them are members of the loan group, Mungo Yupo. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make chapatis

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica has handbags made which she has distributed to diverse stores for 10 years. She buys the material for the party handbags, and she sends them to be made by an acquaintance. Weekly, she sells a dozen handbags to the stores that sell evening dresses in the center of Lima.

3 years ago, Angélica had a store where she sold the handbags, but she had to leave it because the rent was very expensive.

The loan that she has requested will serve for the purchase of materials for the handbags.

Angélica would like to put a wine cellar or phone booth in her house so that she would not have to leave her house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica manda hacer carteras y las reparte a diversas tiendas desde hace 10 años. Ella compra el material para las carteras de fiesta, y las manda a hacer donde un conocido. Semanalmente, ella vende una docena de carteras a las tiendas de vestidos de noche del centro de Lima.

Hace 3 años, Angélica tenía una tienda donde vendía las carteras, pero tuvo que dejarlo porque el alquiler estaba muy caro.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para la compra de materiales de las carteras.

A Angélica le gustaría poner una bodega o locutorio en su casa para así no tener que salir de su casa.

loans.use: To buy materials for making handbags to sell.

loans.name: Vech

texts.en:
Mrs. Vech M. is a subsistence farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. She cultivates twice a year. During the rainy season, Mrs. Vech M. cultivates rice, while during the dry season, she grows vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Try Men, helps her out with the farming in his spare time from working in a kiln.

In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Vech M. now wants to start a cow breeding business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan. Mrs. Vech M. is a 38 year old mother of four children, three of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is too young to work or enrol in school. Her husband is shown in the left of the photo.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business in order to improve her family income.

loans.name: Angel Máximo

texts.es:
Ángel is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since childhood. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate stable income. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well-fed. He sells both the milk they produce, as well as the grasses that he cultivates on his land. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of one animal and to buy fertilizers, as this season he would like to plant potatoes, corn, wheat and barley. Please help support Ángel’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel es muy exigente en su trabajo, es agricultor desde su niñez, hoy como jefe de familia, trabaja incesantemente para generar recursos económicos estables, trabaja cuidando de sus animales, se levanta muy temprano para recoger pastos, de esa manera los tiene bien alimentados, para la producción de la leche, que vende y también vende el pasto que producen sus campos. Él está solicitando el presente préstamo para la compra de un animal y para la compra de abono, esta temporada quiere sembrar papa, maíz, trigo y cebada. Apoya el esfuerzo de Ángel para seguir superándose.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and additional fertilizer for his land.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros is 30 years old. She lives with her son who's 7 years old and her husband.

She raises guinea pigs and she attends to her farm daily which she runs out of her home. The reason why she decided to do this was because her brother-in-law is a zoo technician and he has supported her in how to take care of her animals. She remembers that she only started with 100 guinea pigs and she now has 300 of them. She grows alfalfa in her land to feed the guinea pigs. A private company purchases the guinea pigs from her monthly, but they prefer to buy males weighing more than 2 lbs. She has been able to find more clients such as government institutions.

Milagros is very motivated because she wants to move ahead in life and to be able to offer a good life to her son. She's requesting this loan because she wants to invest it in the farm by installing new corrals.

Translated by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, a Kiva Volunteer.

Milagros tiene 30 años, en la actualidad vive con su hijo de 7 años y su esposo. Atiende diariamente su granja de cuyes, que ha instalado en su propia casa, la razón para que pueda iniciar su negocio fue porque vio la oportunidad y posibilidad de hacerlo, su cuñado es zootecnista y desde que se empezó la apoyó en la orientación técnica de los cuidados en su granja, recuerda que con 100 cuyes y ahora cuenta con más de 300 cuyes, para alimentarlos cultiva la alfalfa en sus tierras, la razón de su rentabilidad, se debe a que una organización no gubernamental le compra periódicamente sus cuyes, cuyo estándar exigido son machos de un kilo, además, está adquiriendo más clientes, como una municipalidad u otras instituciones. Milagros está motivada porque desea seguir adelante, para superarse y darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo. Solicita este préstamo porque desea invertir en el mejoramiento de su granja, instalando nuevos corrales.

loans.use: To invest it in a guinea pig farm

loans.name: Silvia
