texts.es: Silvia de 24 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, quienes son la razón de seguir adelante, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de golosinas y frutas, su esposo Abdiel la apoya en todas sus aspiraciones, él es trabajador dependiente. Silvia no solo se dedica a la venta de estos productos, sino también en sus ratos libres cose y confecciona ropa para niños y adultos, todo esto lo hace por sus hijos a quienes ama mucho. Para que en un mañana sean los profesionales que espera ver.Silvia  quiere incrementar su venta de golosinas y frutas y construir posteriormente un kiosco para venderlos, ella tiene muchas ideas de negocio, y para eso necesariamente estima de un capital que levantará sus ganas de seguir adelante y ver crecer su venta.
texts.en:
Silvia is 24 years old and has three children who are her reason for getting ahead. She has dedicated herself to selling candies and fruit for a long time. Her husbnad Abdiel supports her in all her aspirations and also works as a salesclerk. Silvia does not just dedicate herself to selling these products. In her free time, she also makes clothing for children and adults. She does all of this for her children whom she loves very much so that in the future they will be the professionals she hopes to see them become. Silvia wants to increase her sale of candies and fruits and build a kiosk where she can sell these products. She has a lot of ideas for her business which is why she needs money to elevate her desire to get ahead and to see her sales increase.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of candies and fruits that she sells and build a kiosk for their sale.

loans.name: Gladis Elvira

texts.es:
Al ser 8 personas las que viven en su casa (esposo,2 hijos, 2 nietos y otros familiares) la señora Elvira es el principal sostén económico, sin embargo, no es mucho lo que recauda a partir D. sus 2 negocios, siempre tienD. a serle insuficiente el dinero a la hora D. adquirir los insumos necesarios y, por enD., sus ingresos no suelen incrementarse como realmente pudieran. A pesar D. su edad, ella sigue siendo el sustento D. todos sus hijos y nietos, siendo la persona con más responsabilidad en su hogar pero ella no declina ante nada, continúa su escarpado camino hacia la obtención D. una calidad D. vida adecuada para sus menores nietos, especialmente.

Requiere D. 1100 soles para tan noble labor, que le permitiría alcanzar sus sueños como madre y como abuela.
texts.en:
Though 8 people live in her home (her husband, two children, two grandchildren and other relatives), Mrs. Elvira provides the principal economic income for the family. In spite of running two businesses, she doesn't earn enough to support them all and always comes up short at the time of making basic purchases for the family. Her income has not increased sufficiently to meet the family's needs as she would have liked. In spite of her age, she is still the one who provides primary sustenance for her children and grandchildren, being the most responsible person in her home. However, she doesn't give up but continues her steep climb towards obtaining a more adecuate quality of life for her grandchildren. She needs a loan of $375 which will help her to realize her dreams as a mother and grandmother.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Financing of her businesses: sequined handicrafts and shoe sales

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina’s family lives beside the famous Lullutan River in Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela, across the Cagayan River (the longest river in the Philippines). She manages her own sari-sari store (local term for community-based variety store) in their village. She is married to a construction worker and is blessed with three children. Her husband’s job does not yield a stable income since working in a construction firm is only contractual.

In order to continue the operation of her store, Cristina approached a local MFI (micro finance institution) and asked for a loan of Php7,000 to increase her working capital. This will be used to purchase more stock including vegetables, fish, pork and poultry. Cristina believes that the more variety of products that is available in her store, the more daily sales and income she will gain. It will be of great help to them if this loan would be granted because she can grow her business and from its income she can support one of her children who is in college right now.

The client also believes firmly in the power of God.  Through faith, prayer and a closer relationship with Him, accompanied with hard work and dedication to her business, nothing is impossible.

loans.use: additional working capital (buy vegetables, fish, pork, meat and poultry)

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. She lives in Belaya Tserkov where she owns two vending locations in two different markets of her hometown. One is in the central marketplace and the other is at a local market called “Pischanyi”. Olga has been in business for 10 years, and she offers quality service that attracts many customers. 

Olga is requesting a 5,000 Grivna (about $875) loan that will be paid back in 12 months. She has just given birth to her second child. While she was pregnant, she couldn’t run her business she wasn't able to tend her business as diligently as she usually does. She will use her loan to get her business back to it's best working order by purchasing new inventory.  Olga's good character and strong business skills will enable her to expand and strengthen her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Tuychi

texts.ru: Туйчи закончив свой кредит решил получить очередной займ для покупки баранов.Сам Туйчи по специальности строитель.Но в зимнее время года он занимается только откормом и продажей скота.С чего у него и продвигается жизнь.при мониторинге мы убедились что кредит пошёл ему в пользу, у него увеличилось количество скота.
texts.en:
After paying off a previous loan, Tuychi resolved to take out another loan for the purchase of sheep. By trade, Tuychi is a builder, but in wintertime he only raises livestock for market, and he is able to get by on that. When we visited, we saw that the loan had been of assistance to him, that he had increased the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Сattle

loans.name: Savenco

texts.en: Savenco V. is 30 years old and he lives in Cantemir district, Chioselia village. His business is growing grapes and he has been in business for more than 10 years. He really likes the job he does and wants to be involved in this business in the future. He wants to expand his business so he needs a loan to cultivate the land for more production in the future. So, he will use the loan to increase his working capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Hà, năm nay 37 tuổi, ở Kim Động. Chồng chị mất sớm và chị phải nuôi hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2004, với số vốn vay ban đầu là 500.000 đ đầu tư vào bán hàng ăn sáng. Hiện tại chị Hà đang kinh doanh nước giải khát, đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị  với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng . Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10.000.000 để mua thêm hàng về bán nhằm mở rộng  quy mô kinh doanh tăng thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi H. is 37 years old, living in Kim Dong. Her husband passed away early, and she is left raising two small school aged children. She joined TYM Fund in 2004. Her first loan was 500,000 VND to invest in a breakfast food stand. Currently, she sells refreshment, which gives her family an income of 2,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more supplies to expand her business, and increase the source of income for her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.es: La señora Tarcila tiene 50 años, es casada y vive con sus tres hijos quienes apoyan a su madre en los gastos de su casa. Como toda madre, anheló bien educar a sus hijos, lo cual fue su prioridad y por lo que cada mañana salía a trabajar, pero con el paso del tiempo su hijo mayor vio la necesidad y las ganas de trabajar de su madre y al graduarse utilizó los ahorros de su trabajo para instalar en su casa unas cabinas para el servicio de Internet, dando a su madre la oportunidad de administrar su propio negocio; negocio que ya tiene 6 años y en el que atiende muy alegremente. Pero su espíritu  emprendedor la impulsó a instalar también un locutorio al costado de sus cabinas, el cual se convirtió en una ayuda de comunicación para sus vecinos y el incremento de sus ganancias económicas. Para el futuro Tarcila desea seguir ampliando sus servicios y anhela instalar una botica en la esquina de su casa, ya que sus hijas estudiaron farmacia y sería un servicio más que pueda brindar a sus vecinos. Hace 4 años que trabaja con MFP, este es su octavo préstamo, se siente muy contenta en formar parte de su banco comunal, pues ahí encontró el respaldo de la institución y de sus compañeras que unánimemente trabajan para el bienestar del todo el grupo. Con la cantidad que está solicitando comprará algunas computadoras, además, las que ya tiene  requieren de mantenimiento e invertirá en cada una 100 soles. Con esto espera mejorar el servicio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Tarcila is 50 years old and married, and lives with her three children, who help their mother with household expenses. Like every mother, she longed to give her children a good education. Since it was her top priority, she went to work every morning. But over the course of time her eldest son became aware of the need and was eager to work. When he graduated he used his savings from his work to install some internet stations in their house, giving his mother the opportunity to run her own business. The business is 6 years old now and she manages it happily. But her entrepreneurial spirit inspired her to install telephone booths beside the computers, which has helped her neighbors with their communications and increased her earnings. In the future, Tarcila would like to continue expanding her services, and would like to install a pharmacy in the corner of the house, since her daughters studied pharmacy and it would be an additional service to provide her neighbors. She's been working with MFP for four years, and this is her eighth loan. She feels very happy to be part of her communal bank, since she receives support from the organization and from the other members, who work together for the good of the whole group. With the requested sum, she will buy some computers, and will also invest 100 soles each in the maintenance of the computers she already has. She hopes in this way to improve the service she offers her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers and maintain the ones she has

loans.name: Nuridin

texts.en:
D. Nuridin is 25 years old. He is selling DVD disks. He orders the delivery of the disks from Russia and tries to have all new movies, concerts of the popular actors, singers and others. He is also providing computer services such as audio editing of video tapes and disks with records of his clients' family events. Nuridin tries to use modern up-to-date technologies in his work so he can satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. The business is successful in generating a good income for his family. Today he requests $400 US Dollars. He is planning to purchase a lot of DVD disks to increase the range of his goods for sale. Nuridin thanks all who are supporting him and promises to be accurate in loan payment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of DVD disks

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: Celina tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa propia, esto en la localidad de Villa los Reyes en Lima. Desde muy joven se inclinó por las actividades relacionadas con la creatividad, es así que decidió estudiar cosmetología, implementando su propio negocio, el cual se encuentra en su casa. Esto le facilita el trabajo, ya que además de atender a sus clientes, puede pasar tiempo con sus hijos, los cuales muchas veces la ayudan alcanzándole algunos materiales durante su trabajo. Felizmente su negocio es muy concurrido y nunca le falta trabajo, haciéndolo muy rentable, por lo que Celina tiene muchas esperanzas de expandirlo comprando más materiales y herramientas para su salón de belleza. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todas sus cuotas, ya que sabe que la puntualidad es muy importante si se quiere progresar y salir adelante. Con el dinero solicitado comprará materiales para expandir su salón de belleza y hacerlo más cómodo para su clientela.
texts.en:
Celina is 38 years old and she lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. They live in the Villa los Reyes neighborhood of Lima. Celina has been drawn to creativity since she was a young girl, which is why she decided to study cosmetology. She started a business in her home. This is helpful because she can attend to her clients while spending time with her children. Her children often help her by getting materials when she is working. Happily, her business is very popular and she always has work. This makes it very profitable. Therefore, Celina wants to expand. She wants to buy more materials and tools for her beauty salon. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments since she knows that punctuality is very important and she wants to progress and get ahead. With the money requested, she will buy materials to expand her beauty salon and make it more comfortable for her clientele

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su salón

loans.name: Catherin's Group

texts.en: Catherin owns a small general store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns about $270 a month, and works for 12 hours a day. She is applying for her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her inventory and increase sales. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase profits and grow her business.  Catherin is 38 years old, married and has three children, ages 13, 10 and 7.  She will share this loan with her fellow group member, Feda, who owns her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Lilian M., the married mother of four school-aged children, is from the town of Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte, where she owns and operates a business growing crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately Php 3,500 a month.

In 2006, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of Php 10,000 from PMPC, used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow, she is now requesting a new loan of Php10,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Lilian’s fifth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the resulting additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ara Puahu Group

texts.en:
This committee Ara Puahu formed due to the internal problems of another committee, which dissolved.  Some of the women from that group decided to form the committee Ara Puahu in order to continue investing in their small businesses and to be able to progress and improve their families’ quality of life through the Fundación Pargauaya’s program.  The committee is now in their second cycle and is made up of 15 women who work in their own respective businesses. 

1	María D. C. D.- Hair salon 
2	Norma D.-	General store 
3	Myrian Galeano-	General store 
4	Melissa A.-	Shoe sales 
5	Celba O.- Food sales 
6	Cornelia S.- Food sales 
7	Fermina S.- General store 
8	María Raquel B.- Food sales 
9	Zulma H.- Cosmetics sales 
10	Timotea G.-  Food sales 
11	Crispina G.-	Dressmaker 
12	Cirila N. A.- Beverage sales 
13	Melina N.- Cleaning product sales 
14	María Juana M.-  General store 
15	Liz Liliana F.- Small grocery store

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for sale and of raw materials.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita B. is from the village of Sto. Ñino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old. Lolita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a sari-sari or general store where she sells food and daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Wencit

texts.en:
Wencit D. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 36, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Wencit owns & operates a business selling rice in the local community. Wencit has had her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Wencit joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wencit repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. Wencit is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Elvira Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia Elvira es natural del Cusco y vive en el barrio de pamtipata, en la letra 204.

Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad, es casada con el socio también, Oscar Carlos, ellos tienen 2 hijos y alternan sus diferentes actividades con el empleo que ella tienen en el instituto nacional de cultura en Cusco y a su ves la socia tiene un pequeño terreno el cual lo siembra  cada año con maíz, al cosechar ella vende parte de su cultivo y con otra se queda para hacer uso en su hogar. La socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir como capital de trabajo en algunos proyectos con su esposo.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member [of the community bank], Elvira, is a native of Cusco, and she lives in the Pamtipata neighborhood in number 204. Elvira is 54 years old and is married to another bank member, Oscar Carlos. They have 2 children and alternate the different activities that come with Elvira's job at the Instituto Nacional de Cultura in Cusco, and at the same time she has a small plot of land that she sows with corn each year. At the harvest, she sells part of her crop, and the rest remains for her household use. Elvira is requesting a loan to be able to invest it as working capital for a few projects along with her husband. This member is thankful for and recognizes the value of this loan, and she pledges to follow its repayments according to the outlined plan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Use

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando R. Z. vive en Armenia municipio del departamento de Sonsonate. Orlando siempre ha sido un joven soñador y emprendedor, y a pesar de tener tan solo 32 años es ya cabeza de su familia, y mantiene a su esposa y dos hijos. El negocio familiar es una panadería que administran en su propia casa, y donde trabajan y colaboran todos los miembros de la familia Z.. Orlando solicita un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima, para hacer crecer su negocio familiar cada vez un poco más.
texts.en:
Orlando R. Z. lives in the town of Armenia, which is in the district of Sonsonate. He has always dreamed of becoming an entrepreneur. At 32 years of age, he is the head of his family and supports his wife and two children. His bakery is a family operated business that he manages from his home. Every member of the Z. family works in the business and helps one another. Orlando is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients in bulk so that he can grow his family business a little more each time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: 021 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"Hồng N. Thị is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Hồng is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 21 (021 Quảng Hưng).

Hồng is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Hồng owns and operates a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Hồng has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1400000 (~80$) VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hồng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2442600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her seventh loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hồng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Nhâm (63) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2.  N. Thị Bo (29) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  N. Thị Xuân (23) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:  The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hồng N. Thị (57) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hồng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 21 (021 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hồng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hồng kiếm được khoảng 1400000 VND.  Vào 2005, Hồng đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hồng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2442600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6000000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Nhâm (63) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  N. Thị Bo (29) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  N. Thị Xuân (23) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Makra

texts.en: Mrs. Makra C. is a farmer in Prey Moul village in Takeo province. She owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she needs some money to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field and fertilizer to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of money to buy pig food for her first child’s breeding pigs business. Her husband, Mr. Touch Saroin, is traditional musician. Mrs. Makra C. is 39 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a pig breeder while the others two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan for plowing on the rice field, to buy fertilizer, and pig food for her first child’s breeding pigs business.

loans.name: Teresita Del Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresita del Jesús I. N. es socia del Banco Comunal Everes ubicado  en la comunidad de Palo  Quemado en la provincia de Manabí un lugar tranquilo donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura.

Teresita está casada hace 22 años vive junto a su esposo y dos nietas que las crió desde muy pequeñitas porque su hija falleció hace nueve años asumiendo ella la responsabilidad de cuidar a las niñas.

Teresita debe distribuir su tiempo entre los quehaceres del hogar, el cuidado de sus nietas, su criadero de gallinas criollas, además todos los días debe trasladarse a Portoviejo porque trabaja en casa de un familiar haciendo la limpieza y cuidando dos niños pequeños hasta las tres de la tarde. 

Teresita y su esposo comparten actividades en su pequeña granja,  sobre todo él se encarga de comprar los pollos para la cría,  con el nuevo préstamo que recibirán de la Fundación  van a  comprar más pollos,  alimentos  como maíz, balanceado y además vacunas y vitaminas para su crianza.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresita de Jesús I. N. is a member of the Everes Community Bank, located in the community of Palo Quemado, in the Manabí province, a quiet place where people are in the agriculture industry. Teresita has been married for 22 years and lives with her husband and two granddaughters who she has raised since they were small, since her daughter passed away nine years ago and she took responsibility for caring for the girls. Teresita distributes her time between household duties, caring for her granddaughters, raising her Creole chickens, and every day she also travels to Portoviejo because she works in a house where she does the cleaning and cares for the children until three in the afternoon. Teresita and her husband share the activities in their small farm, wherein he buys the chickens. With the loan from the Foundation, they will be able to buy more chicken, food such as corn, balance and vaccines and vitamins for chickens' growth.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, food such as corn, balance, vaccines and vitamins for her animals.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 40 years old and is from the village of District 2, San Manuel, Isabela. She wants to borrow PHP 15,000 to maintain her business. She works in retail, and grinds coconuts. Her business helps her provide for her children's education. 

Nila dreams that, through her business, she will be able to allow her children to complete their studies. Her business is also helping her to support her family's expenditures. Thanks to the help and support of her husband in managing their business, she has been doing this for fifteen years.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy Q. is from Silangga Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Lucy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lucy owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services to local community members. Lucy has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a very hardworking woman. She is 37 years old and a widow with 3 children. She sells cosmetics and hair extensions at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, she is able to meet the basic needs of her family. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more cosmetics to sell. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Edelmira Leonor

texts.es:
La señora EDELMIRA LEONOR G. V. tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE FATIMA . La socia presenta estudios  secundarios completos, es casada y tiene 1 mayor e independiente. 
La socia se dedica a la preparación y venta de menú en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò arroz, menestras, fideos, azúcar, pollo, aceite, papas, etc.  para la elaboraciòn de la comida que vende.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà platos, mesas y sillas para su local. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
EDELMIRA LEONOR G. V. is 56 years old and lives in the MOCHE district of the Trujillo province, located in La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the VIRGEN DE FATIMA cooperative bank. This member completed her secondary studies, is married, and has one grown child that lives independently. She dedicates herself to food preparation and sales in her home. She used her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles to buy rice, vegetables, noodles, sugar, chicken, cooking oil, potatoes, etc., to make the foods she sells. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,500.00 soles with which she will buy plates, tables, and chairs for her store. She dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and plates.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a married man with four children: three boys and one girl, all of whom are attending school.

Ismail has a shop where he sells fruits, vegetables, frozen meat and chicken. His shop is located in a very good location where it is the only shop in that area that sells such products. Isamil appears in the photo at his shop where he is slicing some goat meat.

Isamil requested 3,000 USD from FATEN to pay some debts he owes to the merchants who provide him with the goods for his shop. In addition to that, he will use some of the loan to pay for new goods.

loans.use: To pay some debts to merchants and to buy new goods

loans.name: Nasi

texts.en: Mrs. Nasi E. is 41 years old. She lives in the village of Prey Khla in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She also breeds pigs in the house. Since her breeding is doing well, she wants to increase and expand it. So, Mrs. Nasi E. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food. With the rest of the loan, she will buy equipment to make palm sugar. Her husband, Mr. Samart Toem, collects juice from palm trees. Mrs. Nasi E. is the mother of five children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, and the others are students at a local school. (Her husband appears on the left in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. V. is 57 and the mother of one school-aged child and three who are married and live independently. She is a farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for many years. Her husband, a supervisor, helps her run the enterprise. In addition, V. digs a pond behind her house where she raises small fish which she sells when they are mature. Recently, she has needed more money to supply her fish-raising business, so she is requesting a loan of $1100. She proposes to use any remaining money from the loan to buy an old motor to get around.

loans.use: To supply her fish-raising business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. sells bananas, plantains and firewood at Elmina.  Ama has no educational background.  She is married and has six dependents. 

Ama has been selling plantains, bananas and firewood for some time now. She helps her husband in the general up-keep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other additional food supplies like maize and yams for sale to meet the demand of her customers. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy other additional food supplies like maize and yams

loans.name: Farid Ahmad

texts.en:
Farid Ahmad is 30 years old, married and the father of two children. He is educated and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the one who is responsible for his whole family. He has a catering shop and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, but he hasn't been able to enlarge his business. Now he needs a loan to expand his catering shop and make a good monthly income for his family.

Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis. With this loan he wants to buy necessary items for his shop. He would like to thank all lenders, Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy necessary items for his catering shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more blocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is from the village of Lucsoon Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables such as okra, string beans, etc. for sale . Elizabeth has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting her 7th loan, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new sewing machines and supplies for his work

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 45 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 9 and 22. Four of the children are currently attending school.

She is a farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya. She has been practising mixed farming for the past 22 years and has employed one person from her community. Her main products are milk, bananas, beans, maize, tea and coffee which she sells locally. Her biggest challenge in farming is too much rain, which destroys her crops, and animal diseases.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of Kes.30,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her to pay school fees for her children and to improve their living standards.

In 5 years time she hopes to improve her productivity by purchasing more cows and expanding her farm. She intends to incorporate poultry farming in her activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Poem's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Poem M. is 59 years old and the leader of a group loan. She was selected by its four members who are located in Chrey Tnoat village in Takeo province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Poem M. and her husband, Mr. Touch Nouch, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Besides farming, Mrs. Poem M. is also a pig breeder at home and is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support her pig breeding business, Mrs. Poem M. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her farming crop. This couple has three children; one is a goldsmith and the other two are students and help their parents with their businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI III  est composé de 10 femmes mariées du village de  Ziekan dans la préfecture de San, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, ayant  en moyenne 35 ans, au moins 7 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ziekan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
SANY D. compte utiliser pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ai de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail , souvent en gros, au comptant à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs et consommateurs..
SANY D. compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de sa production agricole, un bénéfice de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi III group consists of 10 married women from the village of Ziekan in San prefecture, Segou region (Mali's Fourth Administrative District). They live in traditional extended families. On average, each is 35 and has at least seven children. They are peanut farmers. Hoping to make more profit from farming, the group decided to sign up with Soro Yiriwaso three years ago, and are receiving their third seasonal loan after repaying their previous loans properly. Sany D. plans to use her loan to buy seed peanuts, small tools, and fertilizer in the big market in Kimparana. After the rains end, the harvest is stored long enough to increase in value and be sold in the big market of Kimparana and M'peresso and nearby markets at retail (often, wholesale) to to both resellers and consumers. Sany D. is counting on making a profit of 100,000 CFA after her produce is sold. She will use the money to pay loan interest and day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seed and small tools

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A. is from the village of Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Fe is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana lives in a big city called Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan. She is 36 years old and has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. Rehana couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions. Now one of her son works in the field as a farmer. 

Rehana works in the fruit and vegetable market to support her family financially. She sells vegetables and seasonal fruits there to contribute financially to her family. 

Her husband sells milk; he has been in that  business for the past ten years. He puts milk in milk jars and uses his motorbike to deliver it to door to door. 

Rehana has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a buffalo to increase milk production. She is very confident that a new young buffalo will be a great addition to the business of her husband and he will be able to sell a larger quantity of milk, which will obviously makes him more income. 

Rehana has a plan to construct a room for the cattle so her husband keeps his buffalos in there. She is hopeful that increased profits will help her achieve her plan to keep the buffalos safe from heat and rain. 

She is a regular user of Asasah. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has always paid installments on time and proved to be a very responsible client.

Note: In this photo, Rehana is showing her vegetables happily.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Evelinda Del Carmen

texts.es: La  Sra. Evelinda del Carmen C. H. ella es Trabajadora del Hotel Barceló Monte limar  desempeñándose como Ama de llaves tiene  cuatro  año de trabajar para esta empresa es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los  créditos con la institución  le ha beneficiado en gran manera para mejorar su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Evelinda del Carmen C. H. works at the Barceló Montelimar Hotel as a housekeeper. She has worked at this hotel for four years. She is currently married. Evelinda has had two loans with Ceprodel and has used them to purchase construction materials and improve her house. The loans have been a great help to her in improving living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, piedrin to build a wall

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel N. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent, in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. His wife works in a cafe while his two children, 14 and 8, both attend a local secondary school. Altangerel operates a taxi service in his local community. He has been driving a vehicle for 20 years and since 2005, he started his taxi service. 

Over the many years of operation, he has provided a fast, good and reliable service to his customers. For the future, he plans to purchase one more car. Altangerel is a very honest and hardworking man. He says "I want to do some construction on my house where my family live".  He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to renovate his house.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Annbelle

texts.en:
Annbelle P. is 46 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Del Pilar in the municipality of Cabatuan in Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Annbelle makes and sells fish balls, other dim sums, corn bits and legumes such as peanuts and green peas for snacks to the local community. Annbelle is just starting this business.

In 2010, Annbelle joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Annbelle is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to buy additional inventory and add to her working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and add to her working capital.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La  Sra. Águeda  es separada, tiene un hijo  en edad escolar.
 .
Ella  se dedica al alquiler de casa y piezas  en la zona de Ciudad del Este,  siendo un negocio de acceso a una clientela constante, lo que colabora con que sea rentable.

Es una persona destacada por su responsable conducta en cuanto al cumplimiento de sus obligaciones, tanto en el ámbito familiar como laboral.

El préstamo al cual ha accedido le mejorar las piezas que ella alquila, y esto le ayudo a mejorar el servicio que ella ofrece.
texts.en:
Ms. Águeda is a separated mother with one child of school age.

She rents out houses and rooms in the Ciudad del Este area: it is a profitable activity that can count on recurrent customers.

She is a person known for the respectable way in which she fulfills her tasks, both in the family and in working field.

The loan she is requesting will be used to make improvements to the rooms she rents out, as this will help her improve the service she offers.

loans.use: To make improvements to the houses and rooms she rents out.

loans.name: Gioconda Lisseth

texts.es:
GIOCONDA LISSETH Z. A., trabaja como Jefe de Despacho en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. es madre de familia de un niño y este se encuentra en edad escolar.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de zinc, madera, pintura y mano de obra para su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Gioconda works as the head dispatcher at the National University of Engineering. She is a mother with a school-aged son.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy zinc, wood, paint and workers who will work on her house.

loans.use: She is going to use the money to replace the roof and door of her house.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: Rolando José, está casado y vive con sus 2 hijos. El quiere invertir en la compra de productos lácteos. Además, en su finca produce este tipo de productos y es buena producción. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su negocio desde hace 8 años, quiere crecer como un productor de la zona. Es el primer préstamo que recibe, ya que lo hace con fin de mejorar su negocio. El tiene como meta llegar a generar ganancias para su bienestar propio y de su mujer en el futuro y seguir creciendo en el negocio de la producción de leche y también crecer como persona.
texts.en: Rolando José is married and lives with his 2 children.  He would like to invest in buying dairy products.  He also produces this type of product on his property and it is a good production.  He has been in this business for 8 years.  He would like to grow as an area producer.  This is his first loan and he is taking the loan to improve his business.  His goal is to make profits for his own well-being and that of his wife.  In the future he would like to continue growing in his milk production business and also continue growing as a person.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas al Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la señora estudió educación superior.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 5 meses, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 100.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de picarones (dulce).

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para compra harina para la elaboración de picarones.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener un minimarquet y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en: Marisol is a member of the communal bank "Azangarinas al Progreso" (Azangarians for Progress), located in the Azangaro district of Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage with 2 children. She has some post-secondary education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 5 months. Her first loan was of 100 nuevos soles, money she used to increase the capital of her business. She sells picarones. She is asking for a new loan of 500 nuevos soles, money she will use to buy flour to make picarones. Her dream for the future is to have a minimarket and thus increase her income. What she likes most about her communal bank is the meetings and what she is able to save.

loans.use: Purchase of flour wholesale

loans.name: Leonidas Lucas

texts.es: Leónidas se dedica a brindar el servicio de juego de billares. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. Ya que anteriormente tenía una mesa en mal estado el mismo se preocupo por componerla y así empezar este medio de vida fue así que se preocupo por salir adelante. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 3 están a su cargo, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por ser un padre responsable. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como mesa de billar, y proporcionarle mejoras a su local.
texts.en: Leónidas offers a billiards playing service. He has had this business for over 2 years. Since he previously had one table in bad condition, he took it upon himself to repair it. Thus began this mode of gaining income, and this is the way that he has decided to get ahead. He has 5 children of whom only 3 are under his care, and so he has always tried to be a responsible father. The loan will be used for the purchase of basic materials such as a billiards table, and to better stock his business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi K. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Esi sells charcoal at Ankaful near Abura, which she has done for quite some time now. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of the home.

Esi will use the loan to purchase more charcoal for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest back into the charcoal business.

She is standing by a few bags of charcoal in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est créé depuis 2 ans et demi lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 28 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Leur activité principale tourne autour du petit commerce 

Madame CODOU S. mise en médaillon sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est veuve et vit avec ses 07 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de poisson frais et de sucre. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans

Avec son nouveau prêt de 500.000 francs elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises

Depuis le décès de son mari, c'est avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise à partir de son petit commerce qu'elle entretien ses enfants en achetant à la fin de chaque mois de la nourriture, payer les factures d'électricité et d'eau etc.
texts.en:
The group named Bokk Jom was created 2 and a half years ago, at the same time when the communal bank to which they belong was created. It is made up of 28 women who live in the same quarter. Their principal activity is a small business. 

Mrs. Codou S., pictured above the crow, is the leader of the group. She is 48 years old. She is a widow and she lives with her 7 children. 

She has a business selling fresh and candied fish. She manages her business very well, following 5 years of experience. 

Her new loan is in the amount of 500.000 francs and she will increase the quantity of merchandise she purchases. 

Since the passing of her husband, the income generated from this small business has permitted her to support her children, purchasing every month their food and paying the water and hydro bills, etc.

loans.use: To purchase fresh and candied fish.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with nine children, five of whom attend school while the others have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a cashew nut and coconut business for the past seven years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanatumu faces a major challenge of seasonality because during the dry summer season, the availability of cashew nuts for sale is lower. She hopes to expand and supply as a wholesaler in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts, cashew nuts and fruits for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts, cashew nuts and fruits for sale

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 67 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Cruceta en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace seis años, se dedica al cultivo de frutas, nueces  y plantas. Tiene un pequeno terreno agrícola situado en su caserío. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección este rubro. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Juan desea usar el préstamo para comprar pesticidas y fertilizantes para mantener su cultivo de limón. De este modo, puede mejorar la producción de su fruta, venderlas a buen precio en el mercado local y así percibir mayores ingresos. Para lograr su objetivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is a 67-year-old single man with no children. He lives in his own house in a rural area of the Cruceta hamlet in Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in the Piura province, in the region by the same name, over 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For six years, he has been growing fruits, nuts, and plants for a living. He has a small crop field situated in the hamlet. He learned this skill from his father, which means he knows about agriculture to a tee. He has an already established client base in the area.

Juan would like to use this loan to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for his lime cultivation, thus improving fruit production, selling them at the local market at a good price, and earning bigger profits. In order to achieve this goal, he sees the need to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Maintaining and repairing his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. is a 27-year-old man who has been living in the province of Siem Reap. To earn a living, he is a boat deliver for villagers and other passengers who wish to cross the river. He has been operating this business since 2005, earning around $5 in profit per day. He has other income from his wife who sells items in a wooden kiosk next to the house. The products which his wife regularly sells are soft drinks, candy, shampoo, cooking ingredients and other necessary items. His wife’s business is progressing well step by step, and she wants to increase her business capital in order to buy more essential items to sell. Touch S. will use his loan to support his wife's business.

loans.use: to assist his wife's business by purchasing more essential items to sell.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 40 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ana de 50 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Luis de 15 y Daisy de 11 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Teofilo, es el cultivo de plátanos, cítricos y café, las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus cultivos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Teofilo is 40 years old. He is a very modest and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his wife Ana, aged 50, and their 2 beloved children Luis, 15, and Daisy, 11, to whom he wants to offer a better standard of living. Teofilo engages in growing plantain, citrus fruits and coffee. Thanks to the vast lands he possesses, he has become one of the main producers of the area. He sells his products in the town of Pichanaki, where he always finds awaiting customers, thanks to the very good quality of his crops. The part of his job he enjoys the most is harvesting his lands, something he does with strong determination. He has been engaging in this activity for 16 years, and he thinks the most difficult task is to protect his plantations from the pests that can infect them. In the future, he wishes to buy additional famrlands in order to increase his production. This is his third loan with MFP. He is willing to promptly pay his dues, and for this reason he has started saving. He is a very cheerful member of his communal bank, and he is always aware of the agreements that have been reached in his group. With the 1000 PEN he requested he will buy more manure for his crops.

loans.use: To buy more bags of manure.

loans.name: Amusia

texts.en:
Amusia L. is 51 years old, married, and has seven children. Amusia owns and operates a taxi business.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Amusia is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase car parts and petrol to run the taxi.  She plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 260 talas or $108 per week, to improve and expand her business.

Amusia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Amusia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase car parts and petrol

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Joyce has a small restaurant that sells cooked food, which she has had for less than one year.  She also has a second business selling soft drinks  

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food and chairs for the restaurant.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joyce hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees for her child.  In the future, Joyce hopes to own a salon.

Joyce is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning more tactics on how to make money from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food and chairs for her little restaurant.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: The photo above shows Mrs. Sang S. who sells a variety of items from her own store which she operates from her house. She is 45 and married, and has been blessed with five single children: one of them is employed as a salaried security guard. Her husband is a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk) driver in and around the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. Sang S. is a busy woman who works hard every day at her business in order to earn the money to help support her family. She will use part of this Kiva loan as capital to purchase more items to sell, and the rest of the loan to mend her husband’s motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, and the rest of the loan to mend her husband’s motorcycle

loans.name: Mour

texts.en:
Mr. Mour is a policeman who currently lives in Siem Reap province. He has been working as a policeman since 1989 and earns a formal monthly salary. To meet the family’s living expenses, his wife works as a housekeeper for a hotel and also earns a salary. Mr. Mour is blessed with three children who are studying in public school. 

Mr. Mour’s old house often needs repair and the floors are worn down and broken. He does not have enough money to buy new floors to replace the broken sections. Therefore, Mr. Mour is requesting loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the floors in his home

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, la cual distribuye en su vivienda y algunas veces de manera ambulante, pues inicio hace 3 años ya siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos de su familia ella atiende a sus  clientes muy amable es así que sus clientes se sienten a gusto. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de ropa, bolsos, calzado y cosméticos.  Su meta siempre ha sido poder establecer su negocio, de tal manera que pueda vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Maria José has a business selling general merchandise. She sells her products from her home, but occasionally she offers her merchandise as a traveling merchant. Maria José started her business three years ago and has always been concerned about improving her family’s income. She is very friendly when attending to her customers, thereby making them feel at ease.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of clothes, bags, shoes, and cosmetics. Her goal has always been to establish her business so that could sell in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, bags, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Zarkhanim

texts.ru:
Zarkhanim jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Zarkhanim 44 qoda. 
Ona 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas Zarkhanim nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta kotoruyu ona prodayet v razniye magazini.
texts.en: Zarkhanim lives in the Baku region together with her family.  She is 44 years old, married and has three children.  Zarkhanim has been involved in animal husbandry and breeding cattle for nine years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase production of dairy that she sells to different stores.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos nació en la ciudad de Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 44 años de edad. Actualmente, Carlos vive en la misma hermosa ciudad donde nació junto con sus dos hijos.  Carlos es docente de profesión y trabaja en el colegio Institución Educativa Carmen de la ciudad de Calca. Ya son siete años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Carlos requiere el préstamo para pagar cursos de capacitación y otra parte para la construcción de su casa. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in the city of Calca (Cusco, Perú), and is 44 years old.  Currently, Carlos lives in the same beautiful city where he was born with his two children.  Carlos is a teacher by profession and works at the Institución Educativa Carmen high school in the city of Calca.  He has done this work for seven years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  Carlos needs this loan to pay for training classes and also to do construction on his home.

He is a responsible and hard-working person, and because of these qualities, his coworkers invited him to participate in the Virgen del Carmen community bank with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for training classes and to do construction on his house.

loans.name: Tulwanirewamu Community Group

texts.en:
For 12 years, 33-year-old Deborah has been overseeing operations at her beauty salon business in Kampala city, Uganda's capital city. Beauty salons are widespread all over Kampala, and it's always the way beauticians handle clients that sells their services. If one's beauty salon has a reputation for servicing clients well, that will, without a shadow of a doubt, play in the favor of that business. That is what has been unfolding at Deborah's salon. She and her employees aim at offering the best of service to not only their usual clients but also new clients. This has endeared them to many people, most especially women.

Not everything has been going well, however. She says the rising cost of doing business in most of East Africa has not spared her business. She says most of the cosmetics and other equipment she uses at her salon are increasingly becoming expensive. As a result, her business's growth has been stifled somewhat.

She remains upbeat, hoping for a favorable turn in circumstances soon. For a woman who was previously a housewife, this progress and attitude in the face of business adversity is encouraging. This mother of three says this business's gross profits total up to 500,000 Ugandan shillings weekly.  She says this Kiva loan will come in handy in the purchase of more cosmetics, hair dryers and other hair products to use at her salon.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, hair dryers and other hair products to use at her salon

loans.name: Djénéba

texts.fr:
Mme Djénéba est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 04ans.03 vont a l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits d’enfants, des pochettes pour dames et des ensembles chaines et parallèlement des condiments depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont ses amis, certains voisins et les agents des services.

Elle veut s’acheter 01 balle d’habits pour enfants;3 douzaines ensemble chaine et un plat de gombo sec. 

Elle veut aider son mari dans les charges familiales avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin et aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Djénéba is married and a mother of four. Her eldest is 18 and her youngest is four. Three of the children attend school. She has seven dependents in total.

She has been selling children's clothing, clutch bags for ladies and chains with pendants for three years. In parallel, she sells condiments. She gets her supplies from the sector 10 market. Her customers are her friends, some neighbors, and local service agents.

She wants to purchase 1 bundle of clothing for children, three dozen of chains with pendants and one dish of dried okra.

With her profits, she wants to help her husband with the family's expenses. She ambitions to open a department store and to contribute to her children's schooling.

loans.use: buy one bundle of children's clothes, three dozen of chains with pendants and one dish of dried okra.

loans.name: Din

texts.en: After taking four loans, Din is looking for a loan from HKL again as the fifth loan and the first loan from Kiva to buy more piglets for her pig hall. She is a 27-year-old woman married to Ann who is in the same age community. The main business of this family is selling the local traditional Khmer medicine to their villagers. Apart from this selling activity, Ann also earns another additional income by serving as a motor taxi driver. They have two children who are under school age. So, Din would like to request some funds in order to purchase piglets. Their future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least bachelor degrees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
La Señora Marciana está casada con el Señor Celso, el cual se dedica a la vidriería, tienen 2 hijos, 1 D. ellos ya está casado, y el otro es independiente ya mayor D. edad.
Ella tiene una lavandería familiar en donD. todos trabajan y ayudan, Don Celso, su marido, la ayuda en la entrega D. las ropas limpias y planchadas que la la Señora Marciana con sus hijas lavan y planchan. En cuanto a su clientela comenta que tiene clientes D. grandes empresas, a los cuales le cobra en forma mensual por los servicios realizados, por lo que ya tiene un ingreso mensual asegurado.
Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con sus compromisos. Una D. sus metas es seguir creciendo D. forma gradual con su negocio, para que el día D. mañana no solo ayuD. a su familia, sino también a los demás generando puestos D. empleo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. una seca ropas industrial, lo cual le será D. muchísima ayuda en su trabajo. Está muy contenta con la oportunidad que le da la Fundación.
texts.en:
Marciana is married to Celso, whose profession is glasswork.  They have two sons, one of whom is already married, while the other is an independent adult.

She runs a family laundromat where everyone works and helps out.  Celso, her husband, helps her return the clean, ironed clothes that Marciana and her daughters clean and iron.  In terms of clientele, she has customers from big businesses whom she charges monthly for services rendered, which assures her a monthly income.

She has proven to be a very hardworking person who keeps her commitments.  One of her goals is to keep her business growing gradually so that in the future she will help not only her family, but others by creating jobs.  

She is asking for a loan to buy an industrial clothes dryer, which will be very helpful to her in her work.  She is very happy to have this opportunity from the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy a clothes dryer to use in her laundromat

loans.name: Louise

texts.en: Louise is 29 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is single and has three children aged between 7 and 14, all of whom are currently in school and living at home. Louise is a high school graduate who, for the past four years, has been selling oil, rice, pepper and soda. She is the only person in her community to sell these products, therefore she makes a lot of profit. She has many customers and too few commodities, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and soda for her business. Louise hopes to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and soda for her business.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three school-aged children. Mrs. Kin started a career as a local farmer when she was with her parents. Besides cultivating in the field, she also owns a successful business as a rice supplier. Mrs. Kin can generate an income of approximately $3.50 USD a day.
