This is Elmer's second loan with MFP, where he has agreed to make all the payments on time and to continue working as the secretary for his communal bank. He plans to invest the loan funds in the purchase of fertilizers and 500 coffee plant seedlings.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and coffee plants

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo sells kerosene at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to be a major kerosene distributor in future. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and he also supports the household. She has been in this business for a long time. She sells for long hours to enable her to put food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora  PATRICIA DEL CARMEN V. S. tiene 30 años, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. 
La socia presenta estudios superiores incompletos de ventas y marketing, refiere que dejò de estudiar por faltad de recursos económicos. Patricia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo y actualmente espera otro bebè. Ella se dedica a la crianza de patos para su posterior venta en el mercado. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò patos bebès para criarlos y a su vez alimento balanceado.
En la actualidad solicitarà un crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà patos bebes para criarlos y comprará tambièn alimento balanceado al por mayor.
Patricia sueña con tener una tienda de alimentos en su domicilio para generar mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia Del Carmen V. Saldaña is 30 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir, province of Trujillo, and department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "Caridad II". Our partner has had some higher education in sales and marketing, but she quit studying due to a lack of economic resources. She is a live-in partner and has one son, but she is currently expecting another child. She makes a living raising ducks, to later sell them in the market. With her first credit of 300.00 nuevos soles, she purchased baby ducks to raise and also balanced feed for them. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will buy more baby ducks to raise and will also buy feed wholesale. Patricia's dream is to have a food store in her home in order to generate a greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens, ducks, and balanced feed wholesale

loans.name: Xiomara De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Xiomara de los Ángeles J. desde muy joven para ayudar en los gastos del hogar empezó a vender ropa usada. Ella inicio con la cooperación de su compañero de vida el cual le a servido de apoyo y con ello ha sabido salir adelante.
texts.en:
From an early age, Xiomara de los Ángeles J. has helped with the expenses of the home. She began to sell used clothes. She started with the cooperation of her life companion, who helped to support them, and with this business she has been known to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packs of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Khardiatou

texts.en: Ms. Khardiatou B. has worked as a community-health worker in the neighborhood of Cité Lamy in Thies since 1983. She supplements her income by selling beautiful fabrics called Thioup. Her husband used to work in neighboring Mali, where Thioup fabrics can be found at a much better price. He would buy the fabrics in the local market and send them to her in Thies. Now, however, her husband has returned home and she will make the journey herself to purchase the fabrics. The 150,000 franc loan will cover her transport costs and allow her to buy a dozen or so Thioup robes. She says this activity allows her to help meet the family's needs. She and her husband have six children and also take care of her mother and two nieces. Ms. B. has been a member of the IMCEC credit union since 2008, and is a member of the local PDEF (Development Program for Children and Families). Through the cooperation between the two organizations, her loan is financed on more favorable terms, including a reduced interest rate. The objective of the cooperation is to promote the income-generating activities of the parents of disadvantaged children in the PDEF program.

loans.use: Purchase Thioup fabrics

loans.name: Tomasa's Group

texts.en: Tomasa B. is from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is 46 years old and is the group leader of a twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Tomasa is married and has six school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising and fattening pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Tomasa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Tomasa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, O. Célestine est mariée à KOUNAHONDE Félicien, un tailleur. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis sept ans à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Célestine a commencé il y a environs sept ans,la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Célestine s'approvisionne. Célestine sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients ; ce qui lui permettra de maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Célestine O. is married to Félicien Kounahonde, a tailor. The couple have two children, both of whom attend school. For the past seven years, the family has lived in Djeffa, in the Sèmè-Podji borough of Benin. The couple work together to see to their family's needs; in order to help with this, Célestine began to sell staple foods (corn, beans, etc) from home seven years ago. She sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Célestine is seeking her first loan from ALIDé, which she will use to bolster her business so that she may better meet her clients' demands, enabling her to increase her profits.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and beans

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 44-year-old married woman living in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. She has four children, ranging in age from 19 to 29 years old, with two of them currently attending school.

Linet has been running her mixed farm for over five years now, and sells a wide variety of products at the local market. Her primary income comes from the sale of maize, beans, sunflowers and tomatoes, while she also sells milk on occasion. She says that lately the main challenge to her business is the droughts that have been difficult for her farming activities.

Linet has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing two loans of Kes 25,000 and Kes 40,000. She has now requested this loan of Kes 60,000 to expand her poultry farming operations. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay college fees for her two youngest children, therefore providing them with a better future.

Linet has plans for expansion in the next five to ten years, and her main goal is to acquire a small machine that processes sunflowers. She says that this will enable her to create employment opportunities for other people in her area and add to her diversified operations.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business

loans.name: Mathina

texts.en: Mathina sells groceries and kerosene at retail prices. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 42 years old, married and has six children. Her children are doing well in school. Mathina is a Benin by tribe. She needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more kerosene and groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene and groceries to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 24 years old and married with one child. She makes clothes and sells them in the market place in Kibera slums to earn a living.  She has been in this business for five years and has one employee.  She gets extra income from her husband who is employed.  Her business has grown tremendously since she joined Faulu Kenya because she can access loans.  She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business in the future.  She has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy sewing machines and fabric.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines and more fabric

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is married with one adult son. She sells women's clothing at a small open market in Novaya Kahovka town. Natalya has been in this business for 20 years. She started it at the time of high unemployment. During all these years, the business has been a stable source of income for her family. Natalya enjoys her business. She’s got many repeated clients that buy from her. Natalya would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Monica Aoko

texts.en:
Monica Aoko O. lives in Kakmasya in Rongo. She is 40 years old, married, with eight children. Monica quit fish vending and started selling Jaggery (unrefined sugar) in the year 2000 due to the availability of sugar cane in the surrounding area. She buys her stock in Kamkasya on a weekly basis and would like to expand her business to be able to get enough income so that she is able to educate her children.

She would like to get a loan for 30,000 KES so she can increase her sugar cane stock in order to produce more of her product and generate more income.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 46 años, su actividad económica es la una pulpería. Por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperación de mantener a su familia, decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en este negocio que actualmente es que le está generando el pan de cada día a ella y su familia por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de superarse y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Así la ubicación de su actividad es en su vivienda en donde es visitada por vecinos, amigos y compañeros. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 46 years old and manages her own store. Out of desperation to support her family due to the lack of opportunities, she decided to invest all of her savings into this business which now generates daily income for her and her family. Rosa is always looking for ways to overcome so that her children can get ahead. She operates her business out of her home, which is frequented by neighbors, friends, and colleagues. Rosa dreams of improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria G., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provision for its daily needs. Married to Roland G., a reflexologist (a masseur who specializes in reflexology massages) and beautician, they are blessed with a child in their marriage. Gloria makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling health products, such as bio-enzymes, for the past few years.
Gloria has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance for her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. Gloria is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her health business.
To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 8,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities of products currently in her product inventory. Gloria dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her child’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products that are currently in her product inventory

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
A. Essi est née en 1983 et est célibataire. Elle est employée de bureau.
Dans le but de diversifier ses revenus, elle achète et revend des cartes de recharge. Elle a commencé à explorer ce secteur d’activité depuis 2007 et maitrise assez bien le secteur. L’activité se déroule dans une cabine téléphonique située au centre ville. 
Avec le prêt demandé, elle envisage acheter des cartes de recharge pour relancer son commerce.
Elle espère avec l’évolution probable de son activité due à ce crédit, augmenter et conforter son autonomie financière.
texts.en:
A. Essi was born in 1983 and she is single. She is employed in an office. In order to diversify her income, she buys and re-sells rechargeable telephone cards. She got her start in this sector in 2007 and is quite familiar with it. Her business is located in a telephone booth situated in the center of town. With the requested loan, she intends to buy rechargeable cards to get her business going again. She hopes that because of the influence of this loan on her business, she will be able to be more financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Vicente Heraldo

texts.es:
Vicente de 54 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, (zona urbana, la mayoría de los habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene un puesto de venta de “bollos” (plato típico contiene plátanos y pescado muy típico en las playas de Ecuador). 

Antes de vender bollos el trabajaba en un barco como cocinero, pero como no tenia ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia decidió hacer su propia comida y venderla, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo trabajar independientemente vendiendo bollos. 

Ahora para poder agrandar su negocio el quiere con el préstamo comprar una puerta metálica para su local y artículos para cocina. En el futuro quiere tener su propio restaurante de comidas típicas del Ecuador.
texts.en:
54 year-old Vicente lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil (an urban zone where the majority of its inhabitants are informal merchants). He has got a "bollos" stall (a plate of bananas and fish, very typical from the beaches of Ecuador). Before he sold "bollos", he worked on a boat as a cook but he didn't make enough money to maintain his family and so he decided to cook his own food and sell it. Little by little and with a lot of hard work, he was able to work independently selling "bollos." Now, in order to expand his business, he wants a loan so that he can purchase a metal door for his business and kitchen supplies. In the future, he wants to have his own restaurant of typical Ecuadorian cuisine.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Metal door and kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Terlan

texts.ru:
Terlan I. 60 let. On jenat i yeqo semya sostait iz trex dochek i odnoqo sina. Samoy starshey doshke uje 32 qoda ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Dochka 29 let toje zamujem i imeyet 2 detey, a dochka 27 let ona rabotayet i uchitsya. Sin Terlana toje jenat i imeyet 2 dochek. Terlan i eqo semya ochen drujniye.

Terlan uje 15 let kak rabotayet v etom biznese ,On sajayet frukti (yabloko, qrusho i t,d) a potom sobirayet i prodayet ix na rinke. Terlan ochen lubit svoyu rabotu, on lubit uxajivat za derevyami ,polivat ix, sobirat frukti. Seychas Terlan nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit udobreniye i pesticidi dlya uvilicheniya urojaya.
texts.en:
Terlan I. is 60 years old. He is married and has three daughters and one son. The oldest daughter is already 32 years old. She is married and has 2 children. The 29-year-old daughter is also married and has 2 children, and the 27-year-old daughter works and studies. Terlan's son is also married and has 2 daughters. Terlan and his family are very friendly. Terlan has been working in this business for 15 years. He plants fruits (apples, pears, etc.), then picks and sells fruit at a market. Terlan loves his work very much. He loves taking care of trees, watering and picking fruit. Currently, Terlan needs 2000 AZN in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for increasing the harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John N. is 25 years old. He operates a bicycle/motorcycle transport also known locally as `boda boda’ in Changamwe, Mombasa. Married to Muria Mohamed, he solely supports a family of three. 

John N. has been in this business for the last four years and he plans to take his first loan from KADET and add to his savings and purchase a new motorcycle. He  hopes to purchase another motorcycle  and use it in other areas where there is need in Mombasa. In future he would wish to own a passenger service vehicle.

loans.use: add to his savings and purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Chhab

texts.en:
Chhab is a 44-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and three children. He is the owner of a pickup truck, which he uses for transporting many things for people from one place to another, especially for construction use.

Chhab also transports vegetables and fruits from the wholesale market to his clients’ shops. Everyone likes him as he’s very honest and helpful, and seeks perfection in serving others.

This is the first time that Chhab has requested a loan from A. Majmoua, and it’s all because he needs to replace the pickup’s engine, do other necessary maintenance, and change its officiA. papers.

Money was Chhab’s main obstacle when starting his business, and its need made him more excited to fight for his success. He hopes to expand his business through buying more pickup trucks in the future.

loans.use: To replace the pickup truck’s engine, do necessary maintenance, and change its official papers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan L. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Susan is married and has four children. Susan grows hogs for fattening and sale and tills a rice farm with her husband. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells a variety of different products. Susan works hard to provide for her family. It is also her dream for her kids to have bright futures.

Susan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase livestock feed, farm supplies and additional store supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed, farm supplies and additional store supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, sugar, wheat, gallons of cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora, es una comerciante, tiene 42 años, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos David de 16 años y Vanessa de 14 años de edad. Ella tiene un puesto de venta de pupusas en el parqueo municipal donde se reúnen todas las líneas de autobuses de los municipios cercanos, lugar estratégico para realizar la venta de estos alimentos ya que es el plato típico de El Salvador y todas las personas las consumen. 
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Chicharrón, quesillo y bebidas, esta inversión la hará con la intención de preparar más pupusas y atender  toda la demanda de los clientes.
Su Propósito es mantener este negocio por muchos años para ayudar con los ingresos que recibe a sus hijos y estos puedan desarrollarse.
texts.en: Dora is a storekeeper. She's 42-years-old and lives in the city of San Miguel with her husband and two children, David (16-years-old), and Vanessa (14-years-old). She has a pupusa (Central American pastry filled with meat) stand in the municipal parking lot, where all the bus lines from the surrounding towns converge. This is a strategic place to sell food because it's the typical dish of El Salvador and everyone eats it. She needs a loan to buy corn, meat, cheese, and drinks. She'll use the money to make more pupusas to meet the demand of her customers. Her goal is to maintain this business for many years to help with her family's income and to help her children develop.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, meat, cheese, and, and drinks

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora María Lourdes L. T., inicia su negocio a orilla del mercado central con un capital de C$10,000.00 ella también trabaja por la mañana de docente y su esposo en ese lapso atiende el negocio y por la tarde ella se integra también al negocio realizando.

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de retratera, bolsos, lámparas de noche, juguetes. manzanas, ya que se aproxima la navidad.
La Señora L. T., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy conforme por que ha logrado a incrementar su inventario donde ha obtenido buenas ganancias y así mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Lourdes started her business on the outskirts of the central market with C$10,000 of capital. She also works in the morning as a teacher. When she works in the morning, her husband takes care of her business. In the afternoon María Lourdes joins her husband at her business.
This loan will be used to buy picture frames, bags, nightlights, toys and apples for the approaching Christmas holiday.
Mrs. María Lourdes is very happy with the opportunity that CEPRODEL provides. She would like to improve her inventory in order to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: She will buy picture frames, bags, nightlights and toys.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan A. de 56 años de edad es panadero, su cónyuge es la señora Alba Irala, tienen dos hijos varones adolescentes, estudiantes Universitarios, la familia cuenta con una pequeña micro industria familiar, se dedican a la producción de panificados, galleta criolla, palitos, coquitos, pan Felipe y otros, se dedican a este rubro hace mas de 10 años, con mucho esfuerzo están saliendo adelante y por sobre todo pudiendo costear los gastos que acarrea la educación Universitaria de sus hijos.
Solicita préstamo a  Fundación Paraguaya para la compra en cantidad de  materia prima para la elaboración de los productos ya que aumento bastante su venta y no desea fallar con su clientela.  
El Señor Juan agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo brindado y gracias a ello va a poder seguir mejorando sus ingresos y por ende su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Juan A. is 56-years-old. He's a baker. His wife is Alba Irala and they have two teenage children who are studying in the university. The family runs a small bakery where they make baked goods, cookies, pastries, bread, and other products. They've been in this line of work for more than 10 years. With a lot of hard work they're coming out ahead and earning money to finance their sons' university education. He's requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya for the purchase of raw ingredients to be used in baking. His sales have increased and he doesn't want to disappoint his customers. Juan would like to thank Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their support. Thanks to this loan he's going to be able to continue increasing his profits and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of flour in bulk

loans.name: Sop Mame Rokhaya Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
Elles sont au nombre de douze femmes dans ce groupe et sont voisines, leur amitié a démarré avec la formation de petites rencontres pour des tontines dans le quartier ; le 28 mars 2008 à l’ouverture du BV. Elles ont donc donné un nom  au groupe pour mieux consolider leur amitié.

Coumba DialL. Sy debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. C'est une femme très dynamique ; elle est veuve mère de 5 enfants. 

Son activité principale est le petit commerce de divers produits (ustensile de cuisine, tissu, vaisselles etc.) qu’elle mène dans son quartier. C’est dans les différents marchés de Louga qu’elle achète ses produits.

Ses bénéfices l’aide à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et a constituer aussi une bonne épargne.
texts.en:
There are 12 women in this group who are neighbors. Their friendship began with small gatherings where they contributed to their neighborhood “tontines” [a revolving credit system]. On March 28, 2008 upon the opening of the Banc Villageois, they gave the group a name to better affirm their friendship.

Coumba DialL. Sy, standing on the right of the photo, is the group leader. She is a very energetic woman. She is a widow mother of five children.

Her main activity is the small retail of various goods (kitchen utensils, fabric, dishes etc…), which she conducts in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies at the various markets in Louga.

Her income helps her to provide for the needs of her family and to also build up good savings.

loans.use: To develop and promote her income-generating activity.

loans.name: Silvia Edubi

texts.en:
Silvia is twenty-two years old.  She lives in the area of Haya D. la Torre in the city of Lambayeque.  It is a growing part of the city, which was born out of a land taken by local residents a number of years ago.  It is relatively well established now and consists primarily of individuals with few resources who work in nearby factories, public transport or other jobs.  Silvia is married and lives with her husband.  They have three children.

Silvia raises animals in corrals behind her home.  Specifically she raises pigs, which she sells in local markets or to wholesalers once they reach the appropriate size and weight.

The loan proceeds will be used to purchase additional feed and to expand her corrals.  She hopes to be able to grow her business to better care for her animals and increase the capacity of her farm.  She is happy to be able to earn an income on her own and help in meeting her family’s needs.  She dreams of sending her children to school and providing them with assistance to attend a university or traD. school.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and expand her corrals

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Lucia de la cuidad de Tobati que dista a 17 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  5º con sus 11 integrantes. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Salustiana quien se dedica a cría y venta de pollos y comenta que este periodo le va muy bien y solicita el préstamo para la compra de balanceados el cual es el alimento de sus pollos. . 

Todas las integrantes del comité están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por el valioso apoyo que les brinda para poder mejorar sus condiciones financieras en la sociedad.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank are from the barrio of Santa Lucia in the city of Tobati, some 17 kilometers from the regional office in Caacupé. They are very satisfied with the economic assistance being offered by the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation). With this capital these women are expanding their small businesses and, also, their incomes, gaining a better quality of life. The 11 members are now in their 5th loan cycle.

One of the members is Salustiana who is dedicated to raising and selling chickens, and she comments that things are going very well at present. She wishes to solicit a loan to buy 'balanceados', the feed she gives her chickens.

All the members are grateful to the Paraguay Foundation for the valuable help it provides, making possible the improvement of their financial condition in society.

loans.use: TO BUY CHICKEN FEED FOR SALUSTIANA WHO RAISES AND SELLS CHICKENS

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata tiene 23 años y es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Richard, de 25 años, y su querida hija Samerli de 4 años, por quien trabaja para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, Honorata sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son el cacao, el café y la hoja de coca, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de San Francisco.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlas, además cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Para el futuro planea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar sus cultivos.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Honorata con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más semillas, también comprará abono e insecticidas para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Honorata is 23 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 25 year-old Richard, and her beloved daughter, 4 year-old Samerli, for whom she works so that she can provide her with a better quality of life.

Every day, very early in the morning, Honorata goes out to work in her fields.  There are no rest days for her since she has to work continually in order to ensure a good production.  Her main crops are cacao, coffee and coca leaf which she sells wholesale in the city of San Francisco.  What she most likes about her work is the freedom that she has working on her crops since she is free to enjoy her green fields.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be protecting her crops from the pests that can ravage them.  She has her partner's support.  In the future, Honorata plans to buy new land so that she can increase her crops.

This is Honorata's eighth loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her repayments and she hopes to continue being punctual in making her new repayments.  Honorata is a very well-liked member of her community bank since she is very happy.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more seeds.  She will also buy manure and insecticides to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and insecticides

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-Coungo, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitiés, elles font le commerce de tubercules, du beurre de karité, de gâteaux, de la viande et du lait.                                                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des tubercules, du beurre de karité, de la farine de blé, de la viande et du lait.                                                                             
KAMISSA D. compte acheter 100 kg de beurre de Karité avec les revendeurs de la ville de Marka-Coungo et environnants hebdomadairement. Elle revend au marché et à domicile, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group, all married, are on average 44 years old, have three children each, and live in traditional extended families in the village of Marka-Coungo, a sub-prefecture of Farna, in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region in the Republic of Mali).  They have known each other as fellow parents, neighbors, and friends.  They are sellers of tubers, shea butter, cakes, meat, and milk.

The women of the Djekafo group seek their eighth group loan which will be used to buy tubers, shea butter, flour, meat, and milk.

Kamissa D. intends to buy 100kg of shea butter from the resellers in the city of Marka-Coungo and its surrounding areas weekly.  She resells at the market and from her home, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.  She foresees earning a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA which will be used to pay the loan installments, to assume health and food expenses, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing shea butter

loans.name: Phorng

texts.en: Phorng M., age 32, has been earning a daily profit by making the equipment for woman to cook food. She usually generates an income of approximately $0.75 a day. She has a life partner in her husband who climbs palm trees around his village, in Kompong Tom province. Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very popular jobs for poor people who live in the community. The couple is blessed with two single children who are still learning in school.  Presently, she and her family live in the old house that often needs repair. Some parts her house are breaking and growing rotten wood, so it is not comfortable for her and her family to live in. To solve this problem, Phorng M. would like to buy some poles for repairing the broken parts of her house.

loans.use: To buy some poles for repairing the broken parts of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, coffee, juices, bread, cookies, and sodas

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 53-year-old widow who supports her family by selling religious articles and making candles. She lives in Bogo, Cebu. Aida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to buy candles, talo, and plastic so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Aida is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase new religious articles to sell

loans.name: Bénédiction Plus Group

texts.en:
Bénédiction Plus is a group of 18 owners of small businesses chaired by Réné. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Réné M., 52, operates a general store while taking care of one brother-in-law. He is engaged. He is the father of five children who are between 2 and 11 years old. Three of them attend school.

Réné began his business in 1999. Réné has used seventeen Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expansion of his business. His store brings in a profit of $180 per week. 

Due to the high demand in his community, he intends with the next loan to buy more resale goods in order to meet client demand and generate additional profit. Réné’s ambition is to become a provider in his area. This loan will help him achieve his plans to grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for his store for resale at a profit.

loans.name: Zohidjon

texts.ru: Калонов Зохидчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 35 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Зохидчон предоставляет услугу, такси. Он развозит людей по маршруту Каратог-Турсунзаде. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Zohidjon K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 35 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife. Zohidjon provides a taxi service. He carries people on a route between Karatog and Tursun-zoda. He has been doing this work for ten years.  He is taking out a loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Famille Yenawa Group

texts.fr:
FAMILLE YENAWA est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont la présidente (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo) se nomme  Françoise Mekpondon. Les membres du groupe appartiennent à la même famille. Ce groupe sollicite un crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d'augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire.
Née le 20 février 1960 à Dangbo dans le département de l’Ouémé, Françoise Mekpondon vit depuis onze ans à Yénawa à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Françoise Mekpondon est mariée à Jean Bosco et à eu  trois  enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à sa charge. Françoise Mekpondon vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. N’ayant pas été à l’école, Françoise Mekpondon vend depuis longtemps, des produits vivriers (sacs de maïs, de riz, carton de pâte...) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et de nourrir sa famille. Françoise Mekpondon s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Françoise Mekpondon sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu. Françoise Mekpondon aimerait dans l’avenir ouvrir une boutique et rehausser davantage son activité.
texts.en:
FAMILLE YENAWA is a group which is comprised of three persons, including the president (with her finger raised in the photo) by the name of Françoise Mekpondon. The group members belong to the same family. This group is requesting a loan with the aim of raising their level of business and increasing her turnover. 

Born on February 20, 1960 in Dangbo in Ouémé County, Françoise Mekpondon has lived for eleven years in Yénawa, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Jean Bosco and had three children, who have all had schooling. Two of the children are in her care. Françoise Mekpondon lives together with her children and husband. 

Not having attended school, she has sold staple goods (sacks of corn and rice, boxes of pasta…) out of her house for a long time. This enables her to support herself and to feed her family. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

She is requesting financing from ALIDé in order to expand her business and to increase her turnover. For the future, she would like to open a shop and to boost her business further.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and rice and boxes of pasta and some sugar

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly B. is 27 years old and married with one school-aged child. Beverly is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns approximately PHP 5,000 per month. 

Beverly is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and to pay for services to plant corn and vegetables. Beverly has been growing corn and vegetables.  In the future, Beverly hopes to make her business profitable in order to support the schooling of their child and give him a better future. She also believes that someday she can start another kind of business and improve their status of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for services to plant corn and vegetables

loans.name: Tserenbat

texts.en:
Tserenbat is 33 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He manages a milk trading business with the help of his wife in their town. 

They own cow farming, a business which started in 2010 after having 5 cows in their possession. They have been herding husbandry animals since their childhood, therefore, they have much experience in this business field. Now they sell 20 liters of milk every day and earn enough money to buy all the necessities. Tserenbat is a kind man who says, "I am planning to save some money in order to buy a much better breed of cow." He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to build a house for his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Fabiola Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fabiola ya tiene su propio negocio, en donde vende ropa, cosméticos, una variedad de productos, que le ayudado mucho en su vida personal para el apoyo de sus hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en donde junto han logrado la construcción de su casa.
Sus ventas han crecido, como su clientela, al ofertar variedades de productos a si como encargos, lo que logro atreves del financiamiento de Afodenic, teniendo varios ciclos, siendo la mayor parte para la inversión del negocio. 
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de una docena de camisas de mujer, pantalones, una docena de sandalias, camisas para varón, como encargos que entregar como licuadora, plancha, juego de sillas de plásticos, olla de presión. El cual son clientes que le da al crédito por ser buena paga.
texts.en:
Fabiola has her own business selling clothes, cosmetics, and a variety of other products. This business has been a great help to her personal life because it has enabled her to support her children. She also has the support of her husband and together they have been able to build a home.

Her sales and her customer base have grown as a result of taking orders for a variety of products. Most of what she has achieved was due to the several loan cycles in which she participated with AFODENIC. A large portion of those funds were invested into her business.

With this new loan, Fabiola will purchase one dozen women’s shirts, trousers, one dozen sandals, and men’s shirts. She will also buy a blender, an iron, a set of plastic chairs, and a pressure cooker since she has orders for these items. Fabiola extends credit to those customers who have a good payment history.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, and a variety of household appliances.

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, neither of whom are currently in school. Halima has a business selling cooking stoves, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Halima has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making cooking stoves for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Halima hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, by buying new clothes. In the future, she hopes to open a charcoal sales business.
Halima is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her generate more capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making cooking stoves for resale.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes Del Carmen vive en la ciudad de Managua Madre de familia  es una persona responsable, honestas con grandes deseo de superación para su familia.
La señora  visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito para hacer mejoras de su vivienda.
Las mejoras que la señora va hacer es la instalación de baño y  la compra de un taque de agua. 
La señora  manifiesta que se siente agradecido con ceprodel por que gracias a los prestamos que ceprodel le a financiado a podido mejorar su vivienda
texts.en: Mrs. Mercedes del Carmen lives in the city of Managua.  She is a responsible, honest mother who has great desires of getting ahead for her family.  She visited our office to request a loan for home improvement because she wants to put in a bathtub and buy a water tank.  She is grateful to Ceprodel for the loans to make her home more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: José Serafín

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Serafín  le esta haciendo falta la construcción de la barda al rededor de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilla y para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la contracción de la barda. 
Le esta preocupando la seguridad de su familia ya que el trabaja todo el día, como camarógrafo de una televisora.
Con una parte del ingreso que reciba de su trabajo pagara el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en: José Serafín needs to build a wall around his house.  He’s asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies: concrete blocks, cement and iron rods, and also to pay labor costs to the person who will build the wall.  He is concerned about his family’s safety because he works all day as a cameraman for a television station.  He will use part of his salary from work to repay the loan since this is his family’s source of income.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Girumugisha Group

texts.fr:
Judith est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite  la localité de Mumuri au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 23ans. Elle était gardienne de vaches avant de commencer ce métier. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants de dont 3 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« GIRUMUGISHA».
texts.en:
Judith is a merchant, 30 years old, who lives in the town of Mumuri, in the middle of the country, in the Province of Gitega. She has been doing commerce in bananas for 23 years. She used to oversee cows before starting in this trade. She attended school through the sixth grade. She is married and the mother of seven children, of whom three are students in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 200,000 Burundi francs that Judith is obtaining will enable her to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas for resale in order to make large profits. 

Judith is a member of the community group “GIRUMUGISHA”.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru:
Али добросовестный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Али любит свою семью и старается, содержат свою семью в хорошей уровень жизни. Он хочет, видит своих детей в будущем образованными, честными и трудолюбивыми людьми. С этой целью он начал заниматься приготовлением лепешек. Он занимается этим бизнесом более 13 лет и у него богатый опыт. Али хотел бы получит займ для покупки муки и уголь для запасов в зимний период. Он заранее благодарен вам всем за вашу доброту!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Ali is a trustworthy and honest person. He is married and is the loving father of three children. Ali loves his family and tries to provide a decent quality of life for them. He would like to see his children grow up to be educated, honest and hard-working. With this goal, he launched a business  baking flatbread. He has been in this business for over 13 years, and has a lot of experience. He would like to receive a loan in order to purchase flour and coal, to have a supply for the winter season. He thanks all of you in advance for your kindness


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to stock up on flour and coal

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth, resiD. en casa propia ubicada en zona muy humilD., con su grupo familiar el cual lo conforma su esposo D. 27 años y su hija que se encuentra estudiando. Sandra se dedica a la venta D. ropa como: faldas, vestidos, pantalones, short, ropa interior, etc. Esta actividad la realiza D. manera ambulante en las principales comunidades D. la zona cercada a donD. ella habita. Es una persona trabajadora y confiable, muchas personas solicitan sus prendas D. vestir ya que ella siempre trata D. mantenerse al día con la moda, además ofrece precios accesibles e incluso da facilidades D. pago a fin D. poder hacer negocio. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este préstamo para comprar variedad D. prendas D. vestir como: faldas, ropa interior, camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc. para atraer a más clientes y poder aumentar su nivel D. ventas que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos y como consecuencia su nivel D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en: Sandra Elizabeth lives in her own home in a very humble area with her family, which is maD. up of her husband, who is 27, and her daughter, who goes to school.  Sandra sells clothing like:  skirts, dresses, pants, shorts, underwear, etc.  She does this by traveling to the main communities in the neighboring areas where she lives.  She is a very hard-working and trustworthy person.  Many people request clothing from her since she always tries to have the latest fashions.  She also offers affordable prices and ease of payment.  She has decided to request a loan to buy a variety of clothing like skirts, underwear, shirts, pants, blouses, etc., to attract more customers and to be able to expand her level of sales so she can improve her income and consequently the quality of life for her and her family

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing like skirts, underwear, shirts, pants, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her wholesale shop, which sells assorted goods. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more goods like soap for sale, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for her family. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business to a point where she can open another branch. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like soap to sell

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Ramadhan, who is in his early 40s, is married with two children who are still in school. He has been running a fruit business for 20 years now. He works from 6 a.m to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his stock of fruit, pay school fees, and pay household expenses. He paid back the loan successfully and has requested a new loan to buy more fruit to sell.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Muheza," which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Muna is a 39-year-old young woman who is married with three sons and and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He is also a fisherman and gets a low income from fishing. Muna wants to improve her family life by purchasing new home furniture such as bedroom furniture for her and for her children, living room furniture, etc., but she hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Muna gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase the furniture her family needs. This will offer to Muna and her family better and healthier living conditions. Muna is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead at the FATEN branch. About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Waldir Osmar

texts.es:
El Sr. Waldir, está casado tiene 2 hijos, todos aun en edad escolar. El se dedica a la venta de Zapatos Usados, en su domicilio, cuya venta le genera un buen ingreso. Con la ayuda de su esposa están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación. Hoy día el es una microempresario exitoso con mucha clientela, debido a su buen trato y al buen servicio que presta.
El comenta que su trabajo diario es por darle a su esposa e hijos lo mejor, para que ellos no tengan que sufrir de las privaciones por las que el tuvo que pasar en su vida. Desea que ellos sean grandes profesionales útiles a la sociedad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos de segunda mano, para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
Waldir is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. He sells used shoes out of his home, which earns him a good income. With his wife's help and a lot of determination and sacrifice, they are giving their family a better life. Today he is a successful businessman with a good customer base, thanks to the excellent service he offers.
He says that he works hard to give his wife and children the best so they don't have to suffer the deprivation that he's experienced in his life. He wants his children to have good careers and be of service to society.
He is requesting this loan to buy secondhand shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 47 es una mujer dichosa. Ella vive en compañía de Ceferino, su esposo desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo cuida a 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Usibamba. Todas las mañanas como es de costumbre sale a cuidar de sus sembríos, pues es temporada y necesita de una buena cosecha. Sus principales cultivos constan de alfalfa, pasto, avena y demás alimentos para su ganado, pues se dedica a la crianza de vacas, ya cuenta con 8, de los cuales 3 están preñadas, por lo que no brindan leche; aunque ahora este algo escaso, sabe que no durará  para siempre, pues cuando ya nacen las terneras, sus vacas le proporcionarán buena leche y podrá vender a un buen precio. Pero la actividad que más le gusta a ella; es el tejido, mientras realiza sus actividades, ella elabora diversas prendas como chompas, tapetes, colchas y demás accesorios a base de lana. Ahí obtiene una ganancia extra y además disfruta de su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Usibamba” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con sus cuotas, pues las personas de su asociación son responsables y muy solidarias. Amelia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 vacas lecheras, con las que piensa aumentar la cantidad de su ganado.
texts.en: Amelia is 47 years old and is a happy woman. She lives with Cerefino, her husband of 25 years. They have 5 children. They take care of only 4 of them in their own house, which is located in the annex of Usibamba. Every morning as is her custom, she goes to take care of her crops as it is the season and she needs a good harvest. Her principal crops are alfalfa, grass, oats and other food for her animals, as she breeds cows. She already has 8 cows, 3 of which are pregnant and so do not give milk. Although now feeling the pinch, she knows that this will not last forever as when the calves are born her cows will give her good milk which she will sell at a good price. However, what she likes doing the best is weaving. While going about her daily chores, she makes various garments such as sweaters, rugs, quilts and other accessories made from wool. This gives her extra income and she also enjoys the work. She belongs to the communal bank "Usibamba" and this is their 3rd loan with MFP, from which she is hoping to receive a small loan to reach her goals. On the other hand, she promises to make her repayments, as the members of her bank are responsible and very supportive people. Amelia on receiving your support, will invest the money requested to purchase 2 milking cows with which she intends to increase her number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 29 years old and a father of two children. He owns a permanent house where he lives with his family of four. He owns a produce business and has been running it for two years. He started as a peasant farmer. One of the challenges he faces is bad debtors. He is requesting a loan to buy more maize and groundnuts for his business.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng is 52 years old and a villager who has been residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She works together with her husband on her inherited farmland, and is experienced at cultivating rice crops. Together, this couple is able to earn approximately $3.00 per day through this business.

She has four children, three of whom are single and live together with her in the province. She will add the loan of $500 to her saved funds so she can fix her present house partially and rebuild a bigger room for her two daughters. 

This is Mrs. Chheng's first loan from Kiva and she feels confident she will not make a late payment on any of this loan.

loans.use: to fix her present house partially and rebuild a bigger room for her two daughters.

loans.name: Déguène

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui tient une table sous l'arbre à palabre de son village.Elle y vend des produits alimentaire comme le mil, l'arachide.Elle sert également du café"touba" aux passants.Avec les modestes bénéfices qu'elle tire de son commerce, elle parvient à subvenir à certains besoins vestimentaires de ses enfants et à améliorer leur alimentation. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter des arachides, du mil, du haricot et 5 sacs de café touba. Son ambition est de louer une cantine au marché central.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married woman who has a booth under the village’s baobab tree where she sells food products such as millet and groundnuts. She also serves Touba coffee to the passersby. The modest revenue earned from this activity allows her to provide for some of her children’s needs with respect to food and clothing. 

In order to increase her working capital, she is seeking a loan of 100,000F to buy groundnuts, millet, beans, and five bags of Touba coffee. Her goal is to lease a stall at the central market.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, millet, beans and Touba coffee

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. В этой области она 17 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения подарков, скатертей, посуды и канцелярских товаров.
texts.en: Zebiniso  has a retail business. She keeps a general store. She has been in this field for 17 years. She is taking out a loan to buy gift items, tableclothes, dishes and stationery.

loans.use: to buy gift items, tableclothes, dishes and stationery.

loans.name: Callen

texts.en: Callen, 38, is a widow with one child. She describes herself as patient and a woman with morals. She sells food, especially french fries, in a busy place for the last two years. Her business faces the problem of the increased price of ingredients. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase potatoes to be used for making french fries. In the future, Callen hopes to run a big hotel.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for making fries.

loans.name: Tula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tula; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de accesorios y baterías para celulares, ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender accesorios y baterías para celulares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios y baterías para celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the Cachimayo district which belongs to the Anta province in the department of Cusco.

Señora Tula is the borrower; she is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling cellphone accessories and batteries. She works as a traveling vendor from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. By means of this business, Tula takes care of her children. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell cellphone accessories and batteries. She requested this loan to purchase accessories and batteries for cellphones.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase cellphone accessories and batteries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan wants to buy feeds and iron sheets for her dairy goats.

loans.name: Shokir

texts.en: Shokir has three children. His wife is a housewife. He rents a mini- shop to produce knitted garments. There are five women in his workshop. All of them have big families. Two of these women are also receiving loans from MicroInvest.  They produce different kind of cardigans, vests, sweaters and pullovers. Their goal is to develop their production,  to improve the quality of their products and, as a result, to increase the number of clients. To obtain better quality it is necessary to buy new equipment and high quality raw materials. After the number of clients increase, Shokir would like to hire more assistants in his shop.

loans.use: Production of knitted garments

loans.name: Ijang Rose

texts.en:
42-year-old Rose is a widow and a mother of seven children. After the death of her husband, she was left alone to take care of all seven children. Rose has been a long-time pig farmer and has attended a good number of training sessions on pig farming and poultry. Her previous loans from GHAPE were invested in agriculture and the profit she got from the activity was used to pay her children’s school fees, and part equally went to pay for one of them who is learning a trade. The manure she gets from her poultry and pig farm is used for crop cultivation, and the surplus is sold to other members of the community, thereby increasing food production. Due to increased demand from the local public, there is need for her to increase her production. 
With a loan of $600, Rose wants to buy 4 more piglets, 50 week-old chicks, 20 bags of pig and fowl feed, and equally cultivate more land.
She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: Pig farming, Poultry, and crop cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of her clothing business

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: My husband and I work hard to provide for our four children. We work side-by-side selling fruits and vegetables. While he has a fruit cart, I sell ginger and garlic. We buy our stock from the wholesale market and make a small profit selling it in a busy up-scale area. However, at the end of the day this is not enough to sustain our family of six. We are hoping to expand our business and thereby increase our income by introducing more vegetables. We need a loan of $325.

loans.use: To expand our vegetable business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a larger freezer

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Chanthou (age 32) was married in 1996 and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She is currently in the business of weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1988 and began her silk production in the same year. She lives with her mother who is currently weaving silk too. She did not even finish primary school. Her husband has been working in a brick kiln since 1988. He has not finished primary school either. Two of Chanthou’s children are studying at primary school in the village and the youngest one is at home.

Chanthou has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times already. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of $550. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Silomiga

texts.en: Silomiga is a 22-year-old mother with one child who stays at home during the day to work in her vegetable garden, which is her family's sole means of support.  She has applied for a $300 loan to buy chemicals and tools to use in her garden, and also to buy different types of vegetable seeds to plant. Silomiga sells her produce to shops in her village during the week, and in the town market on weekends. She earns about $38 a day during the week and more on weekends, but believes she can increase her income by buying the right tools, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools to use in a vegetable garden

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata had to find a way to support her two small children when her husband died 30 years ago. She started working at a stand at the market but had to leave it because she could not take care of her children. Hence, the idea to set up a small store out of her home was born.

Thanks to this business she has been able to provide a good education for her children and to build a house that was previously made of adobe.

Now that her children are grown, Fortunata works to support herself and to pay her household expenses. This is the reason she needs the loan to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando falleció su esposo hace 30 años, Fortunata tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus dos pequeños hijos. Comenzó a trabajar en un puesto del mercado, pero lo dejó al no poder cuidar a sus hijos. Fue así como nació la idea de poner una tienda en casa.

Gracias a este negocio, pudo darles una buena educación a sus hijos y construir su casa que antes era de adobe.

Ahora que sus hijos están grandes, Fortunata trabaja para poder mantenerse y pagar los gastos de la casa. Es por esto que desea surtir más su tienda.

loans.use: Expand and stock her store

loans.name: Wakimese D(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to boost business. Margret is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a hair dresser. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business.

Margret is joined in her small group by Madina N., Teo M., Rose N., and Brendah N.. Madina N. has a business running a market stall and wants to add stock. Teo M. is currently operating a poultry keeping business and wants a loan to purchase more chicks and feed. Rose N. operates a business selling matooke and wants to start purchasing in bulk. Brendah N. is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina lives in the small Batey de Palavé community of San Cristobal. She’s the proud mother of a son who is in his twenties.

Miguelina owns and operates a cafeteria within her house. The entrepreneur explains that the cafeteria is her family’s main source of income. She would like to boost her business. Miguelina wants to increase her sales volume so as to put aside money for her son’s studies.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy various goods to supply her cafeteria.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco G. currently owns a business making and selling bricks in the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. He does this with much effort, making bricks for use in construction to sell them in that sector of the municipality.

Currently, his business is facing the immediate need for materials for the production of the bricks. For this reason, Mr. G. seeks support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow him to purchase these materials and continue to run his brick business from his home in Villanueva.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Juan Francisco G. actualmente es dueño de un negocio de elaboración y venta de tejas ubicado en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a esta labor con mucho esfuerzo elaborando las tejas para construcción para ofrecerlas en el sector de ubicación en el municipio.

Actualmente la necesidad que este negocio atraviesa es la pronta inversión en los materiales para la elaboración de las tejas. Es por este motivo que el señor G. busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita la compra de estos materiales y así proseguir con su negocio de tejas en su localidad de habitación en Villanueva.

loans.use: Purchase material to make bricks.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en: Jumagul S. lives in the Asht region and she is married with three children. She has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but has showed herself to be a serious client. She is engaged in the family business of livestock. She works also works on a collective farm. Mrs. S. dreams of buying a pedigree bull to increase her livestock. So she is applying with KIVA with the request of financial support for her business's development with a loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months. Mrs. S. thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Jumagul would like to buy a pedigree bull to breed.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is married, and has two children. Both children currently attend school. Augustina sells smoked fish in her village, where she has many loyal customers, who purchase the fish or soup, popularly known as Light Soup in Ghana. Augustina would like a loan to restock and improve her business, as well as continue to finance her children’s education. Augustina would like to keep her prices set and avoid raising them, but the only way she can do this is with more capital.

Augustina is also a member of a group called Isaiah. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of smoked fish

loans.name: Tamasha's Warumi Group

texts.en:
Tamasha is a single woman with two children aged twelve and five years old. She also cares for someone who is 70 years old. She has owned a food vending store since 2002. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Tamasha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Grocery Store Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. Sharif and lives a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. Nasreen baji has been living in this city for the last 15 years. She is the mother of six children: one son and five daughters. Her son is a daily wage labor. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasreen baji's husband runs a grocery shop, with experience of 10 years. Nasreen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her husband's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sabra baji wants a loan to buy more chickens to resell. Sakina baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine. Ansar baji wants a loan to buy goats to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for the grocery shop

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita Osarinwian is a tailor. She also sells tailoring materials like zippers, landings, needles and tailoring designs. She learned how to sew clothes from a friend. Rita is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. Her eldest child is a boy and he is in a private secondary school. Rita has a store in Oba market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of $875 to buy more tailoring materials and a sewing machine. Rita makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials for sale and one sewing machine

loans.name: Mrs. Uon Khoeurn's Group

texts.en:
